Registry System Testing - Test Specifications

Version 3.0.176

Last Updated: 2023-12-07

GDS Technical Services, Internet Corporation for Assigned Names and Numbers (ICANN)

1. Table of Contents

  1. Table of Contents
  2. Preamble
    1. Test plans
    2. Test suites
    3. Test cases
      1. Input parameters
      2. Test results
      3. General pass/fail criteria
      4. Error severity levels
      5. Common errors
    4. Key acronyms and terms
  3. Test Plans
    1. Pre-Delegation Test
    2. RSP Change Test
    3. DNS RSP Change Test
    4. IDN Test
    5. SRS Gateway Test
    6. Main RSP Evaluation Test
    7. DNS RSP Evaluation Test
    8. DNSSEC RSP Evaluation Test
    9. SRS Gateway RSP Evaluation Test
  4. Test Suites
    1. Authoritative DNS Service
    2. DNS Security Extensions (DNSSEC)
    3. Registration Data Access Protocol (RDAP)
    4. Extensible Provisioning Protocol (EPP)
    5. Registry Data Escrow (RDE)
    6. Internationalized Domain Names (IDN)
    7. SRS Gateway
    8. DNSSEC Operations
    9. Minimum Rights Protection Mechanisms (RPMs)
    10. Standard Integration Test
  5. Resources
    1. epp.clientACL
    2. epp.clientCertificate
    3. epp.tlsCertificateStore
    4. integration.rdeSFTPACL
    5. integration.rdeSFTPPublicKey
    6. rde.encryptionKey
  6. Test Cases
    1. dns-address01 - Name server address must be globally routable
    2. dns-address02 - Reverse DNS entry exists for name server IP address
    3. dns-address03 - Reverse DNS entry matches name server name
    4. dns-connectivity01 - UDP connectivity to name servers
    5. dns-connectivity02 - TCP connectivity to name servers
    6. dns-connectivity03 - AS Diversity
    7. dns-connectivity04 - IP Prefix Diversity
    8. dns-consistency01 - SOA serial number consistency
    9. dns-consistency02 - SOA RNAME consistency
    10. dns-consistency03 - SOA timers consistency
    11. dns-consistency04 - Name server NS consistency
    12. dns-consistency05 - Consistency between glue and authoritative data
    13. dns-consistency06 - SOA MNAME consistency
    14. dns-delegation01 - Minimum number of name servers
    15. dns-delegation02 - Name servers must have distinct IP addresses
    16. dns-delegation03 - No truncation of referrals
    17. dns-delegation04 - Name server is authoritative
    18. dns-delegation05 - Name server must not point at CNAME alias
    19. dns-delegation06 - Existence of SOA
    20. dns-delegation07 - Parent glue name records present in child
    21. dns-nameserver01 - A name server should not be a recursor
    22. dns-nameserver02 - Test of EDNS0 support
    23. dns-nameserver03 - Test availability of zone transfer (AXFR)
    24. dns-nameserver04 - Same source address
    25. dns-nameserver05 - Behaviour against AAAA query
    26. dns-nameserver06 - NS can be resolved
    27. dns-nameserver07 - To check whether authoritative name servers return an upward referral
    28. dns-nameserver08 - Testing QNAME case insensitivity
    29. dns-nameserver09 - Testing QNAME case sensitivity
    30. dns-nameserver10 - Test for undefined EDNS version
    31. dns-nameserver11 - Test for unknown EDNS OPTION-CODE
    32. dns-nameserver12 - Test for unknown EDNS flags
    33. dns-nameserver13 - Test for truncated response on EDNS query
    34. dns-nameserver14 - Test for unknown version with unknown OPTION-CODE
    35. dns-nameserver15 - Checking for revealed software version
    36. dns-syntax04 - The NS name must have a valid domain/hostname
    37. dns-syntax05 - Misuse of '@' character in the SOA RNAME field
    38. dns-syntax06 - No illegal characters in the SOA RNAME field
    39. dns-syntax07 - No illegal characters in the SOA MNAME field
    40. dns-zone01 - Fully qualified master nameserver in SOA
    41. dns-zone02 - SOA 'refresh' minimum value
    42. dns-zone03 - SOA 'retry' lower than 'refresh'
    43. dns-zone04 - SOA 'retry' at least 1 hour
    44. dns-zone05 - SOA 'expire' minimum value
    45. dns-zone06 - SOA 'minimum' maximum value
    46. dns-zone07 - SOA master is not an alias
    47. dns-zone10 - No multiple SOA records
    48. dnssec-01 - Legal values for the DS hash digest algorithm
    49. dnssec-02 - DS must match a valid DNSKEY in the child zone
    50. dnssec-03 - Check for too many NSEC3 iterations
    51. dnssec-04 - Check for too short or too long RRSIG lifetimes
    52. dnssec-05 - Check for invalid DNSKEY algorithms
    53. dnssec-06 - Verify DNSSEC additional processing
    54. dnssec-08 - Valid RRSIG for DNSKEY
    55. dnssec-09 - RRSIG(SOA) must be valid and created by a valid DNSKEY
    56. dnssec-10 - Zone contains NSEC or NSEC3 records
    57. dnssec-12 - Test for DNSSEC Algorithm Completeness
    58. dnssec-13 - All DNSKEY algorithms used to sign the zone
    59. dnssec-14 - Check for valid RSA DNSKEY key size
    60. dnssec-15 - Existence of CDS and CDNSKEY
    61. dnssec-16 - Validate CDS
    62. dnssec-17 - Validate CDNSKEY
    63. dnssec-18 - Validate trust from DS to CDS and CDNSKEY
    64. dnssec-91 - Permitted signing algorithms
    65. dnssec-92 - Permitted DS record hash algorithm(s)
    66. dnssecOps01-ZSKRollover - ZSK rollover
    67. dnssecOps02-KSKRollover - KSK rollover
    68. dnssecOps03-AlgorithmRollover - algorithm rollover
    69. epp-01 - EPP server **MUST** have at least one A record
    70. epp-02 - EPP server **MUST** have at least one AAAA record
    71. epp-03 - All IP addresses **MUST** accept TCP connections on port 700
    72. epp-04 - All service ports support TLSv1.2 or higher
    73. epp-05 - All service ports **MUST NOT** support TLSv1.1 or earlier
    74. epp-06 - All service ports **MUST** offer a valid certificate issued by a trusted CA
    75. epp-07 - TLS certificate **MUST** be valid
    76. epp-08 - TLS certificate **MUST** be valid for the server name
    77. epp-09 - All service ports **MUST** send a <greeting> frame after successful connection
    78. epp-10 - All server responses **MUST** validate against the XML schema
    79. epp-11 - <svID> element in the <greeting> **MUST** be valid
    80. epp-12 - <svDate> element in the <greeting> **MUST** be valid
    81. epp-13 - <version> element in the <greeting> **MUST** be valid
    82. epp-14 - <lang> element(s) in the <greeting> **MUST** be valid
    83. epp-15 - <objURI> element(s) in the <greeting> **MUST** be valid for the registry type
    84. epp-16 - <extURI> element(s) in the <greeting> **MUST** be valid
    85. epp-17 - <login> command **MUST** return a successful response
    86. epp-18 - <hello> command **MUST** return a <greeting>
    87. epp-19 - domain <check> command test
    88. epp-22 - host <check> command test (if applicable)
    89. epp-23 - contact <check> command test (if applicable for the registry type)
    90. epp-24 - contact <create> command test (if applicable for the registry type)
    91. epp-25 - contact <info> command test (if applicable for the registry type)
    92. epp-26 - contact <update> command test (if applicable for the registry type)
    93. epp-27 - contact <delete> command test (if applicable for the registry type)
    94. epp-28 - host <create> command test (if applicable)
    95. epp-29 - host <info> command test (if applicable)
    96. epp-30 - (intentionally ommitted)
    97. epp-31 - host <update> command test (if applicable)
    98. epp-31a - host rename test (if applicable)
    99. epp-31b - host <delete> command test (if applicable)
    100. epp-32 - domain <create> command test
    101. epp-33 - domain <info> command test
    102. epp-34 - domain <update> command test
    103. epp-35 - domain <renew> command test
    104. epp-36 - domain <transfer> command test
    105. epp-37 - domain <delete> command test
    106. epp-39 - domain restore test (if applicable)
    107. idn-01 - Label validation test
    108. idn-02 - Level 1 variant handling test
    109. idn-03 - Level 2 variant handling test
    110. idn-04 - Level 3 variant handling test
    111. integration-01 - EPP -> RDAP Integration Test
    112. integration-02 - EPP -> DNS Integration Test
    113. integration-03 - EPP -> RDE Integration Test
    114. minimumRPMs-01 - Sunrise domain <check> command test
    115. minimumRPMs-02 - Claims <check> command test
    116. minimumRPMs-03 - Trademark <check> command test
    117. minimumRPMs-04 - Sunrise domain/launch application <create> command test
    118. minimumRPMs-05 - Sunrise launch application <info> command test
    119. minimumRPMs-06 - Trademark claims domain <create> command test
    120. minimumRPMs-07 - LORDN submission test
    121. rdap-01-domainCaseFoldingValidation - Domain label case folding validation
    122. rdap-02-domainNameValidation - Domain Name validation
    123. rdap-03-ipv4Validation - IPv4 address validation
    124. rdap-04-ipv6Validation - IPv6 address validation
    125. rdap-05-stdRdapAsEventActorValidation - asEventActor Validation
    126. rdap-06-stdRdapConformanceValidation - RDAP Conformance validation
    127. rdap-07-stdRdapDomainLookupValidation - Domain Lookup Validation
    128. rdap-08-stdRdapEntitiesValidation - Entities validation
    129. rdap-09-stdRdapEntityLookupValidation - Entity lookup validation
    130. rdap-10-stdRdapErrorResponseBodyValidation - Error Response Body
    131. rdap-11-stdRdapEventsValidation - Events Validation
    132. rdap-12-stdRdapHelpValidation - Help validation
    133. rdap-13-stdRdapIpAddressesValidation - IP Addresses Validation
    134. rdap-14-stdRdapLanguageIdentifierValidation - Language Identifier Validation
    135. rdap-15-stdRdapLdhNameValidation - LDH name
    136. rdap-16-stdRdapLinksValidation - Links validation
    137. rdap-17-stdRdapNameserverLookupValidation - Nameserver lookup validation
    138. rdap-18-stdRdapNameserversSearchValidation - RFC7159RDAP_RFCsNameservers search validation
    139. rdap-19-stdRdapNoticesRemarksValidation - Notices and Remarks Validation
    140. rdap-20-stdRdapPort43WhoisServerValidation - Port 43 WHOIS Server
    141. rdap-21-stdRdapPublicIdsValidation - Public IDs validation
    142. rdap-22-stdRdapRolesValidation - Roles validation
    143. rdap-23-stdRdapSecureDnsValidation - Secure DNS validation
    144. rdap-24-stdRdapStatusValidation - Status validation
    145. rdap-25-stdRdapUnicodeNameValidation - RFC7159RDAP_RFCsIDNA_RFCsUnicode name
    146. rdap-26-stdRdapVariantsValidation - Variants validation
    147. rdap-27-webUriValidation - Web URI validation
    148. rde-01 - validate deposit filename format
    149. rde-02 - validate signature over deposit file
    150. rde-03 - decrypt deposit file(s)
    151. rde-04 - validate XML/CSV
    152. rde-05 - validate object types
    153. rde-06 - validate object counts
    154. rde-07 - validate domain objects
    155. rde-08 - validate host objects (if applicable)
    156. rde-09 - validate contact objects (if applicable)
    157. rde-10 - validate registrar objects
    158. rde-11 - validate IDN table objects (if applicable)
    159. rde-12 - validate NNDN objects
    160. rde-13 - validate EPP parameters object
    161. rde-14 - validate policy object (if applicable)
    162. srsgw-01 - IPv4 and IPv6 connectivity
    163. srsgw-02 - Host <create> synchronization (if applicable)
    164. srsgw-03 - Contact <create> synchronization (if applicable)
    165. srsgw-04 - Domain <create> synchronization
    166. srsgw-05 - Domain <renew> synchronisation
    167. srsgw-06 - Domain <transfer> synchronisation
    168. srsgw-07 - Domain <transfer> approval synchronisation
    169. srsgw-08 - Domain <delete> synchronisation
    170. srsgw-09 - Host <update> synchronization (if applicable)
    171. srsgw-10 - Host <delete> synchronization (if applicable)
    172. srsgw-11 - Contact <update> synchronization (if applicable)
    173. srsgw-12 - Contact <delete> synchronization (if applicable)
    174. srsgw-13 - Domain RDAP synchronization
    175. srsgw-14 - Nameserver RDAP synchronization
    176. srsgw-15 - Registrar RDAP synchronization
  7. Input Parameters
    1. dns.nameservers (object)
    2. dnssec.dsRecords (object)
    3. dnssecOps.algorithmRolloverZone (string)
    4. dnssecOps.csk (boolean)
    5. dnssecOps.kskRolloverZone (string)
    6. dnssecOps.zskRolloverZone (string)
    7. epp.clid (string)
    8. epp.hostModel (string)
    9. epp.hostName (string)
    10. epp.pwd (string)
    11. epp.registeredContacts (array)
    12. epp.registeredNames (array)
    13. epp.registeredNameservers (array)
    14. epp.restoreReportRequired (boolean)
    15. epp.transferClid (string)
    16. epp.transferPwd (string)
    17. general.gracePeriodsSupported (boolean)
    18. general.minimalPublicDataSet (boolean)
    19. general.sunriseModels (string)
    20. integration.rdeSFTPDirectory (string)
    21. integration.rdeSFTPHostname (string)
    22. integration.rdeSFTPUsername (string)
    23. integration.rriACL (array)
    24. rdap.baseURLs (object)
    25. rdap.testDomains (object)
    26. rdap.testEntities (object)
    27. rdap.testNameservers (object)
    28. rde.depositFile (file)
    29. rde.publicKey (file)
    30. rde.signatureFile (file)
    31. srsgw.eppClid (string)
    32. srsgw.eppHostName (string)
    33. srsgw.eppPwd (string)
    34. srsgw.eppTransferClid (string)
    35. srsgw.eppTransferPwd (string)
    36. srsgw.rdapBaseURLs (object)
  8. Errors
    1. DNSSEC_DNS_QUERY_ERROR (ERROR)
    2. DNSSEC_INVALID_DIGEST_ALGORITHM (ERROR)
    3. DNSSEC_INVALID_SIGNING_ALGORITHM (ERROR)
    4. EPP_CONNECT_ERROR (ERROR)
    5. EPP_GENERIC_COMMAND_ERROR (ERROR)
    6. EPP_LOGIN_ERROR (ERROR)
    7. EPP_SCHEMA_VALIDATION_ERROR (ERROR)
    8. EPP_SUNRISE_AVAILABILITY_CHECK_INVALID_RESULT (ERROR)
    9. ZM_AAAA_BAD_RDATA (ERROR)
    10. ZM_AAAA_QUERY_DROPPED (ERROR)
    11. ZM_AAAA_UNEXPECTED_RCODE (ERROR)
    12. ZM_AAAA_WELL_PROCESSED (INFO)
    13. ZM_ADDRESSES_MATCH (INFO)
    14. ZM_ALGORITHM_DEPRECATED (ERROR)
    15. ZM_ALGORITHM_NOT_RECOMMENDED (WARNING)
    16. ZM_ALGORITHM_NOT_ZONE_SIGN (ERROR)
    17. ZM_ALGORITHM_OK (INFO)
    18. ZM_ALGORITHM_PRIVATE (ERROR)
    19. ZM_ALGORITHM_RESERVED (ERROR)
    20. ZM_ALGORITHM_UNASSIGNED (ERROR)

    22. ZM_BREAKS_ON_EDNS (ERROR)
    23. ZM_CHILD_DISTINCT_NS_IP (INFO)
    24. ZM_CHILD_NS_FAILED (ERROR)
    25. ZM_CHILD_NS_SAME_IP (ERROR)
    26. ZM_CHILD_ZONE_LAME (ERROR)
    27. ZM_CN01_IPV4_DISABLED (NOTICE)
    28. ZM_CN01_IPV6_DISABLED (NOTICE)
    29. ZM_CN01_MISSING_NS_RECORD_UDP (ERROR)

    35. ZM_CN01_SOA_RECORD_NOT_AA_UDP (ERROR)

    37. ZM_CN01_UNEXPECTED_RCODE_SOA_QUERY_UDP (ERROR)

    39. ZM_CN01_WRONG_SOA_RECORD_UDP (ERROR)

    41. ZM_CN02_MISSING_SOA_RECORD_TCP (ERROR)
    42. ZM_CN02_NO_RESPONSE_NS_QUERY_TCP (ERROR)

    46. ZM_CN02_SOA_RECORD_NOT_AA_TCP (ERROR)

    48. ZM_CN02_UNEXPECTED_RCODE_SOA_QUERY_TCP (ERROR)

    50. ZM_CN02_WRONG_SOA_RECORD_TCP (ERROR)

    160. ZM_MULTIPLE_SOA_MNAMES (ERROR)
    161. ZM_MULTIPLE_SOA_RNAMES (ERROR)
    162. ZM_MULTIPLE_SOA_SERIALS (ERROR)
    163. ZM_MULTIPLE_SOA_SERIALS_OK (NOTICE)
    164. ZM_MULTIPLE_SOA_TIME_PARAMETER_SET (ERROR)
    165. ZM_N10_EDNS_RESPONSE_ERROR (ERROR)
    166. ZM_N10_NO_RESPONSE_EDNS1_QUERY (ERROR)
    167. ZM_N10_UNEXPECTED_RCODE (ERROR)
    168. ZM_N11_NO_EDNS (ERROR)
    169. ZM_N11_NO_RESPONSE (ERROR)
    170. ZM_N11_RETURNS_UNKNOWN_OPTION_CODE (ERROR)
    171. ZM_N11_UNEXPECTED_ANSWER_SECTION (ERROR)
    172. ZM_N11_UNEXPECTED_RCODE (ERROR)
    173. ZM_N11_UNSET_AA (ERROR)
    174. ZM_N15_NO_VERSION (INFO)
    175. ZM_N15_SOFTWARE_VERSION (INFO)
    176. ZM_NOT_ENOUGH_IPV4_NS_CHILD (ERROR)
    177. ZM_NOT_ENOUGH_IPV4_NS_DEL (ERROR)
    178. ZM_NOT_ENOUGH_IPV6_NS_CHILD (ERROR)
    179. ZM_NOT_ENOUGH_IPV6_NS_DEL (ERROR)
    180. ZM_NOT_ENOUGH_NS_CHILD (ERROR)
    181. ZM_NOT_ENOUGH_NS_DEL (ERROR)
    182. ZM_NO_EDNS_SUPPORT (ERROR)
    183. ZM_NO_IPV4_NS_CHILD (ERROR)
    184. ZM_NO_IPV4_NS_DEL (ERROR)
    185. ZM_NO_IPV6_NS_CHILD (ERROR)
    186. ZM_NO_IPV6_NS_DEL (ERROR)
    187. ZM_NO_NS_CNAME (INFO)
    188. ZM_NO_RECURSOR (INFO)

    190. ZM_NO_RESPONSE_DNSKEY (ERROR)

    213. ZM_UNKNOWN_OPTION_CODE (ERROR)
    214. ZM_UNSUPPORTED_EDNS_VER (ERROR)
    215. ZM_WRONG_SOA (ERROR)
    216. ZM_Z01_MNAME_HAS_LOCALHOST_ADDR (WARNING)
    217. ZM_Z01_MNAME_IS_DOT (NOTICE)
    218. ZM_Z01_MNAME_IS_LOCALHOST (WARNING)
    219. ZM_Z01_MNAME_MISSING_SOA_RECORD (WARNING)
    220. ZM_Z01_MNAME_NOT_AUTHORITATIVE (WARNING)
    221. ZM_Z01_MNAME_NOT_IN_NS_LIST (INFO)
    222. ZM_Z01_MNAME_NOT_MASTER (WARNING)
    223. ZM_Z01_MNAME_NOT_RESOLVE (WARNING)
    224. ZM_Z01_MNAME_NO_RESPONSE (WARNING)
    225. ZM_Z01_MNAME_UNEXPECTED_RCODE (WARNING)
    226. ZM_Z_FLAGS_NOTCLEAR (ERROR)
  9. About this document
● ━━
● ━━
● ━━

2. Preamble

This file describes each test plan, suite and case in the RST system, as well as the input parameters required for each, relevant resources, any inter-case dependencies, and the errors that might occur during testing.

The key words “MUST”, “MUST NOT”, “REQUIRED”, “SHALL”, “SHALL NOT”, “SHOULD”, “SHOULD NOT”, “RECOMMENDED”, “NOT RECOMMENDED”, “MAY”, and “OPTIONAL” in this document are to be interpreted as described in RFC 2119 when, and only when, they appear in all capitals, as shown here.

2.1. Test plans

An individual Test Plan addresses a particular scenario (for example, RSP evaluation or Pre-Delegation Testing). Each plan consists of one or more test suites, which in turn include one or more test cases.

2.2. Test suites

A Test Suite is a collection of test cases with a common theme or subject matter, for example, Authoritative DNS or Registry Data Escrow.

2.3. Test cases

A Test Case describes a process for determining the conformance or acceptability of a certain element of the system.

A test case consists of a test procedure which accepts zero or more input parameters, and generates one or more test results.

2.3.1. Input parameters

All test cases require some information about the subject of the test, for example, service hostnames, credentials, and functional parameters. These input parameters may be shared across multiple test cases.

2.3.2. Test results

Test cases will generate one or more test results. Test results indicate the outcome of the test and other relevant information.

2.3.3. General pass/fail criteria

In general, for a test to pass, all the test cases specified in the test suite(s) for the test plan MUST pass: if any fail, then the test as a whole will fail.

A test case will fail if it produces one or more errors with the ERROR or CRITICAL severities.

2.3.4. Error severity levels

  1. INFO - an informational message.
  2. NOTICE - a normal but significant condition.
  3. WARNING - an issue which does not prevent the test from passing, but which may benefit from further investigation.
  4. ERROR - an issue which prevents the test from passing, but does not prevent the test from continuing. A test may produce multiple ERROR results.
  5. CRITICAL - an issue which prevents the test from continuing any further. A test will only produce a single CRITICAL result and it will always be the last result in the log.

2.3.5. Common errors

For each test case, various errors and critical errors are defined which will be used to signal why that the case might have failed.

In addition to these, there are a number of errors which any test case may produce, which are:

  • [TBA]

2.4. Key acronyms and terms

RST
Registry System Testing. This system.
PDT
Pre-Delegation Test. A test carried out prior to the delegation of a new TLD into the DNS root zone.
RSP
Registry Service Provider. A specialist provider of critical registry services.
DNS
Domain Name System. The internet’s system of globally unique identifiers.
TLD
Top-level domain. The highest level of the DNS namespace hierarchy.
gTLD
generic top-level domain.
DNSSEC
DNS Security Extensions. DNSSEC is described in BCP 237.
EPP
Extensible Provisioning Protocol. The protocol used by registrars to create and manage domain name registrations in an SRS. EPP is defined in STD 69.
SRS
Shared Registry System. A TLD registry in which registrations are managed by one or more registrars, using EPP.
RDDS
Registration Data Directory Services. A service to provide access to data about domain registrations to third parties.
RDAP
Registration Data Access Protocol. The protocol used to deliver the RDDS. RDAP is defined in STD 95.
RDE
Registry Data Escrow. A system whereby the registration data stored in a Shared Registry System is backed up to a trusted third party. RDE is defined in RFC 8909 and RFC 9022.
IDN
Internationalized Domain Name. A domain name that contains characters not in the ASCII character set. The technical specification for IDNs may be found in RFC 5890. All gTLDs must comply with ICANN’s IDN Guidelines.
LGR
Label Generation Ruleset. The rules by which IDNs are validated. LGRs are described in RFC 7940.
RO
Registry Operator. The entity to which ICANN has granted the right to operate a gTLD.
RA
Registry Agreement. The contract between a Registry Operator and ICANN. The base Registry Agreement may be reviewed at https://www.icann.org/en/registry-agreements/base-agreement.
KSK
Key Signing Key. A cryptographic key which acts as the Secure Entry Point for a DNS zone, and which signs a DNS zone’s ZSKs. A digest of this key is published in the parent zone (ie. the root zone for a TLD).
ZSK
Zone Signing Key. A cryptographic key which signs a DNS zone’s resource records.
CSK
Combined Signing Key. A cryptographic key used as both a KSK and a ZSK.
RPMs
Rights Protection Mechanisms, intended to discourage or prevent registration of domain names that violate or abuse another party’s legal rights. These MUST include (but are not limited to): (1) Sunrise Periods, and (2) Trademark Claims Periods (see Specification 7 of the Registry Agreement).
TMCH
Trademark Clearinghouse. The system established by ICANN to maintain a database of validated and registered trademarks which is used to enforce Rights Protection Mechanisms (RPMs) in gTLDs. The functional specifications of the TMCH are defined in RFC 9361.
SLA
Service Level Agreement. The registry performance specifications laid out in Specification 10 of the Registry Agreement.
RRI
Registration Reporting Interfaces. The interfaces provided by ICANN to contracted parties including Registry Operators to fulfill and monitor their applicable reporting requirements, including per-registrar transaction reports; registry functions activity reports; data escrow deposits reports and data escrow deposits notifications. For registry operators, the relevant interfaces are defined in draft-lozano-icann-registry-interfaces.

3. Test Plans

3.1. Pre-Delegation Test

3.1.1. Description

The purpose of the Pre-Delegation Test is to verify that the applicant has met its commitment to establish registry operations in accordance with the technical and operational criteria described in the gTLD Applicant Guidebook (AGB). Each applicant will be required to complete PDT as a prerequisite to delegation into the root zone.

The Pre-Delegation Test covers all critical registry services and IDNs, and therefore uses all test suites.

Pass/fail criteria

As with all other test plans, for this test to pass, all the listed test cases MUST pass: if any fail, then the test as a whole will fail.

3.1.2. Plan ID

The following Test Plan ID may be used with the RST API:

StandardPreDelegationTest

3.1.3. Test suites

This plan uses the following test suites:

  1. Authoritative DNS Service
  2. DNS Security Extensions (DNSSEC)
  3. Registration Data Access Protocol (RDAP)
  4. Extensible Provisioning Protocol (EPP)
  5. Registry Data Escrow (RDE)
  6. Internationalized Domain Names (IDN)
  7. Standard Integration Test

3.1.4. Resources

The following resources may be required to prepare for this test plan:

  • epp.clientACL
  • epp.clientCertificate
  • epp.tlsCertificateStore
  • integration.rdeSFTPACL
  • integration.rdeSFTPPublicKey
  • rde.encryptionKey

This test plan may produce the following errors:

  • DNSSEC_DNS_QUERY_ERROR (ERROR)

3.1.6. Input parameters

This plan requires the following input parameters:

  • dns.nameservers (object)
  • dnssec.dsRecords (object)
  • epp.clid (string)
  • epp.hostModel (string)
  • epp.hostName (string)
  • epp.pwd (string)
  • epp.registeredContacts (array)
  • epp.registeredNames (array)
  • epp.registeredNameservers (array)
  • epp.restoreReportRequired (boolean)
  • epp.transferClid (string)
  • epp.transferPwd (string)
  • general.gracePeriodsSupported (boolean)
  • general.minimalPublicDataSet (boolean)
  • integration.rdeSFTPDirectory (string)
  • integration.rdeSFTPHostname (string)
  • integration.rdeSFTPUsername (string)
  • integration.rriACL (array)
  • rdap.baseURLs (object)
  • rdap.testDomains (object)
  • rdap.testEntities (object)
  • rdap.testNameservers (object)
  • rde.depositFile (file)
  • rde.publicKey (file)
  • rde.signatureFile (file)

3.1.7. Required files

  • rde.depositFile
  • rde.publicKey
  • rde.signatureFile

3.1.8. RST-API example

POST /test/987654/inputs HTTP/1.1
Content-Type: application/json
Content-Length: 1709

{
   "dns.nameservers" : {
      "example" : {
         "ns1.example.com" : [
            "192.168.53.1",
            "2001:DB8::53:1"
         ],
         "ns2.example.com" : [
            "192.168.53.2",
            "2001:DB8::53:2"
         ]
      }
   },
   "dnssec.dsRecords" : {
      "example" : [
         {
            "alg" : "8",
            "digest" : "E2D3...5766",
            "digestType" : "2",
            "keyTag" : "12345"
         }
      ]
   },
   "epp.clid" : "clid-01",
   "epp.hostModel" : "objects",
   "epp.hostName" : "epp.rsp.tech",
   "epp.pwd" : "foo2bar",
   "epp.registeredContacts" : [
      "abc123",
      "def321"
   ],
   "epp.registeredNames" : [
      "example.example1",
      "example.example2"
   ],
   "epp.registeredNameservers" : [
      "ns1.example.com",
      "ns2.example.org"
   ],
   "epp.restoreReportRequired" : false,
   "epp.transferClid" : "clid-02",
   "epp.transferPwd" : "foo3bar",
   "general.gracePeriodsSupported" : true,
   "general.minimalPublicDataSet" : true,
   "integration.rdeSFTPDirectory" : "/path/to/deposits",
   "integration.rdeSFTPHostname" : "sftp.rsp.tech",
   "integration.rdeSFTPUsername" : "icann",
   "integration.rriACL" : [
      "192.168.22.1",
      "2001:DB8::22:1"
   ],
   "rdap.baseURLs" : {
      "example" : "https://rdap.example.com/example/"
   },
   "rdap.testDomains" : {
      "example" : "example.example"
   },
   "rdap.testEntities" : {
      "example" : "9999"
   },
   "rdap.testNameservers" : {
      "example" : "ns1.example.com"
   },
   "rde.depositFile" : "example_20231004_FULL_S1_R0.ryde",
   "rde.publicKey" : "rsp-rde-signing-key.asc",
   "rde.signatureFile" : "example_20231004_FULL_S1_R0.sig"
}

3.1.9. Sequence diagram

3.2. RSP Change Test

3.2.1. Description

A Registry Operator may apply to ICANN to change a Material Subcontracting Arrangement (MSA) and appoint a new Registry Services Provider. Before this change can be approved, the new RSP MUST complete Registry System Testing to ensure their systems comply with the technical and operational requirements of the Registry Agreement.

The RSP Change Test covers all critical registry services and IDNs, and therefore uses all test suites.

Pass/fail criteria

As with all other test plans, for this test to pass, all the listed test cases MUST pass: if any fail, then the test as a whole will fail.

3.2.2. Plan ID

The following Test Plan ID may be used with the RST API:

StandardRSPChangeTest

3.2.3. Test suites

This plan uses the following test suites:

  1. Authoritative DNS Service
  2. DNS Security Extensions (DNSSEC)
  3. Registration Data Access Protocol (RDAP)
  4. Extensible Provisioning Protocol (EPP)
  5. Registry Data Escrow (RDE)
  6. Internationalized Domain Names (IDN)
  7. Standard Integration Test

3.2.4. Resources

The following resources may be required to prepare for this test plan:

  • epp.clientACL
  • epp.clientCertificate
  • epp.tlsCertificateStore
  • integration.rdeSFTPACL
  • integration.rdeSFTPPublicKey
  • rde.encryptionKey

3.2.5. Errors

This test plan may produce the following errors:

  • DNSSEC_DNS_QUERY_ERROR (ERROR)
  • DNSSEC_INVALID_DIGEST_ALGORITHM (ERROR)
  • DNSSEC_INVALID_SIGNING_ALGORITHM (ERROR)
  • ZM_AAAA_BAD_RDATA (ERROR)
  • ZM_AAAA_QUERY_DROPPED (ERROR)
  • ZM_AAAA_UNEXPECTED_RCODE (ERROR)
  • ZM_AAAA_WELL_PROCESSED (INFO)
  • ZM_ADDRESSES_MATCH (INFO)
  • ZM_ALGORITHM_DEPRECATED (ERROR)
  • ZM_ALGORITHM_NOT_RECOMMENDED (WARNING)
  • ZM_ALGORITHM_NOT_ZONE_SIGN (ERROR)
  • ZM_ALGORITHM_OK (INFO)
  • ZM_ALGORITHM_PRIVATE (ERROR)
  • ZM_ALGORITHM_RESERVED (ERROR)
  • ZM_ALGORITHM_UNASSIGNED (ERROR)
  • ZM_A_UNEXPECTED_RCODE (ERROR)
  • ZM_BREAKS_ON_EDNS (ERROR)
  • ZM_CHILD_DISTINCT_NS_IP (INFO)
  • ZM_CHILD_NS_FAILED (ERROR)
  • ZM_CHILD_NS_SAME_IP (ERROR)
  • ZM_CHILD_ZONE_LAME (ERROR)
  • ZM_CN01_IPV4_DISABLED (NOTICE)
  • ZM_CN01_IPV6_DISABLED (NOTICE)

  • ZM_CN01_MISSING_SOA_RECORD_UDP (ERROR)

3.2.6. Input parameters

This plan requires the following input parameters:

  • dns.nameservers (object)
  • dnssec.dsRecords (object)
  • epp.clid (string)
  • epp.hostModel (string)
  • epp.hostName (string)
  • epp.pwd (string)
  • epp.registeredContacts (array)
  • epp.registeredNames (array)
  • epp.registeredNameservers (array)
  • epp.restoreReportRequired (boolean)
  • epp.transferClid (string)
  • epp.transferPwd (string)
  • general.gracePeriodsSupported (boolean)
  • general.minimalPublicDataSet (boolean)
  • integration.rdeSFTPDirectory (string)
  • integration.rdeSFTPHostname (string)
  • integration.rdeSFTPUsername (string)
  • integration.rriACL (array)
  • rdap.baseURLs (object)
  • rdap.testDomains (object)
  • rdap.testEntities (object)
  • rdap.testNameservers (object)
  • rde.depositFile (file)
  • rde.publicKey (file)
  • rde.signatureFile (file)

3.2.7. Required files

  • rde.depositFile
  • rde.publicKey
  • rde.signatureFile

3.2.8. RST-API example

POST /test/987654/inputs HTTP/1.1
Content-Type: application/json
Content-Length: 1709

{
   "dns.nameservers" : {
      "example" : {
         "ns1.example.com" : [
            "192.168.53.1",
            "2001:DB8::53:1"
         ],
         "ns2.example.com" : [
            "192.168.53.2",
            "2001:DB8::53:2"
         ]
      }
   },
   "dnssec.dsRecords" : {
      "example" : [
         {
            "alg" : "8",
            "digest" : "E2D3...5766",
            "digestType" : "2",
            "keyTag" : "12345"
         }
      ]
   },
   "epp.clid" : "clid-01",
   "epp.hostModel" : "objects",
   "epp.hostName" : "epp.rsp.tech",
   "epp.pwd" : "foo2bar",
   "epp.registeredContacts" : [
      "abc123",
      "def321"
   ],
   "epp.registeredNames" : [
      "example.example1",
      "example.example2"
   ],
   "epp.registeredNameservers" : [
      "ns1.example.com",
      "ns2.example.org"
   ],
   "epp.restoreReportRequired" : false,
   "epp.transferClid" : "clid-02",
   "epp.transferPwd" : "foo3bar",
   "general.gracePeriodsSupported" : true,
   "general.minimalPublicDataSet" : true,
   "integration.rdeSFTPDirectory" : "/path/to/deposits",
   "integration.rdeSFTPHostname" : "sftp.rsp.tech",
   "integration.rdeSFTPUsername" : "icann",
   "integration.rriACL" : [
      "192.168.22.1",
      "2001:DB8::22:1"
   ],
   "rdap.baseURLs" : {
      "example" : "https://rdap.example.com/example/"
   },
   "rdap.testDomains" : {
      "example" : "example.example"
   },
   "rdap.testEntities" : {
      "example" : "9999"
   },
   "rdap.testNameservers" : {
      "example" : "ns1.example.com"
   },
   "rde.depositFile" : "example_20231004_FULL_S1_R0.ryde",
   "rde.publicKey" : "rsp-rde-signing-key.asc",
   "rde.signatureFile" : "example_20231004_FULL_S1_R0.sig"
}

3.2.9. Sequence diagram

3.3. DNS RSP Change Test

3.3.1. Description

A Registry Operator may apply to ICANN to change a Material Subcontracting Arrangement (MSA) and appoint a new provider of authoritative DNS services instead of or in addition to any existing provider(s).

Before this change can be approved, the new DNS provider MUST complete testing to ensure their systems comply with the technical and operational requirements of the Registry Agreement.

The DNS RSP Change Test uses the DNS test suite only.

Pass/fail criteria

As with all other test plans, for this test to pass, all the listed test cases MUST pass: if any fail, then the test as a whole will fail.

3.3.2. Plan ID

The following Test Plan ID may be used with the RST API:

DNSRSPChangeTest

3.3.3. Test suites

This plan uses the following test suites:

  1. Authoritative DNS Service
  2. DNS Security Extensions (DNSSEC)

3.3.4. Resources

The following resources may be required to prepare for this test plan:

  • None specified.

3.3.5. Errors

This test plan may produce the following errors:

  • DNSSEC_DNS_QUERY_ERROR (ERROR)
  • DNSSEC_INVALID_DIGEST_ALGORITHM (ERROR)
  • DNSSEC_INVALID_SIGNING_ALGORITHM (ERROR)
  • ZM_AAAA_BAD_RDATA (ERROR)
  • ZM_AAAA_QUERY_DROPPED (ERROR)
  • ZM_AAAA_UNEXPECTED_RCODE (ERROR)
  • ZM_AAAA_WELL_PROCESSED (INFO)
  • ZM_ADDRESSES_MATCH (INFO)
  • ZM_ALGORITHM_DEPRECATED (ERROR)
  • ZM_ALGORITHM_NOT_RECOMMENDED (WARNING)
  • ZM_ALGORITHM_NOT_ZONE_SIGN (ERROR)
  • ZM_ALGORITHM_OK (INFO)
  • ZM_ALGORITHM_PRIVATE (ERROR)
  • ZM_ALGORITHM_RESERVED (ERROR)
  • ZM_ALGORITHM_UNASSIGNED (ERROR)
  • ZM_A_UNEXPECTED_RCODE (ERROR)
  • ZM_BREAKS_ON_EDNS (ERROR)
  • ZM_CHILD_DISTINCT_NS_IP (INFO)
  • ZM_CHILD_NS_FAILED (ERROR)
  • ZM_CHILD_NS_SAME_IP (ERROR)
  • ZM_CHILD_ZONE_LAME (ERROR)
  • ZM_CN01_IPV4_DISABLED (NOTICE)
  • ZM_CN01_IPV6_DISABLED (NOTICE)
  • ZM_CN01_MISSING_NS_RECORD_UDP (ERROR)
  • ZM_CN01_MISSING_SOA_RECORD_UDP (ERROR)
  • ZM_CN01_NO_RESPONSE_NS_QUERY_UDP (ERROR)
  • ZM_CN01_NO_RESPONSE_SOA_QUERY_UDP (ERROR)
  • ZM_CN01_NO_RESPONSE_UDP (ERROR)
  • ZM_CN01_NS_RECORD_NOT_AA_UDP (ERROR)

3.3.6. Input parameters

This plan requires the following input parameters:

  • dns.nameservers (object)
  • dnssec.dsRecords (object)

3.3.7. Required files

  • None specified.

3.3.8. RST-API example

POST /test/987654/inputs HTTP/1.1
Content-Type: application/json
Content-Length: 469

{
   "dns.nameservers" : {
      "example" : {
         "ns1.example.com" : [
            "192.168.53.1",
            "2001:DB8::53:1"
         ],
         "ns2.example.com" : [
            "192.168.53.2",
            "2001:DB8::53:2"
         ]
      }
   },
   "dnssec.dsRecords" : {
      "example" : [
         {
            "alg" : "8",
            "digest" : "E2D3...5766",
            "digestType" : "2",
            "keyTag" : "12345"
         }
      ]
   }
}

3.3.9. Sequence diagram

3.4. IDN Test

3.4.1. Description

A Registry Operator may apply to ICANN to amend its Registry Agreement to offer new scripts and/or languages for Internationalized Domain Names.

The purpose of an IDN RST test is to verify that the Registry Operator’s registry system handles IDN registrations in accordance with the submitted policy statements and IDN tables.

The IDN Test uses the IDN test suite only.

Pass/fail criteria

As with all other test plans, for this test to pass, all the listed test cases MUST pass: if any fail, then the test as a whole will fail.

3.4.2. Plan ID

The following Test Plan ID may be used with the RST API:

IDNTest

3.4.3. Test suites

This plan uses the following test suites:

  1. Internationalized Domain Names (IDN)

3.4.4. Resources

The following resources may be required to prepare for this test plan:

  • None specified.

3.4.5. Errors

This test plan may produce the following errors:

  • None specified.

3.4.6. Input parameters

This plan requires the following input parameters:

  • epp.clid (string)
  • epp.hostName (string)
  • epp.pwd (string)
  • epp.transferClid (string)
  • epp.transferPwd (string)
  • general.minimalPublicDataSet (boolean)

3.4.7. Required files

  • None specified.

3.4.8. RST-API example

POST /test/987654/inputs HTTP/1.1
Content-Type: application/json
Content-Length: 203

{
   "epp.clid" : "clid-01",
   "epp.hostName" : "epp.rsp.tech",
   "epp.pwd" : "foo2bar",
   "epp.transferClid" : "clid-02",
   "epp.transferPwd" : "foo3bar",
   "general.minimalPublicDataSet" : true
}

3.4.9. Sequence diagram

3.5. SRS Gateway Test

3.5.1. Description

An SRS Gateway service is a Shared Registry System implementation that acts as a proxy between a subset of Registrars and the Registry. It uses a local cache to speed up EPP query commands, but forwards all EPP transform commands to the primary registry system. TLD registries need to deploy a proxy setup in order to operate in certain markets worldwide.

The purpose of an SRS Gateway Test is to verify that the Registry Operator’s proxy setup operates in accordance with the technical and operational criteria for EPP systems described in the gTLD Applicant Guidebook (AGB). Furthermore, it MUST keep its own database synchronized with that of the TLD registry.

The SRS Gateway Test Change Test uses the SRS gateway test suite only.

Pass/fail criteria

As with all other test plans, for this test to pass, all the listed test cases MUST pass: if any fail, then the test as a whole will fail.

3.5.2. Plan ID

The following Test Plan ID may be used with the RST API:

SRSGatewayTest

3.5.3. Test suites

This plan uses the following test suites:

  1. SRS Gateway

3.5.4. Resources

The following resources may be required to prepare for this test plan:

  • epp.clientACL
  • epp.clientCertificate

3.5.5. Errors

This test plan may produce the following errors:

  • None specified.

3.5.6. Input parameters

This plan requires the following input parameters:

  • epp.clid (string)
  • epp.hostModel (string)
  • epp.hostName (string)
  • epp.pwd (string)
  • general.gracePeriodsSupported (boolean)
  • general.minimalPublicDataSet (boolean)
  • rdap.baseURLs (object)
  • srsgw.eppClid (string)
  • srsgw.eppHostName (string)
  • srsgw.eppPwd (string)
  • srsgw.eppTransferClid (string)
  • srsgw.eppTransferPwd (string)
  • srsgw.rdapBaseURLs (object)

3.5.7. Required files

  • None specified.

3.5.8. RST-API example

POST /test/987654/inputs HTTP/1.1
Content-Type: application/json
Content-Length: 563

{
   "epp.clid" : "clid-01",
   "epp.hostModel" : "objects",
   "epp.hostName" : "epp.rsp.tech",
   "epp.pwd" : "foo2bar",
   "general.gracePeriodsSupported" : true,
   "general.minimalPublicDataSet" : true,
   "rdap.baseURLs" : {
      "example" : "https://rdap.example.com/example/"
   },
   "srsgw.eppClid" : "clid-01",
   "srsgw.eppHostName" : "epp.rsp.tech",
   "srsgw.eppPwd" : "foo2bar",
   "srsgw.eppTransferClid" : "clid-02",
   "srsgw.eppTransferPwd" : "foo3bar",
   "srsgw.rdapBaseURLs" : {
      "example" : "https://rdap.example.com/example/"
   }
}

3.5.9. Sequence diagram

3.6. Main RSP Evaluation Test

3.6.1. Description

The Main RSP is responsible for the creation and maintenance of domain name registrations in a Shared Registration System (SRS). This encompasses the lifecycle of a domain name registration using domain registrars and protocols such as the Extensible Provisioning Protocol (EPP) and adherence to policies regarding the use and transparency domain name registrations through reporting, the Registration Data Access Protocol (RDAP), and other mechanisms.

Pass/fail criteria

As with all other test plans, for this test to pass, all the listed test cases MUST pass: if any fail, then the test as a whole will fail.

3.6.2. Plan ID

The following Test Plan ID may be used with the RST API:

MainRSPEvaluationTest

3.6.3. Test suites

This plan uses the following test suites:

  1. Registration Data Access Protocol (RDAP)
  2. Extensible Provisioning Protocol (EPP)
  3. Registry Data Escrow (RDE)
  4. Minimum Rights Protection Mechanisms (RPMs)

3.6.4. Resources

The following resources may be required to prepare for this test plan:

  • epp.clientACL
  • epp.clientCertificate
  • epp.tlsCertificateStore
  • rde.encryptionKey

3.6.5. Errors

This test plan may produce the following errors:

  • EPP_CONNECT_ERROR (ERROR)
  • EPP_GENERIC_COMMAND_ERROR (ERROR)
  • EPP_LOGIN_ERROR (ERROR)
  • EPP_SCHEMA_VALIDATION_ERROR (ERROR)
  • EPP_SUNRISE_AVAILABILITY_CHECK_INVALID_RESULT (ERROR)

3.6.6. Input parameters

This plan requires the following input parameters:

  • epp.clid (string)
  • epp.hostModel (string)
  • epp.hostName (string)
  • epp.pwd (string)
  • epp.registeredContacts (array)
  • epp.registeredNames (array)
  • epp.registeredNameservers (array)
  • epp.restoreReportRequired (boolean)
  • epp.transferClid (string)
  • epp.transferPwd (string)
  • general.gracePeriodsSupported (boolean)
  • general.minimalPublicDataSet (boolean)
  • general.sunriseModels (string)
  • rdap.baseURLs (object)
  • rdap.testDomains (object)
  • rdap.testEntities (object)
  • rdap.testNameservers (object)
  • rde.depositFile (file)
  • rde.publicKey (file)
  • rde.signatureFile (file)

3.6.7. Required files

  • rde.depositFile
  • rde.publicKey
  • rde.signatureFile

3.6.8. RST-API example

POST /test/987654/inputs HTTP/1.1
Content-Type: application/json
Content-Length: 1054

{
   "epp.clid" : "clid-01",
   "epp.hostModel" : "objects",
   "epp.hostName" : "epp.rsp.tech",
   "epp.pwd" : "foo2bar",
   "epp.registeredContacts" : [
      "abc123",
      "def321"
   ],
   "epp.registeredNames" : [
      "example.example1",
      "example.example2"
   ],
   "epp.registeredNameservers" : [
      "ns1.example.com",
      "ns2.example.org"
   ],
   "epp.restoreReportRequired" : false,
   "epp.transferClid" : "clid-02",
   "epp.transferPwd" : "foo3bar",
   "general.gracePeriodsSupported" : true,
   "general.minimalPublicDataSet" : true,
   "general.sunriseModels" : "start-date",
   "rdap.baseURLs" : {
      "example" : "https://rdap.example.com/example/"
   },
   "rdap.testDomains" : {
      "example" : "example.example"
   },
   "rdap.testEntities" : {
      "example" : "9999"
   },
   "rdap.testNameservers" : {
      "example" : "ns1.example.com"
   },
   "rde.depositFile" : "example_20231004_FULL_S1_R0.ryde",
   "rde.publicKey" : "rsp-rde-signing-key.asc",
   "rde.signatureFile" : "example_20231004_FULL_S1_R0.sig"
}

3.6.9. Sequence diagram

3.7. DNS RSP Evaluation Test

3.7.1. Description

DNS RSPs provide primary or secondary authoritative DNS services. Therefore, this test plan only covers the DNS area.

RSPs wishing to offer DNSSEC services in addition to authoritative DNS will also be evaluated using the DNSSEC RSP Evaluation Test below.

Pass/fail criteria

As with all other test plans, for this test to pass, all the listed test cases MUST pass: if any fail, then the test as a whole will fail.

3.7.2. Plan ID

The following Test Plan ID may be used with the RST API:

DNSRSPEvaluationTest

3.7.3. Test suites

This plan uses the following test suites:

  1. Authoritative DNS Service

3.7.4. Resources

The following resources may be required to prepare for this test plan:

  • None specified.

3.7.5. Errors

This test plan may produce the following errors:

  • ZM_AAAA_BAD_RDATA (ERROR)
  • ZM_AAAA_QUERY_DROPPED (ERROR)
  • ZM_AAAA_UNEXPECTED_RCODE (ERROR)
  • ZM_AAAA_WELL_PROCESSED (INFO)
  • ZM_ADDRESSES_MATCH (INFO)
  • ZM_A_UNEXPECTED_RCODE (ERROR)
  • ZM_BREAKS_ON_EDNS (ERROR)
  • ZM_CHILD_DISTINCT_NS_IP (INFO)
  • ZM_CHILD_NS_FAILED (ERROR)
  • ZM_CHILD_NS_SAME_IP (ERROR)
  • ZM_CHILD_ZONE_LAME (ERROR)
  • ZM_CN01_IPV4_DISABLED (NOTICE)
  • ZM_CN01_IPV6_DISABLED (NOTICE)
  • ZM_CN01_MISSING_NS_RECORD_UDP (ERROR)
  • ZM_CN01_MISSING_SOA_RECORD_UDP (ERROR)
  • ZM_CN01_NO_RESPONSE_NS_QUERY_UDP (ERROR)
  • ZM_CN01_NO_RESPONSE_SOA_QUERY_UDP (ERROR)
  • ZM_CN01_NO_RESPONSE_UDP (ERROR)
  • ZM_CN01_NS_RECORD_NOT_AA_UDP (ERROR)
  • ZM_CN01_SOA_RECORD_NOT_AA_UDP (ERROR)
  • ZM_CN01_UNEXPECTED_RCODE_NS_QUERY_UDP (ERROR)
  • ZM_CN01_UNEXPECTED_RCODE_SOA_QUERY_UDP (ERROR)
  • ZM_CN01_WRONG_NS_RECORD_UDP (ERROR)
  • ZM_CN01_WRONG_SOA_RECORD_UDP (ERROR)
  • ZM_CN02_MISSING_NS_RECORD_TCP (ERROR)
  • ZM_CN02_MISSING_SOA_RECORD_TCP (ERROR)
  • ZM_CN02_NO_RESPONSE_NS_QUERY_TCP (ERROR)
  • ZM_CN02_NO_RESPONSE_SOA_QUERY_TCP (ERROR)
  • ZM_CN02_NO_RESPONSE_TCP (ERROR)
  • ZM_CN02_NS_RECORD_NOT_AA_TCP (ERROR)
  • ZM_CN02_SOA_RECORD_NOT_AA_TCP (ERROR)
  • ZM_CN02_UNEXPECTED_RCODE_NS_QUERY_TCP (ERROR)
  • ZM_CN02_UNEXPECTED_RCODE_SOA_QUERY_TCP (ERROR)
  • ZM_CN02_WRONG_NS_RECORD_TCP (ERROR)
  • ZM_CN02_WRONG_SOA_RECORD_TCP (ERROR)
  • ZM_CN04_EMPTY_PREFIX_SET (ERROR)
  • ZM_CN04_ERROR_PREFIX_DATABASE (ERROR)
  • ZM_CN04_IPV4_DIFFERENT_PREFIX (INFO)
  • ZM_CN04_IPV4_SAME_PREFIX (WARNING)
  • ZM_CN04_IPV6_DIFFERENT_PREFIX (INFO)
  • ZM_CN04_IPV6_SAME_PREFIX (WARNING)
  • ZM_DEL_DISTINCT_NS_IP (INFO)
  • ZM_DEL_NS_SAME_IP (ERROR)
  • ZM_EDNS_RESPONSE_WITHOUT_EDNS (ERROR)
  • ZM_EDNS_VERSION_ERROR (ERROR)
  • ZM_EMPTY_ASN_SET (ERROR)
  • ZM_ENOUGH_IPV4_NS_CHILD (INFO)
  • ZM_ENOUGH_IPV4_NS_DEL (INFO)
  • ZM_ENOUGH_IPV6_NS_CHILD (INFO)
  • ZM_ENOUGH_IPV6_NS_DEL (INFO)

  • ZM_NO_IPV4_NS_CHILD (ERROR)
  • ZM_NO_IPV4_NS_DEL (ERROR)
  • ZM_NO_IPV6_NS_CHILD (ERROR)
  • ZM_NO_IPV6_NS_DEL (ERROR)

  • ZM_Z01_MNAME_NOT_MASTER (WARNING)
  • ZM_Z01_MNAME_NOT_RESOLVE (WARNING)
  • ZM_Z01_MNAME_NO_RESPONSE (WARNING)
  • ZM_Z01_MNAME_UNEXPECTED_RCODE (WARNING)
  • ZM_Z_FLAGS_NOTCLEAR (ERROR)

3.7.6. Input parameters

This plan requires the following input parameters:

  • dns.nameservers (object)

3.7.7. Required files

  • None specified.

3.7.8. RST-API example

POST /test/987654/inputs HTTP/1.1
Content-Type: application/json
Content-Length: 261

{
   "dns.nameservers" : {
      "example" : {
         "ns1.example.com" : [
            "192.168.53.1",
            "2001:DB8::53:1"
         ],
         "ns2.example.com" : [
            "192.168.53.2",
            "2001:DB8::53:2"
         ]
      }
   }
}

3.7.9. Sequence diagram

3.8. DNSSEC RSP Evaluation Test

3.8.1. Description

DNSSEC RSPs provide signing of TLD zone files as a service. They do not provide primary or secondary authoritative DNS services.

RSPs wishing to offer DNSSEC services in addition to authoritative DNS will also be evaluated using the DNSSEC RSP Evaluation Test below.

As with all other test plans, for this test to pass, all the listed test cases MUST pass: if any fail, then the test as a whole will fail.

3.8.2. Plan ID

The following Test Plan ID may be used with the RST API:

DNSSECRSPEvaluationTest

3.8.3. Test suites

This plan uses the following test suites:

  1. DNS Security Extensions (DNSSEC)
  2. DNSSEC Operations

3.8.4. Resources

The following resources may be required to prepare for this test plan:

  • None specified.

3.8.5. Errors

This test plan may produce the following errors:

  • DNSSEC_DNS_QUERY_ERROR (ERROR)
  • DNSSEC_INVALID_DIGEST_ALGORITHM (ERROR)
  • DNSSEC_INVALID_SIGNING_ALGORITHM (ERROR)
  • ZM_ALGORITHM_DEPRECATED (ERROR)
  • ZM_ALGORITHM_NOT_RECOMMENDED (WARNING)
  • ZM_ALGORITHM_NOT_ZONE_SIGN (ERROR)

  • ZM_ALGORITHM_PRIVATE (ERROR)
  • ZM_ALGORITHM_RESERVED (ERROR)

3.8.6. Input parameters

This plan requires the following input parameters:

  • dns.nameservers (object)
  • dnssec.dsRecords (object)
  • dnssecOps.algorithmRolloverZone (string)
  • dnssecOps.csk (boolean)
  • dnssecOps.kskRolloverZone (string)
  • dnssecOps.zskRolloverZone (string)

3.8.7. Required files

  • None specified.

3.8.8. RST-API example

POST /test/987654/inputs HTTP/1.1
Content-Type: application/json
Content-Length: 647

{
   "dns.nameservers" : {
      "example" : {
         "ns1.example.com" : [
            "192.168.53.1",
            "2001:DB8::53:1"
         ],
         "ns2.example.com" : [
            "192.168.53.2",
            "2001:DB8::53:2"
         ]
      }
   },
   "dnssec.dsRecords" : {
      "example" : [
         {
            "alg" : "8",
            "digest" : "E2D3...5766",
            "digestType" : "2",
            "keyTag" : "12345"
         }
      ]
   },
   "dnssecOps.algorithmRolloverZone" : "example.com",
   "dnssecOps.csk" : false,
   "dnssecOps.kskRolloverZone" : "example.com",
   "dnssecOps.zskRolloverZone" : "example.com"
}

3.8.9. Sequence diagram

3.9. SRS Gateway RSP Evaluation Test

3.9.1. Description

SRS Gateway RSPs provide a proxy between a subset of Registrars and the Registry. It uses a local cache to speed up EPP query commands, but forwards all EPP transform commands to the primary registry system. TLD registries need to deploy a proxy setup in order to operate in certain markets worldwide.

The SRS Gateway test suite requires access to a primary registry system that is logically independent of the SRS Gateway system, and details of the primary registry system are required as input parameters. RSPs wishing to offer SRS gateway services MUST identify such a primary registry system, which MUST be independent of the SRS gateway system, and MAY be operated by a third party.

Pass/fail criteria

As with all other test plans, for this test to pass, all the listed test cases MUST pass: if any fail, then the test as a whole will fail.

3.9.2. Plan ID

The following Test Plan ID may be used with the RST API:

SRSGatewayRSPTest

3.9.3. Test suites

This plan uses the following test suites:

  1. SRS Gateway

3.9.4. Resources

The following resources may be required to prepare for this test plan:

  • epp.clientACL
  • epp.clientCertificate

3.9.5. Errors

This test plan may produce the following errors:

  • None specified.

3.9.6. Input parameters

This plan requires the following input parameters:

  • epp.clid (string)
  • epp.hostModel (string)
  • epp.hostName (string)
  • epp.pwd (string)
  • general.gracePeriodsSupported (boolean)
  • general.minimalPublicDataSet (boolean)
  • rdap.baseURLs (object)
  • srsgw.eppClid (string)
  • srsgw.eppHostName (string)
  • srsgw.eppPwd (string)
  • srsgw.eppTransferClid (string)
  • srsgw.eppTransferPwd (string)
  • srsgw.rdapBaseURLs (object)

3.9.7. Required files

  • None specified.

3.9.8. RST-API example

POST /test/987654/inputs HTTP/1.1
Content-Type: application/json
Content-Length: 563

{
   "epp.clid" : "clid-01",
   "epp.hostModel" : "objects",
   "epp.hostName" : "epp.rsp.tech",
   "epp.pwd" : "foo2bar",
   "general.gracePeriodsSupported" : true,
   "general.minimalPublicDataSet" : true,
   "rdap.baseURLs" : {
      "example" : "https://rdap.example.com/example/"
   },
   "srsgw.eppClid" : "clid-01",
   "srsgw.eppHostName" : "epp.rsp.tech",
   "srsgw.eppPwd" : "foo2bar",
   "srsgw.eppTransferClid" : "clid-02",
   "srsgw.eppTransferPwd" : "foo3bar",
   "srsgw.rdapBaseURLs" : {
      "example" : "https://rdap.example.com/example/"
   }
}

3.9.9. Sequence diagram

4. Test Suites

4.1. Authoritative DNS Service

4.1.1. Description

The DNS test suite validates the authoritative DNS services for the TLD or RSP.

The DNS test suite is derived from the test plans in version v2023.1.4 of Zonemaster. Test case IDs from this document can be mapped to the Zonemaster test IDs by removing the dns- prefix.

Since Zonemaster is designed to perform testing of domain names anywhere in the DNS hierarchy, not all Zonemaster tests are applicable for TLDs and may not be listed in the test suites in this document.

Testing of Anycast networks using multiple vantage points

In order to test anycast networks without requiring RSPs to provide the unicast adresses of their nodes, tests carried out over the network will be performed from multiple vantage points. All vantage points MUST receive the same response in order for the tests to pass.

Pass/fail criteria

As with all other test suites, for this test suite to pass all the listed test cases MUST pass: if any fail, then the suite as a whole will fail.

Unless stated otherwise, the pass/fail criteria for the test cases in this suite are the same as those defined in the Zonemaster documentation: that is, if Zonemaster reports that a test case has an ERROR or CRITICAL result, then the corresponding test case in this suite will fail. INFO, NOTICE and WARNING results will not result in a failed test case. Error codes in this suite are prefixed with ZM_ which map onto the message tags used by Zonemaster.

4.1.2. Test cases

This suite uses the following test cases:

  1. dns-address01 - Name server address must be globally routable
  2. dns-address02 - Reverse DNS entry exists for name server IP address
  3. dns-address03 - Reverse DNS entry matches name server name
  4. dns-connectivity01 - UDP connectivity to name servers
  5. dns-connectivity02 - TCP connectivity to name servers
  6. dns-connectivity03 - AS Diversity
  7. dns-connectivity04 - IP Prefix Diversity
  8. dns-consistency01 - SOA serial number consistency
  9. dns-consistency02 - SOA RNAME consistency
  10. dns-consistency03 - SOA timers consistency
  11. dns-consistency04 - Name server NS consistency
  12. dns-consistency05 - Consistency between glue and authoritative data
  13. dns-consistency06 - SOA MNAME consistency
  14. dns-delegation01 - Minimum number of name servers
  15. dns-delegation02 - Name servers must have distinct IP addresses
  16. dns-delegation03 - No truncation of referrals
  17. dns-delegation04 - Name server is authoritative
  18. dns-delegation05 - Name server must not point at CNAME alias
  19. dns-delegation06 - Existence of SOA
  20. dns-delegation07 - Parent glue name records present in child
  21. dns-nameserver01 - A name server should not be a recursor
  22. dns-nameserver02 - Test of EDNS0 support
  23. dns-nameserver03 - Test availability of zone transfer (AXFR)
  24. dns-nameserver04 - Same source address
  25. dns-nameserver05 - Behaviour against AAAA query
  26. dns-nameserver06 - NS can be resolved
  27. dns-nameserver07 - To check whether authoritative name servers return an upward referral
  28. dns-nameserver08 - Testing QNAME case insensitivity
  29. dns-nameserver09 - Testing QNAME case sensitivity
  30. dns-nameserver10 - Test for undefined EDNS version
  31. dns-nameserver11 - Test for unknown EDNS OPTION-CODE
  32. dns-nameserver12 - Test for unknown EDNS flags
  33. dns-nameserver13 - Test for truncated response on EDNS query
  34. dns-nameserver14 - Test for unknown version with unknown OPTION-CODE
  35. dns-nameserver15 - Checking for revealed software version
  36. dns-syntax04 - The NS name must have a valid domain/hostname
  37. dns-syntax05 - Misuse of '@' character in the SOA RNAME field
  38. dns-syntax06 - No illegal characters in the SOA RNAME field
  39. dns-syntax07 - No illegal characters in the SOA MNAME field
  40. dns-zone01 - Fully qualified master nameserver in SOA
  41. dns-zone02 - SOA 'refresh' minimum value
  42. dns-zone03 - SOA 'retry' lower than 'refresh'
  43. dns-zone04 - SOA 'retry' at least 1 hour
  44. dns-zone05 - SOA 'expire' minimum value
  45. dns-zone06 - SOA 'minimum' maximum value
  46. dns-zone07 - SOA master is not an alias
  47. dns-zone10 - No multiple SOA records

4.1.3. Test plans

This suite is used by the following test plans:

  1. Pre-Delegation Test
  2. RSP Change Test
  3. DNS RSP Change Test
  4. DNS RSP Evaluation Test

4.1.4. Resources

The following resources may be required to prepare for this test plan:

  • None specified.

4.1.5. Errors

This test suite may produce the following errors:

  • ZM_AAAA_BAD_RDATA (ERROR)
  • ZM_AAAA_QUERY_DROPPED (ERROR)
  • ZM_AAAA_UNEXPECTED_RCODE (ERROR)
  • ZM_AAAA_WELL_PROCESSED (INFO)
  • ZM_ADDRESSES_MATCH (INFO)
  • ZM_A_UNEXPECTED_RCODE (ERROR)
  • ZM_BREAKS_ON_EDNS (ERROR)
  • ZM_CHILD_DISTINCT_NS_IP (INFO)
  • ZM_CHILD_NS_FAILED (ERROR)
  • ZM_CHILD_NS_SAME_IP (ERROR)
  • ZM_CHILD_ZONE_LAME (ERROR)
  • ZM_CN01_IPV4_DISABLED (NOTICE)
  • ZM_CN01_IPV6_DISABLED (NOTICE)
  • ZM_CN01_MISSING_NS_RECORD_UDP (ERROR)
  • ZM_CN01_MISSING_SOA_RECORD_UDP (ERROR)
  • ZM_CN01_NO_RESPONSE_NS_QUERY_UDP (ERROR)
  • ZM_CN01_NO_RESPONSE_SOA_QUERY_UDP (ERROR)
  • ZM_CN01_NO_RESPONSE_UDP (ERROR)
  • ZM_CN01_NS_RECORD_NOT_AA_UDP (ERROR)
  • ZM_CN01_SOA_RECORD_NOT_AA_UDP (ERROR)
  • ZM_CN01_UNEXPECTED_RCODE_NS_QUERY_UDP (ERROR)
  • ZM_CN01_UNEXPECTED_RCODE_SOA_QUERY_UDP (ERROR)
  • ZM_CN01_WRONG_NS_RECORD_UDP (ERROR)
  • ZM_CN01_WRONG_SOA_RECORD_UDP (ERROR)
  • ZM_CN02_MISSING_NS_RECORD_TCP (ERROR)
  • ZM_CN02_MISSING_SOA_RECORD_TCP (ERROR)
  • ZM_CN02_NO_RESPONSE_NS_QUERY_TCP (ERROR)
  • ZM_CN02_NO_RESPONSE_SOA_QUERY_TCP (ERROR)
  • ZM_CN02_NO_RESPONSE_TCP (ERROR)
  • ZM_CN02_NS_RECORD_NOT_AA_TCP (ERROR)
  • ZM_CN02_SOA_RECORD_NOT_AA_TCP (ERROR)
  • ZM_CN02_UNEXPECTED_RCODE_NS_QUERY_TCP (ERROR)
  • ZM_CN02_UNEXPECTED_RCODE_SOA_QUERY_TCP (ERROR)
  • ZM_CN02_WRONG_NS_RECORD_TCP (ERROR)
  • ZM_CN02_WRONG_SOA_RECORD_TCP (ERROR)
  • ZM_CN04_EMPTY_PREFIX_SET (ERROR)
  • ZM_CN04_ERROR_PREFIX_DATABASE (ERROR)
  • ZM_CN04_IPV4_DIFFERENT_PREFIX (INFO)
  • ZM_CN04_IPV4_SAME_PREFIX (WARNING)
  • ZM_CN04_IPV6_DIFFERENT_PREFIX (INFO)
  • ZM_CN04_IPV6_SAME_PREFIX (WARNING)
  • ZM_DEL_DISTINCT_NS_IP (INFO)
  • ZM_DEL_NS_SAME_IP (ERROR)
  • ZM_EDNS_RESPONSE_WITHOUT_EDNS (ERROR)
  • ZM_EDNS_VERSION_ERROR (ERROR)
  • ZM_EMPTY_ASN_SET (ERROR)
  • ZM_ENOUGH_IPV4_NS_CHILD (INFO)
  • ZM_ENOUGH_IPV4_NS_DEL (INFO)
  • ZM_ENOUGH_IPV6_NS_CHILD (INFO)
  • ZM_ENOUGH_IPV6_NS_DEL (INFO)
  • ZM_ENOUGH_NS_CHILD (INFO)
  • ZM_ENOUGH_NS_DEL (INFO)
  • ZM_ERROR_ASN_DATABASE (ERROR)
  • ZM_EXTRA_ADDRESS_CHILD (ERROR)
  • ZM_IN_BAILIWICK_ADDR_MISMATCH (ERROR)
  • ZM_IPV4_DIFFERENT_ASN (INFO)
  • ZM_IPV4_ONE_ASN (ERROR)
  • ZM_IPV4_SAME_ASN (NOTICE)
  • ZM_IPV6_DIFFERENT_ASN (INFO)
  • ZM_IPV6_ONE_ASN (ERROR)
  • ZM_IPV6_SAME_ASN (NOTICE)
  • ZM_IS_A_RECURSOR (ERROR)
  • ZM_MISSING_OPT_IN_TRUNCATED (ERROR)
  • ZM_MULTIPLE_NS_SET (ERROR)
  • ZM_MULTIPLE_SOA (ERROR)
  • ZM_MULTIPLE_SOA_MNAMES (ERROR)
  • ZM_MULTIPLE_SOA_RNAMES (ERROR)
  • ZM_MULTIPLE_SOA_SERIALS (ERROR)
  • ZM_MULTIPLE_SOA_SERIALS_OK (NOTICE)
  • ZM_MULTIPLE_SOA_TIME_PARAMETER_SET (ERROR)
  • ZM_N10_EDNS_RESPONSE_ERROR (ERROR)
  • ZM_N10_NO_RESPONSE_EDNS1_QUERY (ERROR)
  • ZM_N10_UNEXPECTED_RCODE (ERROR)
  • ZM_N11_NO_EDNS (ERROR)
  • ZM_N11_NO_RESPONSE (ERROR)
  • ZM_N11_RETURNS_UNKNOWN_OPTION_CODE (ERROR)
  • ZM_N11_UNEXPECTED_ANSWER_SECTION (ERROR)
  • ZM_N11_UNEXPECTED_RCODE (ERROR)
  • ZM_N11_UNSET_AA (ERROR)
  • ZM_N15_NO_VERSION (INFO)
  • ZM_N15_SOFTWARE_VERSION (INFO)
  • ZM_NOT_ENOUGH_IPV4_NS_CHILD (ERROR)
  • ZM_NOT_ENOUGH_IPV4_NS_DEL (ERROR)
  • ZM_NOT_ENOUGH_IPV6_NS_CHILD (ERROR)
  • ZM_NOT_ENOUGH_IPV6_NS_DEL (ERROR)
  • ZM_NOT_ENOUGH_NS_CHILD (ERROR)
  • ZM_NOT_ENOUGH_NS_DEL (ERROR)
  • ZM_NO_EDNS_SUPPORT (ERROR)
  • ZM_NO_IPV4_NS_CHILD (ERROR)
  • ZM_NO_IPV4_NS_DEL (ERROR)
  • ZM_NO_IPV6_NS_CHILD (ERROR)
  • ZM_NO_IPV6_NS_DEL (ERROR)
  • ZM_NO_NS_CNAME (INFO)
  • ZM_NO_RECURSOR (INFO)
  • ZM_NO_RESPONSE (ERROR)
  • ZM_NO_RESPONSE_NS_QUERY (ERROR)
  • ZM_NO_RESPONSE_SOA_QUERY (ERROR)
  • ZM_NO_SOA_IN_RESPONSE (ERROR)
  • ZM_NS_ERROR (ERROR)
  • ZM_NS_IS_CNAME (ERROR)
  • ZM_ONE_NS_SET (INFO)
  • ZM_ONE_SOA (INFO)
  • ZM_ONE_SOA_MNAME (INFO)
  • ZM_ONE_SOA_RNAME (INFO)
  • ZM_ONE_SOA_SERIAL (INFO)
  • ZM_ONE_SOA_TIME_PARAMETER_SET (INFO)
  • ZM_OUT_OF_BAILIWICK_ADDR_MISMATCH (ERROR)
  • ZM_REFERRAL_SIZE_OK (INFO)
  • ZM_REFERRAL_SIZE_TOO_LARGE (WARNING)
  • ZM_RNAME_MAIL_DOMAIN_INVALID (ERROR)
  • ZM_RNAME_MAIL_DOMAIN_LOCALHOST (ERROR)
  • ZM_RNAME_MAIL_ILLEGAL_CNAME (ERROR)
  • ZM_RNAME_RFC822_INVALID (ERROR)
  • ZM_RNAME_RFC822_VALID (INFO)
  • ZM_SOA_SERIAL (INFO)
  • ZM_SOA_SERIAL_VARIATION (NOTICE)
  • ZM_UNEXPECTED_RCODE (WARNING)
  • ZM_UNKNOWN_OPTION_CODE (ERROR)
  • ZM_UNSUPPORTED_EDNS_VER (ERROR)
  • ZM_WRONG_SOA (ERROR)
  • ZM_Z01_MNAME_HAS_LOCALHOST_ADDR (WARNING)
  • ZM_Z01_MNAME_IS_DOT (NOTICE)
  • ZM_Z01_MNAME_IS_LOCALHOST (WARNING)
  • ZM_Z01_MNAME_MISSING_SOA_RECORD (WARNING)
  • ZM_Z01_MNAME_NOT_AUTHORITATIVE (WARNING)
  • ZM_Z01_MNAME_NOT_IN_NS_LIST (INFO)
  • ZM_Z01_MNAME_NOT_MASTER (WARNING)
  • ZM_Z01_MNAME_NOT_RESOLVE (WARNING)
  • ZM_Z01_MNAME_NO_RESPONSE (WARNING)
  • ZM_Z01_MNAME_UNEXPECTED_RCODE (WARNING)
  • ZM_Z_FLAGS_NOTCLEAR (ERROR)

4.1.6. Input parameters

The test cases used by this suite require the following input parameters:

  1. dns.nameservers (object)

4.1.7. Sequence diagram

4.2. DNS Security Extensions (DNSSEC)

4.2.1. Description

The DNSSEC test suite validates the DNSSEC signing service for the TLD or RSP.

The DNSSEC test suite is derived from the test plans in version v2023.1.4 of Zonemaster. Test case IDs from this document can be mapped to the Zonemaster test IDs by removing the hyphen-minus.

Since Zonemaster is designed to perform testing of domain names anywhere in the DNS hierarchy, not all Zonemaster tests are applicable for TLDs and may not be listed in the test suites in this document.

Pass/fail criteria

As with all other test suites, for this test suite to pass all the listed test cases MUST pass: if any fail, then the suite as a whole will fail.

Unless stated otherwise, the pass/fail criteria for the test cases in this suite are the same as those defined in the Zonemaster documentation: that is, if Zonemaster reports that a test case has an ERROR or CRITICAL result, then the corresponding test case in this suite will fail. INFO, NOTICE and WARNING results will not result in a failed test case. Error codes in this suite are prefixed with ZM_ which map onto the message tags used by Zonemaster.

4.2.2. Test cases

This suite uses the following test cases:

  1. dnssec-01 - Legal values for the DS hash digest algorithm
  2. dnssec-02 - DS must match a valid DNSKEY in the child zone
  3. dnssec-03 - Check for too many NSEC3 iterations
  4. dnssec-04 - Check for too short or too long RRSIG lifetimes
  5. dnssec-05 - Check for invalid DNSKEY algorithms
  6. dnssec-06 - Verify DNSSEC additional processing
  7. dnssec-08 - Valid RRSIG for DNSKEY
  8. dnssec-09 - RRSIG(SOA) must be valid and created by a valid DNSKEY
  9. dnssec-10 - Zone contains NSEC or NSEC3 records
  10. dnssec-12 - Test for DNSSEC Algorithm Completeness
  11. dnssec-13 - All DNSKEY algorithms used to sign the zone
  12. dnssec-14 - Check for valid RSA DNSKEY key size
  13. dnssec-15 - Existence of CDS and CDNSKEY
  14. dnssec-16 - Validate CDS
  15. dnssec-17 - Validate CDNSKEY
  16. dnssec-18 - Validate trust from DS to CDS and CDNSKEY
  17. dnssec-91 - Permitted signing algorithms
  18. dnssec-92 - Permitted DS record hash algorithm(s)

4.2.3. Test plans

This suite is used by the following test plans:

  1. Pre-Delegation Test
  2. RSP Change Test
  3. DNS RSP Change Test
  4. DNSSEC RSP Evaluation Test

4.2.4. Resources

The following resources may be required to prepare for this test plan:

  • None specified.

4.2.5. Errors

This test suite may produce the following errors:

  • DNSSEC_DNS_QUERY_ERROR (ERROR)
  • DNSSEC_INVALID_DIGEST_ALGORITHM (ERROR)
  • DNSSEC_INVALID_SIGNING_ALGORITHM (ERROR)
  • ZM_ALGORITHM_DEPRECATED (ERROR)
  • ZM_ALGORITHM_NOT_RECOMMENDED (WARNING)
  • ZM_ALGORITHM_NOT_ZONE_SIGN (ERROR)
  • ZM_ALGORITHM_OK (INFO)
  • ZM_ALGORITHM_PRIVATE (ERROR)
  • ZM_ALGORITHM_RESERVED (ERROR)
  • ZM_ALGORITHM_UNASSIGNED (ERROR)
  • ZM_DNSKEY_SMALLER_THAN_REC (WARNING)
  • ZM_DNSKEY_TOO_LARGE_FOR_ALGO (ERROR)
  • ZM_DNSKEY_TOO_SMALL_FOR_ALGO (ERROR)
  • ZM_DS01_DIGEST_NOT_SUPPORTED_BY_ZM (NOTICE)
  • ZM_DS01_DS_ALGO_2_MISSING (ERROR)
  • ZM_DS01_DS_ALGO_DEPRECATED (ERROR)
  • ZM_DS01_DS_ALGO_NOT_DS (ERROR)
  • ZM_DS01_DS_ALGO_RESERVED (ERROR)
  • ZM_DS02_ALGO_NOT_SUPPORTED_BY_ZM (NOTICE)
  • ZM_DS02_DNSKEY_NOT_FOR_ZONE_SIGNING (ERROR)
  • ZM_DS02_DNSKEY_NOT_SEP (ERROR)
  • ZM_DS02_DNSKEY_NOT_SIGNED_BY_ANY_DS (ERROR)
  • ZM_DS02_NO_DNSKEY_FOR_DS (ERROR)
  • ZM_DS02_NO_MATCHING_DNSKEY_RRSIG (ERROR)
  • ZM_DS02_NO_MATCH_DS_DNSKEY (ERROR)
  • ZM_DS02_NO_VALID_DNSKEY_FOR_ANY_DS (ERROR)
  • ZM_DS02_RRSIG_NOT_VALID_BY_DNSKEY (ERROR)
  • ZM_DS08_ALGO_NOT_SUPPORTED_BY_ZM (NOTICE)
  • ZM_DS08_DNSKEY_RRSIG_EXPIRED (ERROR)
  • ZM_DS08_DNSKEY_RRSIG_NOT_YET_VALID (ERROR)
  • ZM_DS08_MISSING_RRSIG_IN_RESPONSE (ERROR)
  • ZM_DS08_NO_MATCHING_DNSKEY (ERROR)
  • ZM_DS08_RRSIG_NOT_VALID_BY_DNSKEY (ERROR)
  • ZM_DS09_ALGO_NOT_SUPPORTED_BY_ZM (NOTICE)
  • ZM_DS09_MISSING_RRSIG_IN_RESPONSE (ERROR)
  • ZM_DS09_NO_MATCHING_DNSKEY (ERROR)
  • ZM_DS09_RRSIG_NOT_VALID_BY_DNSKEY (ERROR)
  • ZM_DS09_SOA_RRSIG_EXPIRED (ERROR)
  • ZM_DS09_SOA_RRSIG_NOT_YET_VALID (ERROR)
  • ZM_DS10_ALGO_NOT_SUPPORTED_BY_ZM (NOTICE)
  • ZM_DS10_ANSWER_VERIFY_ERROR (ERROR)
  • ZM_DS10_HAS_NSEC (INFO)
  • ZM_DS10_HAS_NSEC3 (INFO)
  • ZM_DS10_INCONSISTENT_NSEC_NSEC3 (ERROR)
  • ZM_DS10_MISSING_NSEC_NSEC3 (ERROR)
  • ZM_DS10_MIXED_NSEC_NSEC3 (ERROR)
  • ZM_DS10_NAME_NOT_COVERED_BY_NSEC (ERROR)
  • ZM_DS10_NAME_NOT_COVERED_BY_NSEC3 (ERROR)
  • ZM_DS10_NON_EXISTENT_RESPONSE_ERROR (ERROR)
  • ZM_DS10_NSEC3_MISSING_SIGNATURE (ERROR)
  • ZM_DS10_NSEC3_RRSIG_VERIFY_ERROR (ERROR)
  • ZM_DS10_NSEC_MISSING_SIGNATURE (ERROR)
  • ZM_DS10_NSEC_RRSIG_VERIFY_ERROR (ERROR)
  • ZM_DS10_UNSIGNED_ANSWER (ERROR)
  • ZM_DS13_ALGO_NOT_SIGNED_DNSKEY (ERROR)
  • ZM_DS13_ALGO_NOT_SIGNED_NS (ERROR)
  • ZM_DS13_ALGO_NOT_SIGNED_SOA (ERROR)
  • ZM_DS15_HAS_CDNSKEY_NO_CDS (NOTICE)
  • ZM_DS15_HAS_CDS_AND_CDNSKEY (INFO)
  • ZM_DS15_HAS_CDS_NO_CDNSKEY (NOTICE)
  • ZM_DS15_INCONSISTENT_CDNSKEY (ERROR)
  • ZM_DS15_INCONSISTENT_CDS (ERROR)
  • ZM_DS15_MISMATCH_CDS_CDNSKEY (ERROR)
  • ZM_DS15_NO_CDS_CDNSKEY (INFO)
  • ZM_DS16_CDS_INVALID_RRSIG (ERROR)
  • ZM_DS16_CDS_MATCHES_NON_SEP_DNSKEY (ERROR)
  • ZM_DS16_CDS_MATCHES_NON_ZONE_DNSKEY (ERROR)
  • ZM_DS16_CDS_MATCHES_NO_DNSKEY (ERROR)
  • ZM_DS16_CDS_NOT_SIGNED_BY_CDS (ERROR)
  • ZM_DS16_CDS_SIGNED_BY_UNKNOWN_DNSKEY (ERROR)
  • ZM_DS16_CDS_UNSIGNED (ERROR)
  • ZM_DS16_CDS_WITHOUT_DNSKEY (ERROR)
  • ZM_DS16_DELETE_CDS (INFO)
  • ZM_DS16_DNSKEY_NOT_SIGNED_BY_CDS (ERROR)

  • ZM_DS17_CDNSKEY_INVALID_RRSIG (ERROR)

  • ZM_DS17_CDNSKEY_MATCHES_NO_DNSKEY (ERROR)
  • ZM_DS17_CDNSKEY_NOT_SIGNED_BY_CDNSKEY (ERROR)
  • ZM_DS17_CDNSKEY_SIGNED_BY_UNKNOWN_DNSKEY (ERROR)
  • ZM_DS17_CDNSKEY_UNSIGNED (ERROR)
  • ZM_DS17_CDNSKEY_WITHOUT_DNSKEY (ERROR)
  • ZM_DS17_DELETE_CDNSKEY (INFO)
  • ZM_DS17_DNSKEY_NOT_SIGNED_BY_CDNSKEY (ERROR)

  • ZM_DS18_NO_MATCH_CDNSKEY_RRSIG_DS (ERROR)
  • ZM_DS18_NO_MATCH_CDS_RRSIG_DS (ERROR)
  • ZM_KEY_SIZE_OK (INFO)
