  • ZM_NO_RESPONSE_DNSKEY (ERROR)

4.2.6. Input parameters

The test cases used by this suite require the following input parameters:

  1. dns.nameservers (object)
  2. dnssec.dsRecords (object)

4.2.7. Sequence diagram

4.3. Registration Data Access Protocol (RDAP)

4.3.1. Description

The RDAP test suite validates the RDAP service of the TLD or RSP.

The RDAP test suite is derived from the test specification of the RDAP Conformance Tool. As with the DNS and DNSSEC tests, the test IDs can be mapped to the test IDs in this document by removing the rdap-NN- prefix.

Pass/fail criteria

As with all other test suites, for this test suite to pass all the listed test cases MUST pass: if any fail, then the suite as a whole will fail.

4.3.2. Test cases

This suite uses the following test cases:

  1. rdap-01-domainCaseFoldingValidation - Domain label case folding validation
  2. rdap-02-domainNameValidation - Domain Name validation
  3. rdap-03-ipv4Validation - IPv4 address validation
  4. rdap-04-ipv6Validation - IPv6 address validation
  5. rdap-05-stdRdapAsEventActorValidation - asEventActor Validation
  6. rdap-06-stdRdapConformanceValidation - RDAP Conformance validation
  7. rdap-07-stdRdapDomainLookupValidation - Domain Lookup Validation
  8. rdap-08-stdRdapEntitiesValidation - Entities validation
  9. rdap-09-stdRdapEntityLookupValidation - Entity lookup validation
  10. rdap-10-stdRdapErrorResponseBodyValidation - Error Response Body
  11. rdap-11-stdRdapEventsValidation - Events Validation
  12. rdap-12-stdRdapHelpValidation - Help validation
  13. rdap-13-stdRdapIpAddressesValidation - IP Addresses Validation
  14. rdap-14-stdRdapLanguageIdentifierValidation - Language Identifier Validation
  15. rdap-15-stdRdapLdhNameValidation - LDH name
  16. rdap-16-stdRdapLinksValidation - Links validation
  17. rdap-17-stdRdapNameserverLookupValidation - Nameserver lookup validation
  18. rdap-18-stdRdapNameserversSearchValidation - RFC7159RDAP_RFCsNameservers search validation
  19. rdap-19-stdRdapNoticesRemarksValidation - Notices and Remarks Validation
  20. rdap-20-stdRdapPort43WhoisServerValidation - Port 43 WHOIS Server
  21. rdap-21-stdRdapPublicIdsValidation - Public IDs validation
  22. rdap-22-stdRdapRolesValidation - Roles validation
  23. rdap-23-stdRdapSecureDnsValidation - Secure DNS validation
  24. rdap-24-stdRdapStatusValidation - Status validation
  25. rdap-25-stdRdapUnicodeNameValidation - RFC7159RDAP_RFCsIDNA_RFCsUnicode name
  26. rdap-26-stdRdapVariantsValidation - Variants validation
  27. rdap-27-webUriValidation - Web URI validation

4.3.3. Test plans

This suite is used by the following test plans:

  1. Pre-Delegation Test
  2. RSP Change Test
  3. Main RSP Evaluation Test

4.3.4. Resources

The following resources may be required to prepare for this test plan:

  • None specified.

4.3.5. Errors

This test suite may produce the following errors:

  • None specified.

4.3.6. Input parameters

The test cases used by this suite require the following input parameters:

  1. rdap.baseURLs (object)
  2. rdap.testDomains (object)
  3. rdap.testEntities (object)
  4. rdap.testNameservers (object)

4.3.7. Sequence diagram

4.4. Extensible Provisioning Protocol (EPP)

4.4.1. Description

The EPP test suite validates the EPP service of the TLD or RSP. It verifies that the EPP server properly implements the query and transform commands specified for domain names (and optionally host and contact objects) and the mandatory extensions.

Pass/fail criteria

As with all other test suites, for this test suite to pass all the listed test cases MUST pass: if any fail, then the suite as a whole will fail.

4.4.2. Test cases

This suite uses the following test cases:

  1. epp-01 - EPP server **MUST** have at least one A record
  2. epp-02 - EPP server **MUST** have at least one AAAA record
  3. epp-03 - All IP addresses **MUST** accept TCP connections on port 700
  4. epp-04 - All service ports support TLSv1.2 or higher
  5. epp-05 - All service ports **MUST NOT** support TLSv1.1 or earlier
  6. epp-06 - All service ports **MUST** offer a valid certificate issued by a trusted CA
  7. epp-07 - TLS certificate **MUST** be valid
  8. epp-08 - TLS certificate **MUST** be valid for the server name
  9. epp-09 - All service ports **MUST** send a <greeting> frame after successful connection
  10. epp-10 - All server responses **MUST** validate against the XML schema
  11. epp-11 - <svID> element in the <greeting> **MUST** be valid
  12. epp-12 - <svDate> element in the <greeting> **MUST** be valid
  13. epp-13 - <version> element in the <greeting> **MUST** be valid
  14. epp-14 - <lang> element(s) in the <greeting> **MUST** be valid
  15. epp-15 - <objURI> element(s) in the <greeting> **MUST** be valid for the registry type
  16. epp-16 - <extURI> element(s) in the <greeting> **MUST** be valid
  17. epp-17 - <login> command **MUST** return a successful response
  18. epp-18 - <hello> command **MUST** return a <greeting>
  19. epp-19 - domain <check> command test
  20. epp-22 - host <check> command test (if applicable)
  21. epp-23 - contact <check> command test (if applicable for the registry type)
  22. epp-24 - contact <create> command test (if applicable for the registry type)
  23. epp-25 - contact <info> command test (if applicable for the registry type)
  24. epp-26 - contact <update> command test (if applicable for the registry type)
  25. epp-27 - contact <delete> command test (if applicable for the registry type)
  26. epp-28 - host <create> command test (if applicable)
  27. epp-29 - host <info> command test (if applicable)
  28. epp-30 - (intentionally ommitted)
  29. epp-31 - host <update> command test (if applicable)
  30. epp-31a - host rename test (if applicable)
  31. epp-31b - host <delete> command test (if applicable)
  32. epp-32 - domain <create> command test
  33. epp-33 - domain <info> command test
  34. epp-34 - domain <update> command test
  35. epp-35 - domain <renew> command test
  36. epp-36 - domain <transfer> command test
  37. epp-37 - domain <delete> command test
  38. epp-39 - domain restore test (if applicable)

4.4.3. Test plans

This suite is used by the following test plans:

  1. Pre-Delegation Test
  2. RSP Change Test
  3. Main RSP Evaluation Test

4.4.4. Resources

The following resources may be required to prepare for this test plan:

  • epp.clientACL
  • epp.clientCertificate
  • epp.tlsCertificateStore

4.4.5. Errors

This test suite may produce the following errors:

  • None specified.

4.4.6. Input parameters

The test cases used by this suite require the following input parameters:

  1. epp.clid (string)
  2. epp.hostModel (string)
  3. epp.hostName (string)
  4. epp.pwd (string)
  5. epp.registeredContacts (array)
  6. epp.registeredNames (array)
  7. epp.registeredNameservers (array)
  8. epp.restoreReportRequired (boolean)
  9. epp.transferClid (string)
  10. epp.transferPwd (string)
  11. general.gracePeriodsSupported (boolean)
  12. general.minimalPublicDataSet (boolean)

4.4.7. Sequence diagram

4.5. Registry Data Escrow (RDE)

4.5.1. Description

The RDE test suite validates Registry Data Escrow deposits generated for the TLD or RSP. These deposits MUST comply with the specifications in the Registry Agreement and with RFC 8909 and RFC 9022.

Pass/fail criteria

As with all other test suites, for this test suite to pass all the listed test cases MUST pass: if any fail, then the suite as a whole will fail.

4.5.2. Test cases

This suite uses the following test cases:

  1. rde-01 - validate deposit filename format
  2. rde-02 - validate signature over deposit file
  3. rde-03 - decrypt deposit file(s)
  4. rde-04 - validate XML/CSV
  5. rde-05 - validate object types
  6. rde-06 - validate object counts
  7. rde-07 - validate domain objects
  8. rde-08 - validate host objects (if applicable)
  9. rde-09 - validate contact objects (if applicable)
  10. rde-10 - validate registrar objects
  11. rde-11 - validate IDN table objects (if applicable)
  12. rde-12 - validate NNDN objects
  13. rde-13 - validate EPP parameters object
  14. rde-14 - validate policy object (if applicable)

4.5.3. Test plans

This suite is used by the following test plans:

  1. Pre-Delegation Test
  2. RSP Change Test
  3. Main RSP Evaluation Test

4.5.4. Resources

The following resources may be required to prepare for this test plan:

  • epp.clientACL
  • epp.clientCertificate
  • rde.encryptionKey

4.5.5. Errors

This test suite may produce the following errors:

  • None specified.

4.5.6. Input parameters

The test cases used by this suite require the following input parameters:

  1. epp.hostModel (string)
  2. epp.hostName (string)
  3. general.minimalPublicDataSet (boolean)
  4. rde.depositFile (file)
  5. rde.publicKey (file)
  6. rde.signatureFile (file)

4.5.7. Sequence diagram

4.6. Internationalized Domain Names (IDN)

4.6.1. Description

The RDE test suite validates the IDN table(s) for a TLD or RSP, including compliance with specifications for variant labels at the top- or second- level, and conformance with the IDN Guidelines.

Pass/fail criteria

As with all other test suites, for this test suite to pass all the listed test cases MUST pass: if any fail, then the suite as a whole will fail.

4.6.2. Test cases

This suite uses the following test cases:

  1. idn-01 - Label validation test
  2. idn-02 - Level 1 variant handling test
  3. idn-03 - Level 2 variant handling test
  4. idn-04 - Level 3 variant handling test

4.6.3. Test plans

This suite is used by the following test plans:

  1. Pre-Delegation Test
  2. RSP Change Test
  3. IDN Test

4.6.4. Resources

The following resources may be required to prepare for this test plan:

  • None specified.

4.6.5. Errors

This test suite may produce the following errors:

  • None specified.

4.6.6. Input parameters

The test cases used by this suite require the following input parameters:

  1. epp.clid (string)
  2. epp.hostName (string)
  3. epp.pwd (string)
  4. epp.transferClid (string)
  5. epp.transferPwd (string)
  6. general.minimalPublicDataSet (boolean)

4.6.7. Sequence diagram

4.7. SRS Gateway

4.7.1. Description

The SRS Gateway test suite validates the conformance of the Gateway registry infrastructure of a TLD or RSP, and the synchronisation between primary and gateway systems.

Pass/fail criteria

As with all other test suites, for this test suite to pass all the listed test cases MUST pass: if any fail, then the suite as a whole will fail.

4.7.2. Test cases

This suite uses the following test cases:

  1. srsgw-01 - IPv4 and IPv6 connectivity
  2. srsgw-02 - Host <create> synchronization (if applicable)
  3. srsgw-03 - Contact <create> synchronization (if applicable)
  4. srsgw-04 - Domain <create> synchronization
  5. srsgw-05 - Domain <renew> synchronisation
  6. srsgw-06 - Domain <transfer> synchronisation
  7. srsgw-07 - Domain <transfer> approval synchronisation
  8. srsgw-08 - Domain <delete> synchronisation
  9. srsgw-09 - Host <update> synchronization (if applicable)
  10. srsgw-10 - Host <delete> synchronization (if applicable)
  11. srsgw-11 - Contact <update> synchronization (if applicable)
  12. srsgw-12 - Contact <delete> synchronization (if applicable)
  13. srsgw-13 - Domain RDAP synchronization
  14. srsgw-14 - Nameserver RDAP synchronization
  15. srsgw-15 - Registrar RDAP synchronization

4.7.3. Test plans

This suite is used by the following test plans:

  1. SRS Gateway Test
  2. SRS Gateway RSP Evaluation Test

4.7.4. Resources

The following resources may be required to prepare for this test plan:

  • epp.clientACL
  • epp.clientCertificate

4.7.5. Errors

This test suite may produce the following errors:

  • None specified.

4.7.6. Input parameters

The test cases used by this suite require the following input parameters:

  1. epp.clid (string)
  2. epp.hostModel (string)
  3. epp.hostName (string)
  4. epp.pwd (string)
  5. general.gracePeriodsSupported (boolean)
  6. general.minimalPublicDataSet (boolean)
  7. rdap.baseURLs (object)
  8. srsgw.eppClid (string)
  9. srsgw.eppHostName (string)
  10. srsgw.eppPwd (string)
  11. srsgw.eppTransferClid (string)
  12. srsgw.eppTransferPwd (string)
  13. srsgw.rdapBaseURLs (object)

4.7.7. Sequence diagram

4.8. DNSSEC Operations

4.8.1. Description

This test suite verifies the ability of an RSP to carry out standard DNSSEC operational procedures while maintaining a chain of trust to the parent zone.

Pass/fail criteria

As with all other test suites, for this test suite to pass all the listed test cases MUST pass: if any fail, then the suite as a whole will fail.

4.8.2. Test cases

This suite uses the following test cases:

  1. dnssecOps01-ZSKRollover - ZSK rollover
  2. dnssecOps02-KSKRollover - KSK rollover
  3. dnssecOps03-AlgorithmRollover - algorithm rollover

4.8.3. Test plans

This suite is used by the following test plans:

  1. DNSSEC RSP Evaluation Test

4.8.4. Resources

The following resources may be required to prepare for this test plan:

  • None specified.

4.8.5. Errors

This test suite may produce the following errors:

  • None specified.

4.8.6. Input parameters

The test cases used by this suite require the following input parameters:

  1. dnssecOps.algorithmRolloverZone (string)
  2. dnssecOps.csk (boolean)
  3. dnssecOps.kskRolloverZone (string)
  4. dnssecOps.zskRolloverZone (string)

4.8.7. Sequence diagram

4.9. Minimum Rights Protection Mechanisms (RPMs)

4.9.1. Description

This test suite verifies an RSP’s support for the minimum Rights Protection Mechanisms (RPMs), and the Launch Extension (RFC 8334) if supported.

Pass/fail criteria

As with all other test suites, for this test suite to pass all the listed test cases MUST pass: if any fail, then the suite as a whole will fail.

4.9.2. Test cases

This suite uses the following test cases:

  1. minimumRPMs-01 - Sunrise domain <check> command test
  2. minimumRPMs-02 - Claims <check> command test
  3. minimumRPMs-03 - Trademark <check> command test
  4. minimumRPMs-04 - Sunrise domain/launch application <create> command test
  5. minimumRPMs-05 - Sunrise launch application <info> command test
  6. minimumRPMs-06 - Trademark claims domain <create> command test
  7. minimumRPMs-07 - LORDN submission test

4.9.3. Test plans

This suite is used by the following test plans:

  1. Main RSP Evaluation Test

4.9.4. Resources

The following resources may be required to prepare for this test plan:

  • None specified.

4.9.5. Errors

This test suite may produce the following errors:

  • EPP_CONNECT_ERROR (ERROR)
  • EPP_GENERIC_COMMAND_ERROR (ERROR)
  • EPP_LOGIN_ERROR (ERROR)
  • EPP_SCHEMA_VALIDATION_ERROR (ERROR)
  • EPP_SUNRISE_AVAILABILITY_CHECK_INVALID_RESULT (ERROR)

4.9.6. Input parameters

The test cases used by this suite require the following input parameters:

  1. epp.clid (string)
  2. epp.hostModel (string)
  3. epp.hostName (string)
  4. epp.pwd (string)
  5. general.minimalPublicDataSet (boolean)
  6. general.sunriseModels (string)

4.9.7. Sequence diagram

4.10. Standard Integration Test

4.10.1. Description

This test suite verifies that the critical registry services of the TLD are properly integrated and functioning within the requirements of the Service Level Agreement.

Pass/fail criteria

As with all other test suites, for this test suite to pass all the listed test cases MUST pass: if any fail, then the suite as a whole will fail.

4.10.2. Test cases

This suite uses the following test cases:

  1. integration-01 - EPP -> RDAP Integration Test
  2. integration-02 - EPP -> DNS Integration Test
  3. integration-03 - EPP -> RDE Integration Test

4.10.3. Test plans

  1. Pre-Delegation Test
  2. RSP Change Test

  • integration.rdeSFTPPublicKey

  2. integration.rdeSFTPDirectory (string)

  4. integration.rdeSFTPUsername (string)
  5. integration.rriACL (array)
  6. rdap.baseURLs (object)

4.10.7. Sequence diagram

5. Resources

5.1. epp.clientACL

5.1.1. Description

A list of IPv4 and IPv6 address(es) from which client connections to the operator’s EPP server will be made. The list is a plain text file with each IP address on a separate line.

5.1.2. URL

  • https://rst.icann.org/v2/resources/epp.clientACL.txt

5.2. epp.clientCertificate

5.2.1. Description

RFC 5734 requires servers to perform authentication of clients by means of a client certificate. Operators MUST configure their systems to permit the test client to connect using the certificate found at this URL.

5.2.2. URL

  • https://rst.icann.org/v2/resources/epp.clientCertificate.pem

5.3. epp.tlsCertificateStore

5.3.1. Description

A PEM-formatted file containing the CA certificates trusted by Mozilla. For more information, see https://curl.se/docs/caextract.html.

EPP servers MUST use a certificate that has a chain of trust to one of the CAs present in this file.

5.3.2. URL

  • https://rst.icann.org/v2/resources/epp.tlsCertificateStore.pem

5.4. integration.rdeSFTPACL

5.4.1. Description

A list of IPv4 and IPv6 address(es) from which client connections to the operator’s SFTP server will be made. The list is a plain text file with each IP address on a separate line.

5.4.2. URL

  • https://rst.icann.org/v2/resources/integration.rdeSFTPACL.txt

5.5. integration.rdeSFTPPublicKey

5.5.1. Description

The SSH public key that will be used to authenticate connections to the operator’s SFTP server.

5.5.2. URL

  • https://rst.icann.org/v2/resources/integration.rdeSFTPPublicKey.pem

5.6. rde.encryptionKey

5.6.1. Description

RDE deposit files MUST be encrypted using OpenPGP (RFC 4880). The PGP key that MUST be used to encrypt the escrow deposit file may be found at this URL.

5.6.2. URL

  • https://rst.icann.org/v2/resources/rde.encryptionKey.asc

6. Test Cases

6.1. dns-address01 - Name server address must be globally routable

6.1.1. Description

This test case comes from version v2023.1.4 of Zonemaster. For more information, see https://github.com/zonemaster/zonemaster/blob/v2023.1.4/docs/public/specifications/tests/Address-TP/address01.md.

Objective

In order for the domain and its resources to be accessible, authoritative name servers must have addresses in the routable public addressing space.

IANA is responsible for global coordination of the IP addressing system. Aside its address allocation activities, it maintains reserved address ranges for special uses. These ranges can be categorized into three types : Special purpose IPv4 addresses, Special purpose IPv6 addresses and Multicast reserved addresses.

Pass/fail criteria

If one name server has one of its addresses matches a forbidden address block, the test fails. If all the name server addresses are outside these forbidden blocks, the test case succeeds.

6.1.2. Errors

This test case may produce the following errors:

  • None specified.

6.1.3. Input parameters

This test case requires the following input parameters:

  • None specified.

6.1.4. Resources

The following resources may be required to prepare for this test plan:

  • None specified.

6.1.5. Dependencies

This test case requires the following test cases to have successfully passed:

  • None specified.

6.1.6. Dependants

The following test cases require this test case to have successfully passed:

  • None specified.

6.1.7. Test suites

This test case is used in the following test suites:

  • Authoritative DNS Service

6.2. dns-address02 - Reverse DNS entry exists for name server IP address

6.2.1. Description

This test case comes from version v2023.1.4 of Zonemaster. For more information, see https://github.com/zonemaster/zonemaster/blob/v2023.1.4/docs/public/specifications/tests/Address-TP/address02.md.

Objective

Some anti-spam techniques use reverse DNS lookup to allow incoming traffic. In order to prevent name servers to be blocked or blacklisted, DNS administrators should publish PTR records associated to name server addresses.

[technical reference to be found]

Pass/fail criteria

If the test case succeeds, its result is a list of addresses with corresponding hostnames which are the result of the PTR queries performed. The result could be represented as a hash table where the keys are the IP addresses and the values their corresponding hostnames.

6.2.2. Errors

This test case may produce the following errors:

  • None specified.

6.2.3. Input parameters

This test case requires the following input parameters:

  • None specified.

6.2.4. Resources

The following resources may be required to prepare for this test plan:

  • None specified.

6.2.5. Dependencies

This test case requires the following test cases to have successfully passed:

  • None specified.

6.2.6. Dependants

The following test cases require this test case to have successfully passed:

  • None specified.

6.2.7. Test suites

This test case is used in the following test suites:

  • Authoritative DNS Service

6.3. dns-address03 - Reverse DNS entry matches name server name

6.3.1. Description

This test case comes from version v2023.1.4 of Zonemaster. For more information, see https://github.com/zonemaster/zonemaster/blob/v2023.1.4/docs/public/specifications/tests/Address-TP/address03.md.

Objective

Some anti-spam techniques use reverse DNS lookup to allow incoming traffic. In order to prevent name servers to be blocked or blacklisted, DNS administrators should publish PTR records associated with the name server addresses.

Moreover, as mentioned in paragraph 2.1 of RFC 1912 when a PTR record exists, it must match the host name.

Pass/fail criteria

Multiple addresses and multiple PTR records are allowed. The test succeeds if every name server address has one or more PTR records and one of these records matches the server name. If one address doesn’t match, the whole test case fails.

6.3.2. Errors

This test case may produce the following errors:

  • None specified.

6.3.3. Input parameters

This test case requires the following input parameters:

  • None specified.

6.3.4. Resources

The following resources may be required to prepare for this test plan:

  • None specified.

6.3.5. Dependencies

This test case requires the following test cases to have successfully passed:

  • None specified.

6.3.6. Dependants

The following test cases require this test case to have successfully passed:

  • None specified.

6.3.7. Test suites

This test case is used in the following test suites:

  • Authoritative DNS Service

6.4. dns-connectivity01 - UDP connectivity to name servers

6.4.1. Description

This test case comes from version v2023.1.4 of Zonemaster. For more information, see https://github.com/zonemaster/zonemaster/blob/v2023.1.4/docs/public/specifications/tests/Connectivity-TP/connectivity01.md.

Objective

UDP is the fundamental protocol to reach a general purpose name server hosting a zone, “DNS servers MUST be able to service UDP […]” (RFC 1123, section 6.1.3.2, page 75), also restated in RFC 7766, section 5.

This Test Case will verify if the name servers of Child Zone are reachable over UDP. The name servers tested are both those in the delegation of Child Zone and those in the NS records in the Child Zone itself.

Most Zonemaster Test Cases will query the name servers in the delegation or the name servers appointed by the NS records in the zone for the NS or SOA record, or both. It is crucial that problems are reported, but instead of letting several Test Cases report the same problems found, most Test Cases assume that this test case is run. Only this Test Case will report problems found in the following areas over UDP:

  • Name Server not responding to a query without EDNS.
  • Name Server not including SOA record of Child Zone in the answer section in the response on a SOA query for Child Zone.
  • Name Server not including NS record of Child Zone in the answer section in the response on an NS query for Child Zone.
  • Name Server not setting the AA flag in a response with SOA or NS in answer section.
  • Name Server responding with unexpected RCODE Name (any except “NoError”) on query for SOA or NS for Child Zone.

In addition, this test case will output a message if transport over IPv4 or IPv6 has been disabled.

Summary

Message Tag Level Arguments Message ID for message tag
ZM_CN01_IPV4_DISABLED NOTICE ns_list IPv4 is disabled. No DNS queries are sent to these name servers: “{ns_list}”.
ZM_CN01_IPV6_DISABLED NOTICE ns_list IPv6 is disabled. No DNS queries are sent to these name servers: “{ns_list}”.
ZM_CN01_MISSING_NS_RECORD_UDP ERROR (changed from WARNING) ns Nameserver {ns} reponds to a NS query with no NS records in the answer section over UDP.
ZM_CN01_MISSING_SOA_RECORD_UDP ERROR (changed from WARNING) ns Nameserver {ns} reponds to a SOA query with no SOA records in the answer section over UDP.
ZM_CN01_NO_RESPONSE_NS_QUERY_UDP ERROR (changed from WARNING) ns Nameserver {ns} does not respond to NS queries over UDP.
ZM_CN01_NO_RESPONSE_SOA_QUERY_UDP ERROR (changed from WARNING) ns Nameserver {ns} does not respond to SOA queries over UDP.
ZM_CN01_NO_RESPONSE_UDP ERROR (changed from WARNING) ns Nameserver {ns} does not respond to any queries over UDP.
ZM_CN01_NS_RECORD_NOT_AA_UDP ERROR (changed from WARNING) ns Nameserver {ns} does not give an authoritative response on an NS query over UDP.
ZM_CN01_SOA_RECORD_NOT_AA_UDP ERROR (changed from WARNING) ns Nameserver {ns} does not give an authoritative response on an SOA query over UDP.
ZM_CN01_UNEXPECTED_RCODE_NS_QUERY_UDP ERROR (changed from WARNING) ns, rcode Nameserver {ns} responds with an unexpected RCODE ({rcode}) on an NS query over UDP.
ZM_CN01_UNEXPECTED_RCODE_SOA_QUERY_UDP ERROR (changed from WARNING) ns, rcode Nameserver {ns} responds with an unexpected RCODE ({rcode}) on an SOA query over UDP.
ZM_CN01_WRONG_NS_RECORD_UDP ERROR (changed from WARNING) ns, domain_found, domain_expected Nameserver {ns} responds with a wrong owner name ({domain_found} instead of {domain_expected}) on NS queries over UDP.
ZM_CN01_WRONG_SOA_RECORD_UDP ERROR (changed from WARNING) ns, domain_found, domain_expected Nameserver {ns} responds with a wrong owner name ({domain_found} instead of {domain_expected}) on SOA queries over UDP.

The value in the Level column is the default severity level of the message. The severity level can be changed in the Zonemaster-Engine profile. Also see the Severity Level Definitions document.

The argument names in the Arguments column lists the arguments used in the message. The argument names are defined in the argument list.

Pass/fail criteria

The outcome of this Test Case is “fail” if there is at least one message with the severity level ERROR or CRITICAL.

The outcome of this Test Case is “warning” if there is at least one message with the severity level WARNING, but no message with severity level ERROR or CRITICAL.

In other cases, no message or only messages with severity level INFO or NOTICE, the outcome of this Test Case is “pass”.

6.4.2. Errors

This test case may produce the following errors:

  • ZM_CN01_IPV4_DISABLED (NOTICE)
  • ZM_CN01_IPV6_DISABLED (NOTICE)
  • ZM_CN01_MISSING_NS_RECORD_UDP (ERROR)
  • ZM_CN01_MISSING_SOA_RECORD_UDP (ERROR)
  • ZM_CN01_NO_RESPONSE_NS_QUERY_UDP (ERROR)
  • ZM_CN01_NO_RESPONSE_SOA_QUERY_UDP (ERROR)
  • ZM_CN01_NO_RESPONSE_UDP (ERROR)
  • ZM_CN01_NS_RECORD_NOT_AA_UDP (ERROR)
  • ZM_CN01_SOA_RECORD_NOT_AA_UDP (ERROR)
  • ZM_CN01_UNEXPECTED_RCODE_NS_QUERY_UDP (ERROR)
  • ZM_CN01_UNEXPECTED_RCODE_SOA_QUERY_UDP (ERROR)
  • ZM_CN01_WRONG_NS_RECORD_UDP (ERROR)
  • ZM_CN01_WRONG_SOA_RECORD_UDP (ERROR)

6.4.3. Input parameters

This test case requires the following input parameters:

  • None specified.

6.4.4. Resources

The following resources may be required to prepare for this test plan:

  • None specified.

6.4.5. Dependencies

This test case requires the following test cases to have successfully passed:

  • None specified.

6.4.6. Dependants

The following test cases require this test case to have successfully passed:

  • None specified.

6.4.7. Test suites

This test case is used in the following test suites:

  • Authoritative DNS Service

6.5. dns-connectivity02 - TCP connectivity to name servers

6.5.1. Description

This test case comes from version v2023.1.4 of Zonemaster. For more information, see https://github.com/zonemaster/zonemaster/blob/v2023.1.4/docs/public/specifications/tests/Connectivity-TP/connectivity02.md.

Objective

TCP is a protocol to reach a general purpose name server hosting a zone, “All general-purpose DNS implementations MUST support […] TCP transport” (RFC 7766, section 5).

This Test Case will verify if the name servers of Child Zone are reachable over TCP. The name servers tested are both those in the delegation of Child Zone and those in the NS records in the Child Zone itself.

This Test Case will mimic the tests done by Connectivity01, but over TCP instead:

  • Name Server responding to a query.
  • Name Server including SOA record of Child Zone in the answer section in the response on a SOA query for Child Zone.
  • Name Server including NS record of Child Zone in the answer section in the response on an NS query for Child Zone.
  • Name Server setting the AA flag in a response with SOA or NS in answer section.
  • Name Server responding with expected RCODE Name (“NoError”) on query for SOA or NS for Child Zone.

Summary

Message Tag Level Arguments Message ID for message tag
ZM_CN02_MISSING_NS_RECORD_TCP ERROR (changed from WARNING) ns Nameserver {ns} reponds to a NS query with no NS records in the answer section over TCP.
ZM_CN02_MISSING_SOA_RECORD_TCP ERROR (changed from WARNING) ns Nameserver {ns} reponds to a SOA query with no SOA records in the answer section over TCP.
ZM_CN02_NO_RESPONSE_NS_QUERY_TCP ERROR (changed from WARNING) ns Nameserver {ns} does not respond to NS queries over TCP.
ZM_CN02_NO_RESPONSE_SOA_QUERY_TCP ERROR (changed from WARNING) ns Nameserver {ns} does not respond to SOA queries over TCP.
ZM_CN02_NO_RESPONSE_TCP ERROR (changed from WARNING) ns Nameserver {ns} does not respond to any queries over TCP.
ZM_CN02_NS_RECORD_NOT_AA_TCP ERROR (changed from WARNING) ns Nameserver {ns} does not give an authoritative response on an NS query over TCP.
ZM_CN02_SOA_RECORD_NOT_AA_TCP ERROR (changed from WARNING) ns Nameserver {ns} does not give an authoritative response on an SOA query over TCP.
ZM_CN02_UNEXPECTED_RCODE_NS_QUERY_TCP ERROR (changed from WARNING) ns, rcode Nameserver {ns} responds with an unexpected RCODE ({rcode}) on an NS query over TCP.
ZM_CN02_UNEXPECTED_RCODE_SOA_QUERY_TCP ERROR (changed from WARNING) ns, rcode Nameserver {ns} responds with an unexpected RCODE ({rcode}) on an SOA query over TCP.
ZM_CN02_WRONG_NS_RECORD_TCP ERROR (changed from WARNING) ns, , domain_found, domain_expected Nameserver {ns} responds with a wrong owner name ({domain_found} instead of {domain_expected}) on NS queries over TCP.
ZM_CN02_WRONG_SOA_RECORD_TCP ERROR (changed from WARNING) ns, , domain_found, domain_expected Nameserver {ns} responds with a wrong owner name ({domain_found} instead of {domain_expected}) on SOA queries over TCP.

The value in the Level column is the default severity level of the message. The severity level can be changed in the Zonemaster-Engine profile. Also see the Severity Level Definitions document.

The argument names in the Arguments column lists the arguments used in the message. The argument names are defined in the argument list.

Pass/fail criteria

The outcome of this Test Case is “fail” if there is at least one message with the severity level ERROR or CRITICAL.

The outcome of this Test Case is “warning” if there is at least one message with the severity level WARNING, but no message with severity level ERROR or CRITICAL.

In other cases, no message or only messages with severity level INFO or NOTICE, the outcome of this Test Case is “pass”.

6.5.2. Errors

This test case may produce the following errors:

  • ZM_CN02_MISSING_NS_RECORD_TCP (ERROR)
  • ZM_CN02_MISSING_SOA_RECORD_TCP (ERROR)
  • ZM_CN02_NO_RESPONSE_NS_QUERY_TCP (ERROR)
  • ZM_CN02_NO_RESPONSE_SOA_QUERY_TCP (ERROR)
  • ZM_CN02_NO_RESPONSE_TCP (ERROR)
  • ZM_CN02_NS_RECORD_NOT_AA_TCP (ERROR)
  • ZM_CN02_SOA_RECORD_NOT_AA_TCP (ERROR)
  • ZM_CN02_UNEXPECTED_RCODE_NS_QUERY_TCP (ERROR)
  • ZM_CN02_UNEXPECTED_RCODE_SOA_QUERY_TCP (ERROR)
  • ZM_CN02_WRONG_NS_RECORD_TCP (ERROR)
  • ZM_CN02_WRONG_SOA_RECORD_TCP (ERROR)

6.5.3. Input parameters

This test case requires the following input parameters:

  • None specified.

6.5.4. Resources

The following resources may be required to prepare for this test plan:

  • None specified.

6.5.5. Dependencies

This test case requires the following test cases to have successfully passed:

  • None specified.

6.5.6. Dependants

The following test cases require this test case to have successfully passed:

  • None specified.

6.5.7. Test suites

This test case is used in the following test suites:

  • Authoritative DNS Service

6.6. dns-connectivity03 - AS Diversity

6.6.1. Description

This test case comes from version v2023.1.4 of Zonemaster. For more information, see https://github.com/zonemaster/zonemaster/blob/v2023.1.4/docs/public/specifications/tests/Connectivity-TP/connectivity03.md.

Objective

The objective in this test is to verify that all IP addresses of the domain’s authoritative name servers are announced from different ASNs (autonomous system number). See RFC 1930 and Wikipedia for an explanation of AS (autonomous system).

This test is done separately on IPv4 and IPv6, and both must match the criterion.

RFC 2182, section 3.1, clearly specifies that distinct authoritative name servers for a child domain should be placed in different topological and geographical locations. The objective is to minimise the likelihood of a single failure disabling all of them.

Pass/fail criteria

The outcome of this Test Case is “fail” if there is at least one message with the severity level ERROR or CRITICAL.

The outcome of this Test Case is “warning” if there is at least one message with the severity level WARNING, but no message with severity level ERROR or CRITICAL.

In other cases the outcome of this Test Case is “pass”.

Message Default severity level
ZM_EMPTY_ASN_SET ERROR
ZM_ERROR_ASN_DATABASE ERROR
ZM_IPV4_ONE_ASN ERROR (changed from WARNING)
ZM_IPV4_SAME_ASN NOTICE
ZM_IPV4_DIFFERENT_ASN INFO
ZM_IPV6_ONE_ASN ERROR (changed from WARNING)
ZM_IPV6_SAME_ASN NOTICE
ZM_IPV6_DIFFERENT_ASN INFO

6.6.2. Errors

This test case may produce the following errors:

  • ZM_EMPTY_ASN_SET (ERROR)
  • ZM_ERROR_ASN_DATABASE (ERROR)
  • ZM_IPV4_DIFFERENT_ASN (INFO)
  • ZM_IPV4_ONE_ASN (ERROR)
  • ZM_IPV4_SAME_ASN (NOTICE)
  • ZM_IPV6_DIFFERENT_ASN (INFO)
  • ZM_IPV6_ONE_ASN (ERROR)
  • ZM_IPV6_SAME_ASN (NOTICE)

6.6.3. Input parameters

This test case requires the following input parameters:

  • None specified.

6.6.4. Resources

The following resources may be required to prepare for this test plan:

  • None specified.

6.6.5. Dependencies

This test case requires the following test cases to have successfully passed:

  • None specified.

6.6.6. Dependants

The following test cases require this test case to have successfully passed:

  • None specified.

6.6.7. Test suites

This test case is used in the following test suites:

  • Authoritative DNS Service

6.7. dns-connectivity04 - IP Prefix Diversity

6.7.1. Description

This test case comes from version v2023.1.4 of Zonemaster. For more information, see https://github.com/zonemaster/zonemaster/blob/v2023.1.4/docs/public/specifications/tests/Connectivity-TP/connectivity04.md.

Objective

The objective in this Test Case is to verify that all IP addresses of the domain’s authoritative name servers are announced from different IP prefixes.

This Test is done separately on IPv4 and IPv6, and both must match the criterion.

RFC 2182, section 3.1, clearly specifies that distinct authoritative name servers for a child domain should be placed in different topological and geographical locations. The objective is to minimise the likelihood of a single failure disabling all of them.

Summary

Message Tag Level Arguments Message ID for message tag
ZM_CN04_EMPTY_PREFIX_SET ERROR ns_ip Prefix database returned no information for IP address {ns_ip}.
ZM_CN04_ERROR_PREFIX_DATABASE ERROR ns_ip Prefix database error. No data to analyze for IP address {ns_ip}.
ZM_CN04_IPV4_SAME_PREFIX WARNING ns_list, ip_prefix The following name server(s) are announced in the same IPv4 prefix ({ip_prefix}): “{ns_list}”
ZM_CN04_IPV4_DIFFERENT_PREFIX INFO ns_list The following name server(s) are announced in unique IPv4 prefix(es): “{ns_list}”
ZM_CN04_IPV6_SAME_PREFIX WARNING ns_list, ip_prefix The following name server(s) are announced in the same IPv6 prefix ({ip_prefix}): “{ns_list}”
ZM_CN04_IPV6_DIFFERENT_PREFIX INFO ns_list The following name server(s) are announced in unique IPv6 prefix(es): “{ns_list}”

The value in the Level column is the default severity level of the message. The severity level can be changed in the Zonemaster-Engine Profile. Also see the Severity Level Definitions document.

The argument names in the Arguments column lists the arguments used in the message. The argument names are defined in the Argument List.

Pass/fail criteria

The outcome of this Test Case is “fail” if there is at least one message with the severity level ERROR or CRITICAL.

The outcome of this Test Case is “warning” if there is at least one message with the severity level WARNING, but no message with severity level ERROR or CRITICAL.

In other cases, no message or only messages with severity level INFO or NOTICE, the outcome of this Test Case is “pass”.

6.7.2. Errors

This test case may produce the following errors:

  • ZM_CN04_EMPTY_PREFIX_SET (ERROR)
  • ZM_CN04_ERROR_PREFIX_DATABASE (ERROR)
  • ZM_CN04_IPV4_DIFFERENT_PREFIX (INFO)
  • ZM_CN04_IPV4_SAME_PREFIX (WARNING)
  • ZM_CN04_IPV6_DIFFERENT_PREFIX (INFO)
  • ZM_CN04_IPV6_SAME_PREFIX (WARNING)

6.7.3. Input parameters

This test case requires the following input parameters:

  • None specified.

6.7.4. Resources

The following resources may be required to prepare for this test plan:

  • None specified.

6.7.5. Dependencies

This test case requires the following test cases to have successfully passed:

  • None specified.

6.7.6. Dependants

The following test cases require this test case to have successfully passed:

  • None specified.

6.7.7. Test suites

This test case is used in the following test suites:

  • Authoritative DNS Service

6.8. dns-consistency01 - SOA serial number consistency

6.8.1. Description

This test case comes from version v2023.1.4 of Zonemaster. For more information, see https://github.com/zonemaster/zonemaster/blob/v2023.1.4/docs/public/specifications/tests/Consistency-TP/consistency01.md.

Objective

For the data served by the authoritative name servers for a designated zone to be consistent, all authoritative name servers must serve the same SOA record for the designated zone.

If the serial number (explained in 3.3.13. of RFC 1035), which is part of the SOA record, is not consistent between authoritative servers, there is a possibility that the data served is inconsistent. The reasons for this inconsistency may be different - such as misconfiguration, or as a result of slow propagation to the secondary name servers.

The objective of this test is to verify that the serial number is consistent between different authoritative name servers.

For reference purposes : RFC 1982 explains the serial number arithmetic, and section 4.3.5 of RFC 1034 explains the importance of serial number consistency.

Pass/fail criteria

The outcome of this Test Case is “fail” if there is at least one message with the severity level ERROR or CRITICAL.

The outcome of this Test Case is “warning” if there is at least one message with the severity level WARNING, but no message with severity level ERROR or CRITICAL.

In other cases the outcome of this Test Case is “pass”.

Message Default severity level (if message is emitted)
ZM_NO_RESPONSE ERROR (changed from DEBUG)
ZM_NO_RESPONSE_SOA_QUERY ERROR (changed from DEBUG)
ZM_ONE_SOA_SERIAL INFO
ZM_MULTIPLE_SOA_SERIALS ERROR (changed from WARNING)
ZM_MULTIPLE_SOA_SERIALS_OK NOTICE
ZM_SOA_SERIAL INFO
ZM_SOA_SERIAL_VARIATION NOTICE

6.8.2. Errors

This test case may produce the following errors:

  • ZM_MULTIPLE_SOA_SERIALS (ERROR)
  • ZM_MULTIPLE_SOA_SERIALS_OK (NOTICE)
  • ZM_NO_RESPONSE (ERROR)
  • ZM_NO_RESPONSE_SOA_QUERY (ERROR)
  • ZM_ONE_SOA_SERIAL (INFO)
  • ZM_SOA_SERIAL (INFO)
  • ZM_SOA_SERIAL_VARIATION (NOTICE)

6.8.3. Input parameters

This test case requires the following input parameters:

  • None specified.

6.8.4. Resources

The following resources may be required to prepare for this test plan:

  • None specified.

6.8.5. Dependencies

This test case requires the following test cases to have successfully passed:

  • None specified.

6.8.6. Dependants

The following test cases require this test case to have successfully passed:

  • None specified.

6.8.7. Test suites

This test case is used in the following test suites:

  • Authoritative DNS Service

6.9. dns-consistency02 - SOA RNAME consistency

6.9.1. Description

This test case comes from version v2023.1.4 of Zonemaster. For more information, see https://github.com/zonemaster/zonemaster/blob/v2023.1.4/docs/public/specifications/tests/Consistency-TP/consistency02.md.

Objective

All authoritative name servers must serve the same SOA record for the tested domain (section 4.2.1 of RFC 1034). As per section 3.3.13 of RFC 1035, the RNAME field in the SOA RDATA refers to the administrative contact. An inconsistency in the administrative contact for the domain might result in operational failures being reported to different persons.

The objective of this test is to verify that the administrative contact is consistent between different authoritative name servers.

Pass/fail criteria

The outcome of this Test Case is “fail” if there is at least one message with the severity level ERROR or CRITICAL.

The outcome of this Test Case is “warning” if there is at least one message with the severity level WARNING, but no message with severity level ERROR or CRITICAL.

In other cases the outcome of this Test Case is “pass”.

Message Default severity level (if message is emitted)
ZM_NO_RESPONSE ERROR (changed from DEBUG)
ZM_NO_RESPONSE_SOA_QUERY ERROR (changed from DEBUG)
ZM_ONE_SOA_RNAME INFO
ZM_MULTIPLE_SOA_RNAMES ERROR (changed from NOTICE)

6.9.2. Errors

This test case may produce the following errors:

  • ZM_MULTIPLE_SOA_RNAMES (ERROR)
  • ZM_NO_RESPONSE (ERROR)
  • ZM_NO_RESPONSE_SOA_QUERY (ERROR)
  • ZM_ONE_SOA_RNAME (INFO)

6.9.3. Input parameters

This test case requires the following input parameters:

  • None specified.

6.9.4. Resources

The following resources may be required to prepare for this test plan:

  • None specified.

6.9.5. Dependencies

This test case requires the following test cases to have successfully passed:

  • None specified.

6.9.6. Dependants

The following test cases require this test case to have successfully passed:

  • None specified.

6.9.7. Test suites

This test case is used in the following test suites:

  • Authoritative DNS Service

6.10. dns-consistency03 - SOA timers consistency

6.10.1. Description

This test case comes from version v2023.1.4 of Zonemaster. For more information, see https://github.com/zonemaster/zonemaster/blob/v2023.1.4/docs/public/specifications/tests/Consistency-TP/consistency03.md.

Objective

All SOA record timer fields must be consistent across all authoritative name servers. An inconsistency in these fields might result in operational inconsistencies for the designated zone.

There are other test cases that provide consistency tests for the other SOA fields:

  • CONSISTENCY01 (SOA Serial)
  • CONSISTENCY02 (RNAME)
  • CONSISTENCY06 (MNAME)

Pass/fail criteria

The outcome of this Test Case is “fail” if there is at least one message with the severity level ERROR or CRITICAL.

The outcome of this Test Case is “warning” if there is at least one message with the severity level WARNING, but no message with severity level ERROR or CRITICAL.

In other cases the outcome of this Test Case is “pass”.

Message Default severity level (if message is emitted)
ZM_NO_RESPONSE ERROR (changed from DEBUG)
ZM_NO_RESPONSE_SOA_QUERY ERROR (changed from DEBUG)
ZM_ONE_SOA_TIME_PARAMETER_SET INFO
ZM_MULTIPLE_SOA_TIME_PARAMETER_SET ERROR (changed from NOTICE)

6.10.2. Errors

This test case may produce the following errors:

  • ZM_MULTIPLE_SOA_TIME_PARAMETER_SET (ERROR)
  • ZM_NO_RESPONSE (ERROR)
  • ZM_NO_RESPONSE_SOA_QUERY (ERROR)
  • ZM_ONE_SOA_TIME_PARAMETER_SET (INFO)

6.10.3. Input parameters

This test case requires the following input parameters:

  • None specified.

6.10.4. Resources

The following resources may be required to prepare for this test plan:

  • None specified.

  • None specified.

  • None specified.

6.11. dns-consistency04 - Name server NS consistency

6.11.1. Description

This test case comes from version v2023.1.4 of Zonemaster. For more information, see https://github.com/zonemaster/zonemaster/blob/v2023.1.4/docs/public/specifications/tests/Consistency-TP/consistency04.md.

Objective

All authoritative name servers must serve the same NS record set for the tested domain, child zone (RFC 1034, section 4.2.2). Any inconsistencies in NS records described in RFC 1035, section 3.3.11, might result in operational failures.

The objective of this test is to verify that the NS records are consistent between all authoritative name servers of the child zone.

Two NS RR sets are considered to be equal if both sets have the same number of NS records, and for each NS record in one of the sets there is exactly one NS record with identical owner name, class, TTL and RDATA in the other NS set.

Pass/fail criteria

The outcome of this Test Case is “fail” if there is at least one message with the severity level ERROR or CRITICAL.

The outcome of this Test Case is “warning” if there is at least one message with the severity level WARNING, but no message with severity level ERROR or CRITICAL.

In other cases the outcome of this Test Case is “pass”.

Message Default severity level (if message is emitted)
ZM_NO_RESPONSE ERROR (changed from DEBUG)
ZM_NO_RESPONSE_NS_QUERY ERROR (changed from DEBUG)
ZM_ONE_NS_SET INFO
ZM_MULTIPLE_NS_SET ERROR (changed from NOTICE)

6.11.2. Errors

This test case may produce the following errors:

  • ZM_MULTIPLE_NS_SET (ERROR)
  • ZM_NO_RESPONSE (ERROR)
  • ZM_NO_RESPONSE_NS_QUERY (ERROR)
  • ZM_ONE_NS_SET (INFO)

6.11.3. Input parameters

This test case requires the following input parameters:

  • None specified.

6.11.4. Resources

The following resources may be required to prepare for this test plan:

  • None specified.

6.11.5. Dependencies

This test case requires the following test cases to have successfully passed:

  • None specified.

6.11.6. Dependants

The following test cases require this test case to have successfully passed:

  • None specified.

6.11.7. Test suites

This test case is used in the following test suites:

  • Authoritative DNS Service

6.12. dns-consistency05 - Consistency between glue and authoritative data

6.12.1. Description

This test case comes from version v2023.1.4 of Zonemaster. For more information, see https://github.com/zonemaster/zonemaster/blob/v2023.1.4/docs/public/specifications/tests/Consistency-TP/consistency05.md.

Objective

For name servers that have IP addresses listed as glue, the IP addresses must match the authoritative A and AAAA records for that host. This is an IANA name server requirement.

The objective of this test is to verify that the glue records in the delegation are consistent with authoritative data.

Pass/fail criteria

The outcome of this Test Case is “fail” if there is at least one message with the severity level ERROR or CRITICAL.

The outcome of this Test Case is “warning” if there is at least one message with the severity level WARNING, but no message with severity level ERROR or CRITICAL.

The outcome of this Test case is “pass” in all other cases.

Message Default severity level (when message is outputted)
ZM_CHILD_NS_FAILED ERROR (changed from DEBUG)
ZM_NO_RESPONSE ERROR (changed from DEBUG)
ZM_CHILD_ZONE_LAME ERROR (changed from ERROR)
ZM_IN_BAILIWICK_ADDR_MISMATCH ERROR (changed from ERROR)
ZM_OUT_OF_BAILIWICK_ADDR_MISMATCH ERROR (changed from ERROR)
ZM_EXTRA_ADDRESS_CHILD ERROR (changed from NOTICE)
ZM_ADDRESSES_MATCH INFO

6.12.2. Errors

This test case may produce the following errors:

  • ZM_ADDRESSES_MATCH (INFO)
  • ZM_CHILD_NS_FAILED (ERROR)
  • ZM_CHILD_ZONE_LAME (ERROR)
  • ZM_EXTRA_ADDRESS_CHILD (ERROR)
  • ZM_IN_BAILIWICK_ADDR_MISMATCH (ERROR)
  • ZM_NO_RESPONSE (ERROR)
  • ZM_OUT_OF_BAILIWICK_ADDR_MISMATCH (ERROR)

6.12.3. Input parameters

This test case requires the following input parameters:

  • None specified.

6.12.4. Resources

The following resources may be required to prepare for this test plan:

  • None specified.

6.12.5. Dependencies

This test case requires the following test cases to have successfully passed:

  • None specified.

6.12.6. Dependants

The following test cases require this test case to have successfully passed:

  • None specified.

6.12.7. Test suites

This test case is used in the following test suites:

  • Authoritative DNS Service

6.13. dns-consistency06 - SOA MNAME consistency

6.13.1. Description

This test case comes from version v2023.1.4 of Zonemaster. For more information, see https://github.com/zonemaster/zonemaster/blob/v2023.1.4/docs/public/specifications/tests/Consistency-TP/consistency06.md.

Objective

All authoritative name servers must serve the same SOA record (section 4.2.1) of RFC 1034 for the tested domain. As per section 3.3.13 of RFC 1035 the MNAME field in the SOA RDATA refers to the name of “the name server that was the original or primary source of data for this zone”. Inconsistency in MNAME of the domain might result in operational failures for applications that uses MNAME.

Pass/fail criteria

The outcome of this Test Case is “fail” if there is at least one message with the severity level ERROR or CRITICAL.

The outcome of this Test Case is “warning” if there is at least one message with the severity level WARNING, but no message with severity level ERROR or CRITICAL.

In other cases the outcome of this Test Case is “pass”.

Message Default severity level (if message is emitted)
ZM_NO_RESPONSE ERROR (changed from DEBUG)
ZM_NO_RESPONSE_SOA_QUERY ERROR (changed from DEBUG)
ZM_ONE_SOA_MNAME INFO
ZM_MULTIPLE_SOA_MNAMES ERROR (changed from NOTICE)

6.13.2. Errors

This test case may produce the following errors:

  • ZM_MULTIPLE_SOA_MNAMES (ERROR)
  • ZM_NO_RESPONSE (ERROR)
  • ZM_NO_RESPONSE_SOA_QUERY (ERROR)
  • ZM_ONE_SOA_MNAME (INFO)

6.13.3. Input parameters

This test case requires the following input parameters:

  • None specified.

6.13.4. Resources

The following resources may be required to prepare for this test plan:

  • None specified.

6.13.5. Dependencies

This test case requires the following test cases to have successfully passed:

  • None specified.

6.13.6. Dependants

The following test cases require this test case to have successfully passed:

  • None specified.

6.13.7. Test suites

This test case is used in the following test suites:

  • Authoritative DNS Service

6.14. dns-delegation01 - Minimum number of name servers

6.14.1. Description

This test case comes from version v2023.1.4 of Zonemaster. For more information, see https://github.com/zonemaster/zonemaster/blob/v2023.1.4/docs/public/specifications/tests/Delegation-TP/delegation01.md.

Objective

Section 4.1 of RFC 1034 specifies that there must be a minimum of two name servers for a domain. This test is done to verify this condition.

The RFC (RFC 1034) predates IPv6. Since IPv4 and IPv6 work as separate networks, this test case has been extended to test for two name servers that resolve into IPv4 addresses and IPv6 addresses respectively.

Both RFC 3901 (section 3) and RFC 4472 (section 1.3) states that a domain (zone) should be available over IPv4 for the time being. Therefore, it is by the default level in this test case considered to be more problematic not being available over IPv4 than not being available over IPv6.

Pass/fail criteria

The outcome of this Test Case is “fail” if there is at least one message with the severity level ERROR or CRITICAL.

The outcome of this Test Case is “warning” if there is at least one message with the severity level WARNING, but no message with severity level ERROR or CRITICAL.

Else the outcome of this Test Case is “pass”.

Message Default severity level
ZM_ENOUGH_IPV4_NS_CHILD INFO
ZM_ENOUGH_IPV4_NS_DEL INFO
ZM_ENOUGH_IPV6_NS_CHILD INFO
ZM_ENOUGH_IPV6_NS_DEL INFO
ZM_ENOUGH_NS_CHILD INFO
ZM_ENOUGH_NS_DEL INFO
ZM_NOT_ENOUGH_IPV4_NS_CHILD ERROR
ZM_NOT_ENOUGH_IPV4_NS_DEL ERROR
ZM_NOT_ENOUGH_IPV6_NS_CHILD ERROR
ZM_NOT_ENOUGH_IPV6_NS_DEL ERROR
ZM_NOT_ENOUGH_NS_CHILD ERROR
ZM_NOT_ENOUGH_NS_DEL ERROR
ZM_NO_IPV4_NS_CHILD ERROR (changed from WARNING)
ZM_NO_IPV4_NS_DEL ERROR (changed from WARNING)
ZM_NO_IPV6_NS_CHILD ERROR (changed from NOTICE)
ZM_NO_IPV6_NS_DEL ERROR (changed from NOTICE)

6.14.2. Errors

This test case may produce the following errors:

  • ZM_ENOUGH_IPV4_NS_CHILD (INFO)
  • ZM_ENOUGH_IPV4_NS_DEL (INFO)
  • ZM_ENOUGH_IPV6_NS_CHILD (INFO)
  • ZM_ENOUGH_IPV6_NS_DEL (INFO)
  • ZM_ENOUGH_NS_CHILD (INFO)
  • ZM_ENOUGH_NS_DEL (INFO)
  • ZM_NOT_ENOUGH_IPV4_NS_CHILD (ERROR)
  • ZM_NOT_ENOUGH_IPV4_NS_DEL (ERROR)
  • ZM_NOT_ENOUGH_IPV6_NS_CHILD (ERROR)
  • ZM_NOT_ENOUGH_IPV6_NS_DEL (ERROR)
  • ZM_NOT_ENOUGH_NS_CHILD (ERROR)
  • ZM_NOT_ENOUGH_NS_DEL (ERROR)
  • ZM_NO_IPV4_NS_CHILD (ERROR)
  • ZM_NO_IPV4_NS_DEL (ERROR)
  • ZM_NO_IPV6_NS_CHILD (ERROR)
  • ZM_NO_IPV6_NS_DEL (ERROR)

6.14.3. Input parameters

This test case requires the following input parameters:

  • None specified.

6.14.4. Resources

The following resources may be required to prepare for this test plan:

  • None specified.

6.14.5. Dependencies

This test case requires the following test cases to have successfully passed:

  • None specified.

6.14.6. Dependants

The following test cases require this test case to have successfully passed:

  • None specified.

6.14.7. Test suites

This test case is used in the following test suites:

  • Authoritative DNS Service

6.15. dns-delegation02 - Name servers must have distinct IP addresses

6.15.1. Description

This test case comes from version v2023.1.4 of Zonemaster. For more information, see https://github.com/zonemaster/zonemaster/blob/v2023.1.4/docs/public/specifications/tests/Delegation-TP/delegation02.md.

Objective

If the domain’s name servers use several different names, they can all be using the same IP address. This may be due to a configuration error, or a workaround for a certain policy restriction. This test case checks that the name servers used do not reuse the same IP addresses.

Section 4.1 of RFC 1034 says at least two name servers must be used for a delegation.

Pass/fail criteria

The outcome of this Test Case is “fail” if there is at least one message with the severity level ERROR or CRITICAL.

The outcome of this Test Case is “warning” if there is at least one message with the severity level WARNING, but no message with severity level ERROR or CRITICAL.

In other cases the outcome of this Test Case is “pass”.

Message Default severity level (if message is emitted)
ZM_DEL_NS_SAME_IP ERROR
ZM_CHILD_NS_SAME_IP ERROR
ZM_DEL_DISTINCT_NS_IP INFO
ZM_CHILD_DISTINCT_NS_IP INFO

6.15.2. Errors

This test case may produce the following errors:

  • ZM_CHILD_DISTINCT_NS_IP (INFO)
  • ZM_CHILD_NS_SAME_IP (ERROR)
  • ZM_DEL_DISTINCT_NS_IP (INFO)
  • ZM_DEL_NS_SAME_IP (ERROR)

6.15.3. Input parameters

This test case requires the following input parameters:

  • None specified.

6.15.4. Resources

The following resources may be required to prepare for this test plan:

  • None specified.

6.15.5. Dependencies

This test case requires the following test cases to have successfully passed:

  • None specified.

6.15.6. Dependants

The following test cases require this test case to have successfully passed:

  • None specified.

6.15.7. Test suites

This test case is used in the following test suites:

  • Authoritative DNS Service

6.16. dns-delegation03 - No truncation of referrals

6.16.1. Description

This test case comes from version v2023.1.4 of Zonemaster. For more information, see https://github.com/zonemaster/zonemaster/blob/v2023.1.4/docs/public/specifications/tests/Delegation-TP/delegation03.md.

Objective

The Domain Name System defaults to using UDP for queries and answers with a DNS payload limit of 512 octets (bytes). Larger replies cause an initial truncation indication leading to a subsequent handling via TCP with substantially higher overhead. EDNS0 is used to allow for larger UDP responses thus reducing the need for use of TCP.

But IANA still maintains that referrals from the parent zone name servers must fit into a non-EDNS0 UDP DNS packet.

Pass/fail criteria

The outcome of this Test Case is “fail” if there is at least one message with the severity level ERROR or CRITICAL.

The outcome of this Test Case is “warning” if there is at least one message with the severity level WARNING, but no message with severity level ERROR or CRITICAL.

In other cases the outcome of this Test Case is “pass”.

Message Default severity level of message
ZM_REFERRAL_SIZE_TOO_LARGE WARNING
ZM_REFERRAL_SIZE_OK INFO

6.16.2. Errors

This test case may produce the following errors:

  • ZM_REFERRAL_SIZE_OK (INFO)
  • ZM_REFERRAL_SIZE_TOO_LARGE (WARNING)

6.16.3. Input parameters

This test case requires the following input parameters:

  • None specified.

6.16.4. Resources

The following resources may be required to prepare for this test plan:

  • None specified.

6.16.5. Dependencies

This test case requires the following test cases to have successfully passed:

  • None specified.

6.16.6. Dependants

The following test cases require this test case to have successfully passed:

  • None specified.

6.16.7. Test suites

This test case is used in the following test suites:

  • Authoritative DNS Service

6.17. dns-delegation04 - Name server is authoritative

6.17.1. Description

This test case comes from version v2023.1.4 of Zonemaster. For more information, see https://github.com/zonemaster/zonemaster/blob/v2023.1.4/docs/public/specifications/tests/Delegation-TP/delegation04.md.

Objective

Subsection 6.1 of RFC 2181 specifies that the nameservers must answer authoritatively for the domain. Answers to queries to the name servers for the designated zone must have the “AA” bit set.

Pass/fail criteria

If all the name servers answer with the AA-bit set, then the test succeeds.

6.17.2. Errors

This test case may produce the following errors:

  • None specified.

6.17.3. Input parameters

This test case requires the following input parameters:

  • None specified.

6.17.4. Resources

The following resources may be required to prepare for this test plan:

  • None specified.

6.17.5. Dependencies

This test case requires the following test cases to have successfully passed:

  • None specified.

6.17.6. Dependants

The following test cases require this test case to have successfully passed:

  • None specified.

6.17.7. Test suites

This test case is used in the following test suites:

  • Authoritative DNS Service

6.18. dns-delegation05 - Name server must not point at CNAME alias

6.18.1. Description

This test case comes from version v2023.1.4 of Zonemaster. For more information, see https://github.com/zonemaster/zonemaster/blob/v2023.1.4/docs/public/specifications/tests/Delegation-TP/delegation05.md.

Objective

Name servers for a zone are defined in NS records. An NS record points at a name, i.e. the RDATA for an NS record is a domain name. That name is the name of the name server. RFC 2181, section 10.3, states that the name of the name server must not itself point at a CNAME.

The objective of this test is to verify that name servers of the tested domain (zone) do not point at CNAME records.

Pass/fail criteria

The outcome of this Test Case is “fail” if there is at least one message with the severity level ERROR or CRITICAL.

The outcome of this Test Case is “warning” if there is at least one message with the severity level WARNING, but no message with severity level ERROR or CRITICAL.

In other cases the outcome of this Test Case is “pass”.

Message Default severity level
ZM_NO_RESPONSE ERROR (changed from DEBUG)
ZM_UNEXPECTED_RCODE WARNING
ZM_NS_IS_CNAME ERROR
ZM_NO_NS_CNAME INFO

6.18.2. Errors

This test case may produce the following errors:

  • ZM_NO_NS_CNAME (INFO)
  • ZM_NO_RESPONSE (ERROR)
  • ZM_NS_IS_CNAME (ERROR)
  • ZM_UNEXPECTED_RCODE (WARNING)

6.18.3. Input parameters

This test case requires the following input parameters:

  • None specified.

6.18.4. Resources

The following resources may be required to prepare for this test plan:

  • None specified.

6.18.5. Dependencies

This test case requires the following test cases to have successfully passed:

  • None specified.

6.18.6. Dependants

The following test cases require this test case to have successfully passed:

  • None specified.

6.18.7. Test suites

This test case is used in the following test suites:

  • Authoritative DNS Service

6.19. dns-delegation06 - Existence of SOA

6.19.1. Description

This test case comes from version v2023.1.4 of Zonemaster. For more information, see https://github.com/zonemaster/zonemaster/blob/v2023.1.4/docs/public/specifications/tests/Delegation-TP/delegation06.md.

Objective

Section 6.1 of the RFC 2181 specifies that the SOA record is mandatory for every zone.

This test is intended to verify the prescence of a SOA record for the domain.

Pass/fail criteria

If there is a SOA record present for the domain this test case succeeds.

6.19.2. Errors

This test case may produce the following errors:

  • None specified.

6.19.3. Input parameters

This test case requires the following input parameters:

  • None specified.

6.19.4. Resources

The following resources may be required to prepare for this test plan:

  • None specified.

6.19.5. Dependencies

This test case requires the following test cases to have successfully passed:

  • None specified.

6.19.6. Dependants

The following test cases require this test case to have successfully passed:

  • None specified.

6.19.7. Test suites

This test case is used in the following test suites:

  • Authoritative DNS Service

6.20. dns-delegation07 - Parent glue name records present in child

6.20.1. Description

This test case comes from version v2023.1.4 of Zonemaster. For more information, see https://github.com/zonemaster/zonemaster/blob/v2023.1.4/docs/public/specifications/tests/Delegation-TP/delegation07.md.

Objective

If the list of name servers for a domain obtained from its parent are not found in its its child zone, then it leads to an inconsistency (section 2.3 of RIPE-114)

Pass/fail criteria

If the set of glue name records obtained are found in the list of name servers obtained from the child also, then the test succeeds

6.20.2. Errors

This test case may produce the following errors:

  • None specified.

6.20.3. Input parameters

This test case requires the following input parameters:

  • None specified.

6.20.4. Resources

The following resources may be required to prepare for this test plan:

  • None specified.

6.20.5. Dependencies

This test case requires the following test cases to have successfully passed:

  • None specified.

6.20.6. Dependants

The following test cases require this test case to have successfully passed:

  • None specified.

6.20.7. Test suites

This test case is used in the following test suites:

  • Authoritative DNS Service

6.21. dns-nameserver01 - A name server should not be a recursor

6.21.1. Description

This test case comes from version v2023.1.4 of Zonemaster. For more information, see https://github.com/zonemaster/zonemaster/blob/v2023.1.4/docs/public/specifications/tests/Nameserver-TP/nameserver01.md.

Objective

To ensure consistency in DNS, an authoritative name server should not be configured to do recursive lookups. Also, open recursive resolvers are considered bad internet practice due to their capability of assisting in large scale DDoS attacks. The introduction to RFC 5358 elaborates on mixing recursor and authoritative functionality, and the issue is further elaborated by D.J. Bernstein.

Section 2.5 of RFC 2870 have very specific requirement on disabling recursion functionality on root name servers.

Pass/fail criteria

The outcome of this Test Case is “fail” if there is at least one message with the severity level ERROR or CRITICAL.

The outcome of this Test Case is “warning” if there is at least one message with the severity level WARNING, but no message with severity level ERROR or CRITICAL.

In other cases the outcome of this Test Case is “pass”.

Message Default severity level (if message is emitted)
ZM_NO_RESPONSE ERROR (changed from DEBUG)
ZM_IS_A_RECURSOR ERROR
ZM_NO_RECURSOR INFO

6.21.2. Errors

This test case may produce the following errors:

  • ZM_IS_A_RECURSOR (ERROR)
  • ZM_NO_RECURSOR (INFO)
  • ZM_NO_RESPONSE (ERROR)

6.21.3. Input parameters

This test case requires the following input parameters:

  • None specified.

6.21.4. Resources

The following resources may be required to prepare for this test plan:

  • None specified.

6.21.5. Dependencies

This test case requires the following test cases to have successfully passed:

  • None specified.

6.21.6. Dependants

The following test cases require this test case to have successfully passed:

  • None specified.

6.21.7. Test suites

This test case is used in the following test suites:

  • Authoritative DNS Service

6.22. dns-nameserver02 - Test of EDNS0 support

6.22.1. Description

This test case comes from version v2023.1.4 of Zonemaster. For more information, see https://github.com/zonemaster/zonemaster/blob/v2023.1.4/docs/public/specifications/tests/Nameserver-TP/nameserver02.md.

Objective

EDNS(0) is a mechanism to announce capabilities of a DNS implementation, and is now basically required by any new functionality in DNS such as DNSSEC. EDNS(0) is standardized in RFC 6891.

This test case checks that all name servers has the capability to do EDNS(0) or if not, correctly replies to queries containing EDNS (OPT record).

Servers not supporting EDNS(0) must return FORMERR (RFC 6891, section 7):

Responders that choose not to implement the protocol extensions defined in this document MUST respond with a return code (RCODE) of FORMERR to messages containing an OPT record in the additional section and MUST NOT include an OPT record in the response.

Servers supporting EDNS(0) must reply with EDNS(0) (RFC 6891, section 6.1.1):

If an OPT record is present in a received request, compliant responders MUST include an OPT record in their respective responses.

To eliminating the risk of falsely classifying the server as not supporting EDNS due e.g. firewall issues, the UDP buffer size is set to 512 bytes (octets).

Pass/fail criteria

The outcome of this Test Case is “fail” if there is at least one message with the severity level ERROR or CRITICAL.

The outcome of this Test Case is “warning” if there is at least one message with the severity level WARNING, but no message with severity level ERROR or CRITICAL.

The outcome of this Test case is “pass” in all other cases.

Message Default severity level (when message is outputted)
ZM_NO_RESPONSE ERROR (changed from DEBUG)
ZM_NO_EDNS_SUPPORT ERROR (changed from WARNING)
ZM_BREAKS_ON_EDNS ERROR
ZM_EDNS_RESPONSE_WITHOUT_EDNS ERROR
ZM_EDNS_VERSION_ERROR ERROR
ZM_NS_ERROR ERROR (changed from WARNING)

6.22.2. Errors

This test case may produce the following errors:

  • ZM_BREAKS_ON_EDNS (ERROR)
  • ZM_EDNS_RESPONSE_WITHOUT_EDNS (ERROR)
  • ZM_EDNS_VERSION_ERROR (ERROR)
  • ZM_NO_EDNS_SUPPORT (ERROR)
  • ZM_NO_RESPONSE (ERROR)
  • ZM_NS_ERROR (ERROR)

6.22.3. Input parameters

This test case requires the following input parameters:

  • None specified.

6.22.4. Resources

The following resources may be required to prepare for this test plan:

  • None specified.

6.22.5. Dependencies

This test case requires the following test cases to have successfully passed:

  • None specified.

6.22.6. Dependants

The following test cases require this test case to have successfully passed:

  • None specified.

6.22.7. Test suites

This test case is used in the following test suites:

  • Authoritative DNS Service

6.23. dns-nameserver03 - Test availability of zone transfer (AXFR)

6.23.1. Description

This test case comes from version v2023.1.4 of Zonemaster. For more information, see https://github.com/zonemaster/zonemaster/blob/v2023.1.4/docs/public/specifications/tests/Nameserver-TP/nameserver03.md.

Objective

AXFR is a mechanism to transfer the whole content of a zone from a name server. Some people prefer to not disclose the whole content of a zone for various reasons, and thus wants the public name server infrastructure not do disclose the whole zone content to the public. This test case checks the availability of the AXFR mechanism.

AXFR is defined in its latest revision in RFC 5936.

Pass/fail criteria

If any name server for the domain allows a zone transfer using AXFR, this test case fails.

6.23.2. Errors

This test case may produce the following errors:

  • None specified.

6.23.3. Input parameters

This test case requires the following input parameters:

  • None specified.

6.23.4. Resources

The following resources may be required to prepare for this test plan:

  • None specified.

6.23.5. Dependencies

This test case requires the following test cases to have successfully passed:

  • None specified.

6.23.6. Dependants

The following test cases require this test case to have successfully passed:

  • None specified.

6.23.7. Test suites

This test case is used in the following test suites:

  • Authoritative DNS Service

6.24. dns-nameserver04 - Same source address

6.24.1. Description

This test case comes from version v2023.1.4 of Zonemaster. For more information, see https://github.com/zonemaster/zonemaster/blob/v2023.1.4/docs/public/specifications/tests/Nameserver-TP/nameserver04.md.

Objective

Responses from the authoritative name servers must contain same source IP address as the destination IP address of the initial query. This has been clarified in section 4 of RFC 2181.

Pass/fail criteria

If any response comes from another IP address than the query was sent to, this test case fails.

6.24.2. Errors

  • None specified.

6.25. dns-nameserver05 - Behaviour against AAAA query

6.25.1. Description

This test case comes from version v2023.1.4 of Zonemaster. For more information, see https://github.com/zonemaster/zonemaster/blob/v2023.1.4/docs/public/specifications/tests/Nameserver-TP/nameserver05.md.

Objective

Older implementations of authoritative name servers have shown different misbehaviours trying to answer queries for AAAA records, as described in RFC 4074. This test case is intended to find out if the name server authoritative for the domain shows any of these behaviours.

Pass/fail criteria

The outcome of this Test Case is “fail” if there is at least one message with the severity level ERROR or CRITICAL.

The outcome of this Test Case is “warning” if there is at least one message with the severity level WARNING, but no message with severity level ERROR or CRITICAL.

In other cases the outcome of this Test Case is “pass”.

Message Default severity level
ZM_AAAA_BAD_RDATA ERROR
ZM_AAAA_QUERY_DROPPED ERROR
ZM_AAAA_UNEXPECTED_RCODE ERROR
ZM_AAAA_WELL_PROCESSED INFO
ZM_A_UNEXPECTED_RCODE ERROR (changed from WARNING)
ZM_NO_RESPONSE ERROR (changed from DEBUG)

6.25.2. Errors

This test case may produce the following errors:

  • ZM_AAAA_BAD_RDATA (ERROR)
  • ZM_AAAA_QUERY_DROPPED (ERROR)
  • ZM_AAAA_UNEXPECTED_RCODE (ERROR)
  • ZM_AAAA_WELL_PROCESSED (INFO)
  • ZM_A_UNEXPECTED_RCODE (ERROR)
  • ZM_NO_RESPONSE (ERROR)

6.25.3. Input parameters

This test case requires the following input parameters:

  • None specified.

6.25.4. Resources

The following resources may be required to prepare for this test plan:

  • None specified.

  • None specified.

The following test cases require this test case to have successfully passed:

  • None specified.

6.26. dns-nameserver06 - NS can be resolved

6.26.1. Description

This test case comes from version v2023.1.4 of Zonemaster. For more information, see https://github.com/zonemaster/zonemaster/blob/v2023.1.4/docs/public/specifications/tests/Nameserver-TP/nameserver06.md.

Objective

All name servers names listed for a delegation must be resolvable in DNS. If they are not resolvable using DNS this is a sign of misconfiguration, and raises the risk of unreachability for the domain. It could also lower the performance for any resolver trying to resolve the name.

The objective of this test is to resolve the domain using all the listed name servers used in the delegation. More information about resolver behavior is in section 7 of RFC 1035.

Pass/fail criteria

If any of the name server names fails to resolve to an IP address, this test case fails.

6.26.2. Errors

This test case may produce the following errors:

  • None specified.

6.26.3. Input parameters

This test case requires the following input parameters:

  • None specified.

6.26.4. Resources

The following resources may be required to prepare for this test plan:

  • None specified.

6.26.5. Dependencies

This test case requires the following test cases to have successfully passed:

  • None specified.

6.26.6. Dependants

The following test cases require this test case to have successfully passed:

  • None specified.

6.26.7. Test suites

This test case is used in the following test suites:

  • Authoritative DNS Service

6.27. dns-nameserver07 - To check whether authoritative name servers return an upward referral

6.27.1. Description

This test case comes from version v2023.1.4 of Zonemaster. For more information, see https://github.com/zonemaster/zonemaster/blob/v2023.1.4/docs/public/specifications/tests/Nameserver-TP/nameserver07.md.

Objective

The configuration and/or implementation of some authoritative name servers causes them to return an upward referral to the root zone. There are proofs that such a behaviour could be used for DDoS attacks

Pass/fail criteria

The test case is Ok only if there are no responses in the authority section

6.27.2. Errors

  • None specified.

  • None specified.

  • None specified.

  • None specified.
