6.58. dnssec-13 - All DNSKEY algorithms used to sign the zone

6.58.1. Description

This test case comes from version v2023.1.4 of Zonemaster. For more information, see https://github.com/zonemaster/zonemaster/blob/v2023.1.4/docs/public/specifications/tests/DNSSEC-TP/dnssec13.md.

Objective

From RFC 6840, section 5.11:

The DS RRset and DNSKEY RRset are used to signal which algorithms are used to sign a zone. […] The zone MUST also be signed with each algorithm (though not each key) present in the DNSKEY RRset. […]

To verify that the whole zone is signed with all algorithms require access to the complete zone, which is generally not possible for public zones. This test case is limited to three RRsets that must be present in a signed zone, the SOA RRset, the NS RRset and the DNSKEY RRset.

This test case will verify that for each DNSKEY algorithm, there is a RRSIG of that algorithm for the three selected RRsets.

Summary

  • If the name server reports no DNSKEY RRset, then this test case will not test or report anything.
  • This test case will not report anything unless there is an issue to report.
Message Tag outputted Level Arguments Description of when message tag is outputted
ZM_DS13_ALGO_NOT_SIGNED_DNSKEY ERROR (changed from WARNING) ns_ip_list, algo_mnemo, algo_num The DNSKEY RRset is not signed with an algorithm present in the DNSKEY RRset
ZM_DS13_ALGO_NOT_SIGNED_NS ERROR (changed from WARNING) ns_ip_list, algo_mnemo, algo_num The NS RRset is not signed with an algorithm present in the DNSKEY RRset
ZM_DS13_ALGO_NOT_SIGNED_SOA ERROR (changed from WARNING) ns_ip_list, algo_mnemo, algo_num The SOA RRset is not signed with an algorithm present in the DNSKEY RRset

The value in the Level column is the default severity level of the message. The severity level can be changed in the Zonemaster-Engine profile. Also see the Severity Level Definitions document.

The argument names in the Arguments column lists the arguments used in the message. The argument names are defined in the argument list.

Pass/fail criteria

The outcome of this Test Case is “fail” if there is at least one message with the severity level ERROR or CRITICAL.

The outcome of this Test Case is “warning” if there is at least one message with the severity level WARNING, but no message with severity level ERROR or CRITICAL.

In other cases, no message or only messages with severity level INFO or NOTICE, the outcome of this Test Case is “pass”.

6.58.2. Errors

This test case may produce the following errors:

  • ZM_DS13_ALGO_NOT_SIGNED_DNSKEY (ERROR)
  • ZM_DS13_ALGO_NOT_SIGNED_NS (ERROR)
  • ZM_DS13_ALGO_NOT_SIGNED_SOA (ERROR)

6.58.3. Input parameters

This test case requires the following input parameters:

  • None specified.

6.58.4. Resources

The following resources may be required to prepare for this test plan:

  • None specified.

6.58.5. Dependencies

This test case requires the following test cases to have successfully passed:

  • None specified.

6.58.6. Dependants

The following test cases require this test case to have successfully passed:

  • None specified.

6.58.7. Test suites

This test case is used in the following test suites:

  • DNS Security Extensions (DNSSEC)

6.59. dnssec-14 - Check for valid RSA DNSKEY key size

6.59.1. Description

This test case comes from version v2023.1.4 of Zonemaster. For more information, see https://github.com/zonemaster/zonemaster/blob/v2023.1.4/docs/public/specifications/tests/DNSSEC-TP/dnssec14.md.

Objective

The DNSKEYs based on RSA have different minimum and maximum key sizes, which must be followed. This test case will validate the keys size of such keys. RSA based algorithms that are deprecated or else not suitable for DNSKEY (RFC 8624 and IANA registry) are just ignored. See test case DNSSEC05 for test of algorithm.

The table 1 below specify the maximum and minimum key size, respectively. Algorithm number can be found in IANA registry.

Table 1: Minimum and maximum RSA key sizes in bits

Algorithm Min size Max size Reference
5 512 4096 RFC 3110
7 512 4096 RFC 5155
8 512 4096 RFC 5702
10 1024 4096 RFC 5702

It is also recommended that an RSA based algorithm has a key length of at least 2048 bit as stated in NIST SP 800-57 Part 1 Rev. 4, table 2 on page 53 in section 5.6.1 and table 4 on page 55 in section 5.6.2.

This test case verifies that RSA DNSKEYs follows the stated key lengths from the RFCs and also the NIST recommended shortest key length.

Pass/fail criteria

The outcome of this Test Case is “fail” if there is at least one message with the severity level ERROR or CRITICAL.

The outcome of this Test Case is “warning” if there is at least one message with the severity level WARNING, but no message with severity level ERROR or CRITICAL.

In other cases the outcome of this Test Case is “pass”.

Message Default severity level
ZM_NO_RESPONSE ERROR (changed from DEBUG)
ZM_NO_RESPONSE_DNSKEY ERROR (changed from WARNING)
ZM_DNSKEY_SMALLER_THAN_REC WARNING
ZM_DNSKEY_TOO_SMALL_FOR_ALGO ERROR
ZM_DNSKEY_TOO_LARGE_FOR_ALGO ERROR
ZM_KEY_SIZE_OK INFO

6.59.2. Errors

This test case may produce the following errors:

  • ZM_DNSKEY_SMALLER_THAN_REC (WARNING)
  • ZM_DNSKEY_TOO_LARGE_FOR_ALGO (ERROR)
  • ZM_DNSKEY_TOO_SMALL_FOR_ALGO (ERROR)
  • ZM_KEY_SIZE_OK (INFO)
  • ZM_NO_RESPONSE (ERROR)
  • ZM_NO_RESPONSE_DNSKEY (ERROR)

6.59.3. Input parameters

This test case requires the following input parameters:

  • None specified.

6.59.4. Resources

The following resources may be required to prepare for this test plan:

  • None specified.

6.59.5. Dependencies

This test case requires the following test cases to have successfully passed:

  • None specified.

6.59.6. Dependants

The following test cases require this test case to have successfully passed:

  • None specified.

6.59.7. Test suites

This test case is used in the following test suites:

  • DNS Security Extensions (DNSSEC)

6.60. dnssec-15 - Existence of CDS and CDNSKEY

6.60.1. Description

This test case comes from version v2023.1.4 of Zonemaster. For more information, see https://github.com/zonemaster/zonemaster/blob/v2023.1.4/docs/public/specifications/tests/DNSSEC-TP/dnssec15.md.

Objective

CDS and CDNSKEY record types are defined in RFC 7344 and RFC 8078. Both record types are optional in a zone. The objective of this test case is to verify that they are correctly set-up, if included in the zone.

If a CDS record is included in the zone, the corresponding CDNSKEY record should also be included (RFC 7344, section 4).

The CDS and CDNSKEY RRsets should be consistent between all name servers for the zone in question.

If there are both CDS RRs and CDNSKEY RRs in the zone they must match in content (RFC 7344, section 4). It means that both must be derived from the same DNSKEY or both being “delete” CDS and CDNSKEY.

Summary

Message Tag outputted Default level Description of when message tag is outputted
ZM_DS15_HAS_CDNSKEY_NO_CDS NOTICE CDNSKEY RRset is found, but no CDS RRset.
ZM_DS15_HAS_CDS_AND_CDNSKEY INFO CDNSKEY and CDS RRsets are found.
ZM_DS15_HAS_CDS_NO_CDNSKEY NOTICE CDS RRset is found, but no CDNSKEY RRset.
ZM_DS15_INCONSISTENT_CDNSKEY ERROR All servers do not have the same CDNSKEY RRset.
ZM_DS15_INCONSISTENT_CDS ERROR All servers do not have the same CDS RRset.
ZM_DS15_MISMATCH_CDS_CDNSKEY ERROR Both CDS and CDNSKEY RRsets are found but they do not match.
ZM_DS15_NO_CDS_CDNSKEY INFO No CDS or CDNSKEY RRsets are found on any name server.

Pass/fail criteria

The outcome of this Test Case is “fail” if there is at least one message with the severity level ERROR or CRITICAL.

The outcome of this Test Case is “warning” if there is at least one message with the severity level WARNING, but no message with severity level ERROR or CRITICAL.

In other cases, no message or only messages with severity level INFO or NOTICE, the outcome of this Test Case is “pass”.

6.60.2. Errors

This test case may produce the following errors:

  • ZM_DS15_HAS_CDNSKEY_NO_CDS (NOTICE)
  • ZM_DS15_HAS_CDS_AND_CDNSKEY (INFO)
  • ZM_DS15_HAS_CDS_NO_CDNSKEY (NOTICE)
  • ZM_DS15_INCONSISTENT_CDNSKEY (ERROR)
  • ZM_DS15_INCONSISTENT_CDS (ERROR)
  • ZM_DS15_MISMATCH_CDS_CDNSKEY (ERROR)
  • ZM_DS15_NO_CDS_CDNSKEY (INFO)

6.60.3. Input parameters

This test case requires the following input parameters:

  • None specified.

6.60.4. Resources

The following resources may be required to prepare for this test plan:

  • None specified.

6.60.5. Dependencies

This test case requires the following test cases to have successfully passed:

  • None specified.

6.60.6. Dependants

The following test cases require this test case to have successfully passed:

  • None specified.

6.60.7. Test suites

This test case is used in the following test suites:

  • DNS Security Extensions (DNSSEC)

6.61. dnssec-16 - Validate CDS

6.61.1. Description

This test case comes from version v2023.1.4 of Zonemaster. For more information, see https://github.com/zonemaster/zonemaster/blob/v2023.1.4/docs/public/specifications/tests/DNSSEC-TP/dnssec16.md.

Objective

CDS and CDNSKEY record types are defined in RFC 7344 and RFC 8078. Both record types are optional in a zone. The objective of this test case is to verify that the CDS RRset is valid. This test case is only relevant if the zone has at least one CDS record. For tests of the CDNSKEY, see test case DNSSEC17.

Summary

  • If no CDS record is found, the test case will terminate early with no message tag outputted.
  • If a CDS record is of “delete” type, then it can by definition not match or point at any DNSKEY record.
Message Tag outputted Default level Description of when message tag is outputted
ZM_DS16_CDS_INVALID_RRSIG ERROR CDS RRset is signed with an invalid RRSIG.
ZM_DS16_CDS_MATCHES_NON_SEP_DNSKEY ERROR (changed from NOTICE) CDS record matches a DNSKEY with SEP bit (bit 15) unset.
ZM_DS16_CDS_MATCHES_NON_ZONE_DNSKEY ERROR CDS record matches a DNSKEY with zone bit (bit 7) unset.
ZM_DS16_CDS_MATCHES_NO_DNSKEY ERROR (changed from WARNING) CDS record does not match any DNSKEY in DNSKEY RRset.
ZM_DS16_CDS_NOT_SIGNED_BY_CDS ERROR (changed from NOTICE) CDS RRset is not signed by the key that the CDS record points to.
ZM_DS16_CDS_SIGNED_BY_UNKNOWN_DNSKEY ERROR CDS RRset is signed by a key not in DNSKEY RRset.
ZM_DS16_CDS_UNSIGNED ERROR CDS RRset is unsigned.
ZM_DS16_CDS_WITHOUT_DNSKEY ERROR CDS RRset exists, but there is no DNSKEY RRset.
ZM_DS16_DELETE_CDS INFO CDS RRset has a “delete” CDS record as a single record.
ZM_DS16_DNSKEY_NOT_SIGNED_BY_CDS ERROR (changed from WARNING) DNSKEY RRset is not signed by the key or keys that the CDS records point to.
ZM_DS16_MIXED_DELETE_CDS ERROR “Delete” CDS record is mixed with normal CDS record.

Pass/fail criteria

The outcome of this Test Case is “fail” if there is at least one message with the severity level ERROR or CRITICAL.

The outcome of this Test Case is “warning” if there is at least one message with the severity level WARNING, but no message with severity level ERROR or CRITICAL.

In other cases, no message or only messages with severity level INFO or NOTICE, the outcome of this Test Case is “pass”.

6.61.2. Errors

This test case may produce the following errors:

  • ZM_DS16_CDS_INVALID_RRSIG (ERROR)
  • ZM_DS16_CDS_MATCHES_NON_SEP_DNSKEY (ERROR)
  • ZM_DS16_CDS_MATCHES_NON_ZONE_DNSKEY (ERROR)
  • ZM_DS16_CDS_MATCHES_NO_DNSKEY (ERROR)
  • ZM_DS16_CDS_NOT_SIGNED_BY_CDS (ERROR)
  • ZM_DS16_CDS_SIGNED_BY_UNKNOWN_DNSKEY (ERROR)
  • ZM_DS16_CDS_UNSIGNED (ERROR)
  • ZM_DS16_CDS_WITHOUT_DNSKEY (ERROR)
  • ZM_DS16_DELETE_CDS (INFO)
  • ZM_DS16_DNSKEY_NOT_SIGNED_BY_CDS (ERROR)
  • ZM_DS16_MIXED_DELETE_CDS (ERROR)

6.61.3. Input parameters

This test case requires the following input parameters:

  • None specified.

6.61.4. Resources

The following resources may be required to prepare for this test plan:

  • None specified.

6.61.5. Dependencies

This test case requires the following test cases to have successfully passed:

  • None specified.

6.61.6. Dependants

The following test cases require this test case to have successfully passed:

  • None specified.

6.61.7. Test suites

This test case is used in the following test suites:

  • DNS Security Extensions (DNSSEC)

6.62. dnssec-17 - Validate CDNSKEY

6.62.1. Description

This test case comes from version v2023.1.4 of Zonemaster. For more information, see https://github.com/zonemaster/zonemaster/blob/v2023.1.4/docs/public/specifications/tests/DNSSEC-TP/dnssec17.md.

Objective

CDS and CDNSKEY record types are defined in RFC 7344 and RFC 8078. Both record types are optional in a zone. The objective of this test case is to verify that the CDNSKEY RRset is valid. This test case is only relevant if the zone has at least one CDNSKEY record. For tests of the CDS, see test case DNSSEC16.

Summary

  • If no CDNSKEY record is found, the test case will terminate early with no message tag outputted.
  • If a CDNSKEY record is of “delete” type, then it can by definition not match or point at any DNSKEY record.
Message Tag outputted Default level Description of when message tag is outputted
ZM_DS17_CDNSKEY_INVALID_RRSIG ERROR CDNSKEY RRset signed with an invalid RRSIG.
ZM_DS17_CDNSKEY_IS_NON_SEP ERROR (changed from NOTICE) CDNSKEY record has the SEP bit (bit 15) unset.
ZM_DS17_CDNSKEY_IS_NON_ZONE ERROR CDNSKEY record has the zone bit (bit 7) unset.
ZM_DS17_CDNSKEY_MATCHES_NO_DNSKEY ERROR (changed from WARNING) CDNSKEY record does not match any DNSKEY in DNSKEY RRset.
ZM_DS17_CDNSKEY_NOT_SIGNED_BY_CDNSKEY ERROR (changed from NOTICE) CDNSKEY RRset is not signed by the key that the CDNSKEY record points to.
ZM_DS17_CDNSKEY_SIGNED_BY_UNKNOWN_DNSKEY ERROR CDNSKEY RRset is signed by a key not in DNSKEY RRset.
ZM_DS17_CDNSKEY_UNSIGNED ERROR CDNSKEY RRset is unsigned.
ZM_DS17_CDNSKEY_WITHOUT_DNSKEY ERROR CDNSKEY RRset exists, but there is no DNSKEY RRset.
ZM_DS17_DELETE_CDNSKEY INFO CDNSKEY RRset has a “delete” CDNSKEY record as a single record.
ZM_DS17_DNSKEY_NOT_SIGNED_BY_CDNSKEY ERROR (changed from WARNING) DNSKEY RRset is not signed by the key or keys that the CDNSKEY records point to.
ZM_DS17_MIXED_DELETE_CDNSKEY ERROR “Delete” CDNSKEY record is mixed with normal CDNSKEY record.

Pass/fail criteria

The outcome of this Test Case is “fail” if there is at least one message with the severity level ERROR or CRITICAL.

The outcome of this Test Case is “warning” if there is at least one message with the severity level WARNING, but no message with severity level ERROR or CRITICAL.

In other cases, no message or only messages with severity level INFO or NOTICE, the outcome of this Test Case is “pass”.

6.62.2. Errors

This test case may produce the following errors:

  • ZM_DS17_CDNSKEY_INVALID_RRSIG (ERROR)
  • ZM_DS17_CDNSKEY_IS_NON_SEP (ERROR)
  • ZM_DS17_CDNSKEY_IS_NON_ZONE (ERROR)
  • ZM_DS17_CDNSKEY_MATCHES_NO_DNSKEY (ERROR)
  • ZM_DS17_CDNSKEY_NOT_SIGNED_BY_CDNSKEY (ERROR)
  • ZM_DS17_CDNSKEY_SIGNED_BY_UNKNOWN_DNSKEY (ERROR)
  • ZM_DS17_CDNSKEY_UNSIGNED (ERROR)
  • ZM_DS17_CDNSKEY_WITHOUT_DNSKEY (ERROR)
  • ZM_DS17_DELETE_CDNSKEY (INFO)
  • ZM_DS17_DNSKEY_NOT_SIGNED_BY_CDNSKEY (ERROR)
  • ZM_DS17_MIXED_DELETE_CDNSKEY (ERROR)

6.62.3. Input parameters

  • None specified.

6.63. dnssec-18 - Validate trust from DS to CDS and CDNSKEY

6.63.1. Description

This test case comes from version v2023.1.4 of Zonemaster. For more information, see https://github.com/zonemaster/zonemaster/blob/v2023.1.4/docs/public/specifications/tests/DNSSEC-TP/dnssec18.md.

Objective

CDS and CDNSKEY record types are defined in RFC 7344 and RFC 8078. Both record types are optional in a zone. The objective of this test case is to verify that there is a correct chain of trust from DS, in the parent zone to the CDS and CDNSKEY RRsets (RFC 7344, section 4.1).

As stated in RFC 4035, section 2.4: > A DS RR SHOULD point to a DNSKEY RR that is present in the child’s > apex DNSKEY RRset, and the child’s apex DNSKEY RRset SHOULD be > signed by the corresponding private key.”

This Test case is only relevant if * The Child Zone has either CDS or CDNSKEY record or both, and * The parent zone has a DS RRset for the Child Zone.

Summary

  • If no CDS or CDNSKEY records are found, this test case is not run and no message will be outputted.
  • If no DS records are found at parent, this test case is not run and no message will be outputted.
Message Tag outputted Default level Description of when message tag is outputted
ZM_DS18_NO_MATCH_CDS_RRSIG_DS ERROR The CDS RRset is not signed with a DNSKEY record that a DS record points to.
ZM_DS18_NO_MATCH_CDNSKEY_RRSIG_DS ERROR CDNSKEY RRset is not signed with a DNSKEY record that a DS record points to.

Pass/fail criteria

The outcome of this Test Case is “fail” if there is at least one message with the severity level ERROR or CRITICAL.

The outcome of this Test Case is “warning” if there is at least one message with the severity level WARNING, but no message with severity level ERROR or CRITICAL.

In other cases, no message or only messages with severity level INFO or NOTICE, the outcome of this Test Case is “pass”.

6.63.2. Errors

This test case may produce the following errors:

  • ZM_DS18_NO_MATCH_CDNSKEY_RRSIG_DS (ERROR)
  • ZM_DS18_NO_MATCH_CDS_RRSIG_DS (ERROR)

6.63.3. Input parameters

This test case requires the following input parameters:

  • None specified.

6.63.4. Resources

The following resources may be required to prepare for this test plan:

  • None specified.

6.63.5. Dependencies

This test case requires the following test cases to have successfully passed:

  • None specified.

6.63.6. Dependants

The following test cases require this test case to have successfully passed:

  • None specified.

6.63.7. Test suites

This test case is used in the following test suites:

  • DNS Security Extensions (DNSSEC)

6.64. dnssec-91 - Permitted signing algorithms

6.64.1. Description

In addition to the requirements outlined in dnssec-05, this test imposes an additional requirement on the signing algorithms used to sign zones, specifically, the algorithm number MUST NOT be lower than 8.

6.64.2. Errors

This test case may produce the following errors:

  • DNSSEC_DNS_QUERY_ERROR (ERROR)
  • DNSSEC_INVALID_SIGNING_ALGORITHM (ERROR)

6.64.3. Input parameters

  • dns.nameservers (object)

6.64.4. Resources

  • None specified.

This test case requires the following test cases to have successfully passed:

  • dnssec-05 - Check for invalid DNSKEY algorithms

  • None specified.

  • DNS Security Extensions (DNSSEC)

6.65. dnssec-92 - Permitted DS record hash algorithm(s)

6.65.1. Description

The DS record(s) submitted in the dnssec.dsRecords input parameters will be validated. Algorithm 1 (SHA-1) MUST NOT be used.

6.65.2. Errors

This test case may produce the following errors:

  • DNSSEC_DNS_QUERY_ERROR (ERROR)
  • DNSSEC_INVALID_DIGEST_ALGORITHM (ERROR)

  • dnssec.dsRecords (object)

  • None specified.

  • None specified.

6.65.7. Test suites

This test case is used in the following test suites:

  • DNS Security Extensions (DNSSEC)

6.66. dnssecOps01-ZSKRollover - ZSK rollover

6.66.1. Description

This test case verifies the RSP’s ability to perform a ZSK rollover (as described in Section 4.1.1 of RFC 6781 for a zone.

If the value of the dnssecOps.csk input parameter is true, then this test will be skipped.

The system will monitor the SOA record in the domain name specified in the dnssec.zskRolloverZone input parameter. The domain may be present anywhere in the DNS hierarchy (that is, it does not need to be a TLD), but MUST have a secure chain of trust up to the root zone, so that it can be validated using the root zone trust anchor.

During the test period (currently defined as 24 hours) the operator MUST successfully carry out a ZSK rollover for the domain, where the Zone Signing Key is replaced, without disrupting the chain of trust.

To simplify testing, applicants may wish to provision domain that is configured with short TTLs and a short ZSK lifetime, so that a ZSK rollover is guaranteed to occur within the 24 test period.

6.66.2. Errors

This test case may produce the following errors:

  • None specified.

6.66.3. Input parameters

This test case requires the following input parameters:

  • dnssecOps.csk (boolean)
  • dnssecOps.zskRolloverZone (string)

6.66.4. Resources

The following resources may be required to prepare for this test plan:

  • None specified.

6.66.5. Dependencies

This test case requires the following test cases to have successfully passed:

  • None specified.

6.66.6. Dependants

The following test cases require this test case to have successfully passed:

  • None specified.

6.66.7. Test suites

This test case is used in the following test suites:

  • DNSSEC Operations

6.67. dnssecOps02-KSKRollover - KSK rollover

6.67.1. Description

This test case verifies the RSP’s ability to perform a CSK/KSK rollover (as described in Sections 4.1.2 and 4.13 of RFC 6781 for a zone.

The system will monitor the SOA record in the domain name specified in the dnssec.kskRolloverZone input parameter. The domain may be present anywhere in the DNS hierarchy (that is, it does not need to be a TLD), but MUST have a secure chain of trust up to the root zone, so that it can be validated using the root zone trust anchor.

During the test period (currently defined as 24 hours) the operator MUST successfully carry out a KSK rollover for the domain, where the Key Signing Key is replaced, and the DS record in the parent zone is updated, without disrupting the chain of trust.

6.67.2. Errors

This test case may produce the following errors:

  • None specified.

6.67.3. Input parameters

This test case requires the following input parameters:

  • dnssecOps.kskRolloverZone (string)

6.67.4. Resources

The following resources may be required to prepare for this test plan:

  • None specified.

6.67.5. Dependencies

This test case requires the following test cases to have successfully passed:

  • None specified.

6.67.6. Dependants

The following test cases require this test case to have successfully passed:

  • None specified.

6.67.7. Test suites

This test case is used in the following test suites:

  • DNSSEC Operations

6.68. dnssecOps03-AlgorithmRollover - algorithm rollover

6.68.1. Description

This test case verifies the RSP’s ability to perform an algorithm rollover (as described in Section 4.1.4 of RFC 6781 for a zone.

The system will monitor the SOA record in the domain name specified in the dnssec.algorithmRolloverZone input parameter. The domain may be present anywhere in the DNS hierarchy (that is, it does not need to be a TLD), but MUST have a secure chain of trust up to the root zone, so that it can be validated using the root zone trust anchor.

During the test period (currently defined as 72 hours) the operator MUST successfully carry out an algorithm rollover for the domain (including an update to the DS record in the parent zone), where the algorithm used to secure the domain is changed, without disrupting the chain of trust.

Note that the specific algorithms being rolled to and from are not significant (although they MUST be present in the IANA registry); it is not required that the new algorithm be more “secure” than the original algorithm; only that they are different. So a rollover from algorithm 13 (ECDSAP256SHA256) to algorithm 8 (RSASHA256) will be accepted as well as a rollover from RSASHA256 to ECDSAP256SHA256.

6.68.2. Errors

This test case may produce the following errors:

  • None specified.

6.68.3. Input parameters

This test case requires the following input parameters:

  • dnssecOps.algorithmRolloverZone (string)

6.68.4. Resources

The following resources may be required to prepare for this test plan:

  • None specified.

6.68.5. Dependencies

This test case requires the following test cases to have successfully passed:

  • None specified.

6.68.6. Dependants

The following test cases require this test case to have successfully passed:

  • None specified.

6.68.7. Test suites

This test case is used in the following test suites:

  • DNSSEC Operations

6.69. epp-01 - EPP server **MUST** have at least one A record

6.69.1. Description

At least one A record MUST be published in the DNS for the EPP hostname, to allow IPv4-only hosts to connect to the EPP service.

6.69.2. Errors

  • None specified.

6.70. epp-02 - EPP server **MUST** have at least one AAAA record

6.70.1. Description

At least one AAAA record MUST be published in the DNS for the EPP hostname, to allow IPv6-only hosts to connect to the EPP service.

6.71. epp-03 - All IP addresses **MUST** accept TCP connections on port 700

6.71.1. Description

EPP is associated with TCP port 700. All IPv4/IPv6 addresses published in the DNS for the EPP hostname MUST accept TCP connections on this port.

Since the EPP specification requires IP-based access control, the RSP MUST configure their firewall to allow access from the RST system.

6.71.2. Errors

This test case may produce the following errors:

  • None specified.

6.71.3. Input parameters

This test case requires the following input parameters:

  • epp.hostName (string)

6.71.4. Resources

The following resources may be required to prepare for this test plan:

  • epp.clientACL

6.71.5. Dependencies

This test case requires the following test cases to have successfully passed:

  • epp-01 - EPP server **MUST** have at least one A record
  • epp-02 - EPP server **MUST** have at least one AAAA record

6.71.6. Dependants

The following test cases require this test case to have successfully passed:

  • None specified.

6.71.7. Test suites

This test case is used in the following test suites:

  • Extensible Provisioning Protocol (EPP)

6.72. epp-04 - All service ports support TLSv1.2 or higher

6.72.1. Description

EPP uses TLS to secure the channel between client and server. The server MUST support TLSv1.2 and optionally any subsequent protocol published by the IETF.

6.72.2. Errors

This test case may produce the following errors:

  • None specified.

6.73. epp-05 - All service ports **MUST NOT** support TLSv1.1 or earlier

6.73.1. Description

TLSv1.1 and all previous versions have known security issues and should not be supported by the server.

6.74. epp-06 - All service ports **MUST** offer a valid certificate issued by a trusted CA

6.74.1. Description

To ensure that the connection can be trusted, the server MUST present a certificate issued by a trusted CA, such as those supported by major browsers.

6.83. epp-15 - <objURI> element(s) in the <greeting> **MUST** be valid for the registry type

6.83.1. Description

All <objURI> element(s) in the <greeting> MUST contain XML namespace URIs that are appropriate.

The only mandatory URI that MUST be present is the domain namespace URI.

For example, the presence of the host and contact namespace URIs may be required depending on the epp.hostModel and general.minimalPublicDataSet parameters.

6.83.2. Errors

This test case may produce the following errors:

  • None specified.

6.84. epp-16 - <extURI> element(s) in the <greeting> **MUST** be valid

6.84.1. Description

6.85. epp-17 - <login> command **MUST** return a successful response

6.85.1. Description

The EPP server MUST return a 1000 result in response to a <login> command.

The client will use the object and extension XML namespaces from the server’s <greeting> as part of the <login> command.

6.86.1. Description

6.87. epp-19 - domain <check> command test

6.87.1. Description

The client will perform a series of <check> commands and will validate the avail attribute of the <domain:name> elements in the server response, as follows:

  • syntactically invalid domain: avail attribute MUST be 0
  • valid but registered domain: avail attribute MUST be 0.
  • valid and unregistered domain: avail attribute MUST be 1. The domain will be generated using random characters.

These checks will be carried out for each TLD in the TLD set.

6.87.2. Errors

This test case may produce the following errors:

  • None specified.

6.87.3. Input parameters

This test case requires the following input parameters:

  • epp.registeredNames (array)

6.87.4. Resources

The following resources may be required to prepare for this test plan:

  • None specified.

6.87.5. Dependencies

This test case requires the following test cases to have successfully passed:

  • None specified.

6.87.6. Dependants

The following test cases require this test case to have successfully passed:

  • None specified.

6.87.7. Test suites

This test case is used in the following test suites:

  • Extensible Provisioning Protocol (EPP)

6.88. epp-22 - host <check> command test (if applicable)

6.88.1. Description

If the EPP server supports host objects, this test will perform a series of <check> commands and will validate the avail attribute of the <host:name> elements in the server response, as follows:

  • syntactically invalid hostname: avail attribute MUST be 0
  • valid but registered hostname: avail attribute MUST be 0.
  • valid and unregistered hostname: avail attribute MUST be 1. The hostname will be generated using random characters.

6.88.2. Errors

This test case may produce the following errors:

  • None specified.

  • Extensible Provisioning Protocol (EPP)

6.89. epp-23 - contact <check> command test (if applicable for the registry type)

6.89.1. Description

If the EPP server supports contact objects, this test will perform a series of <check> commands and will validate the avail attribute of the <contact:id> elements in the server response, as follows:

  • syntactically invalid ID: avail attribute MUST be 0
  • valid but registered ID: avail attribute MUST be 0.
  • valid and unregistered ID: avail attribute MUST be 1. The ID will be generated using random characters.

6.89.2. Errors

This test case may produce the following errors:

  • None specified.

  • Extensible Provisioning Protocol (EPP)

6.90. epp-24 - contact <create> command test (if applicable for the registry type)

6.90.1. Description

This test attempts to create a number of contact objects, and validates the server’s response. For example, the test will expect that the server will reject a command that creates an object with missing or invalid properties, but will accept a command to create an object with valid properties. Property values will be randomly generated but will contain realistic values. No personal information will be transmitted as part of this test.

The test will confirm that the server checks and validates the values of the following elements:

  • <contact:id>
  • <contact:status>
  • <contact:postalInfo> elements (both int and loc)
    • <contact:name>
    • <contact:addr> elements
      • <contact:street> element(s)
      • <contact:city> element
      • <contact:cc> element
  • <contact:voice>
  • <contact:email>

If the general.minimalPublicDataSet input parameter is true, this test will be skipped.

6.90.2. Errors

This test case may produce the following errors:

  • None specified.

6.90.3. Input parameters

This test case requires the following input parameters:

  • general.minimalPublicDataSet (boolean)

6.90.4. Resources

The following resources may be required to prepare for this test plan:

  • None specified.

6.90.5. Dependencies

This test case requires the following test cases to have successfully passed:

  • None specified.

6.90.6. Dependants

The following test cases require this test case to have successfully passed:

  • None specified.

6.90.7. Test suites

This test case is used in the following test suites:

  • Extensible Provisioning Protocol (EPP)

6.91. epp-25 - contact <info> command test (if applicable for the registry type)

6.91.1. Description

This test will perform <info> commands on the objects successfully created during epp-24 and will confirm that the server has correctly stored the provided values.

If the general.minimalPublicDataSet input parameter is true, this test will be skipped.

6.91.2. Errors

This test case may produce the following errors:

  • None specified.

  • None specified.

  • Extensible Provisioning Protocol (EPP)

6.92. epp-26 - contact <update> command test (if applicable for the registry type)

6.92.1. Description

This test will perform <update> commands on the objects created during epp-24 and will confirm that the server correctly rejects invalid commands (which would specify invalid property values) and accepts valid commands.

The test will confirm that the server checks and validates <update> commands which transform the values of the following elements:

  • <contact:status>
  • <contact:postalInfo> elements (both int and loc)
    • <contact:name>
    • <contact:addr> elements
      • <contact:street> element(s)
      • <contact:city> element
      • <contact:cc> element
  • <contact:voice>
  • <contact:email>

If the general.minimalPublicDataSet input parameter is true, this test will be skipped.

6.92.2. Errors

This test case may produce the following errors:

  • None specified.

6.92.3. Input parameters

This test case requires the following input parameters:

  • general.minimalPublicDataSet (boolean)

6.92.4. Resources

The following resources may be required to prepare for this test plan:

  • None specified.

6.92.5. Dependencies

This test case requires the following test cases to have successfully passed:

  • epp-25 - contact <info> command test (if applicable for the registry type)

6.92.6. Dependants

The following test cases require this test case to have successfully passed:

  • None specified.

6.92.7. Test suites

This test case is used in the following test suites:

  • Extensible Provisioning Protocol (EPP)

6.93. epp-27 - contact <delete> command test (if applicable for the registry type)

6.93.1. Description

This test will perform <delete> commands on the objects created during epp-24 and will confirm that the server accepts the <delete> command with a 1xxx response code.

If the general.minimalPublicDataSet input parameter is true, this test will be skipped.

6.93.2. Errors

This test case may produce the following errors:

  • None specified.

6.93.3. Input parameters

This test case requires the following input parameters:

  • general.minimalPublicDataSet (boolean)

6.93.4. Resources

The following resources may be required to prepare for this test plan:

  • None specified.

6.93.5. Dependencies

This test case requires the following test cases to have successfully passed:

  • epp-26 - contact <update> command test (if applicable for the registry type)

6.93.6. Dependants

The following test cases require this test case to have successfully passed:

  • None specified.

6.93.7. Test suites

This test case is used in the following test suites:

  • Extensible Provisioning Protocol (EPP)

6.94. epp-28 - host <create> command test (if applicable)

6.94.1. Description

This test attempts to create a number of host objects, and validates the server’s response. For example, the test will expect that the server will reject a command that creates an object with missing or invalid properties, but will accept a command to create an object with valid properties. Property values will be randomly generated but will contain realistic values. No personal information will be transmitted as part of this test.

The test will confirm that the server checks and validates the values of the following elements:

  • <host:name> (both in- and out-of-bailiwick, for each TLD in the TLD set)
  • <host:status>
  • <host:addr> elements (both IPv4 and IPv6)

If the epp.hostModel input parameter is attributes, this test will be skipped.

6.94.2. Errors

This test case may produce the following errors:

  • None specified.

6.94.3. Input parameters

This test case requires the following input parameters:

  • epp.hostModel (string)

6.94.4. Resources

The following resources may be required to prepare for this test plan:

  • None specified.

6.94.5. Dependencies

This test case requires the following test cases to have successfully passed:

  • None specified.

6.94.6. Dependants

The following test cases require this test case to have successfully passed:

  • None specified.

6.94.7. Test suites

This test case is used in the following test suites:

  • Extensible Provisioning Protocol (EPP)

6.95. epp-29 - host <info> command test (if applicable)

6.95.1. Description

This test will perform <info> commands on the objects successfully created during epp-28 and will confirm that the server has correctly stored the provided values.

If the epp.hostModel input parameter is attributes, this test will be skipped.

6.95.2. Errors

This test case may produce the following errors:

  • None specified.

6.95.3. Input parameters

This test case requires the following input parameters:

  • epp.hostModel (string)

6.95.4. Resources

The following resources may be required to prepare for this test plan:

  • None specified.

6.95.5. Dependencies

This test case requires the following test cases to have successfully passed:

  • epp-28 - host <create> command test (if applicable)

6.95.6. Dependants

The following test cases require this test case to have successfully passed:

  • None specified.

6.95.7. Test suites

This test case is used in the following test suites:

  • Extensible Provisioning Protocol (EPP)

6.96. epp-30 - (intentionally ommitted)

6.96.1. Description

6.96.2. Errors

  • None specified.

6.97. epp-31 - host <update> command test (if applicable)

6.97.1. Description

This test will perform <update> commands on the objects created during epp-28 and will confirm that the server correctly rejects invalid commands (which would specify invalid property values) and accepts valid commands.

The test will confirm that the server checks and validates <update> commands which transform the values of the following elements:

  • <host:status>
  • <host:addr> elements (both IPv4 and IPv6)

Note: the server’s ability to support host renames is checked in a later test.

If the epp.hostModel input parameter is attributes, this test will be skipped.

6.97.2. Errors

This test case may produce the following errors:

  • None specified.

6.97.3. Input parameters

This test case requires the following input parameters:

  • epp.hostModel (string)

6.97.4. Resources

The following resources may be required to prepare for this test plan:

  • None specified.

6.97.5. Dependencies

This test case requires the following test cases to have successfully passed:

  • epp-29 - host <info> command test (if applicable)

6.97.6. Dependants

The following test cases require this test case to have successfully passed:

  • None specified.

6.97.7. Test suites

This test case is used in the following test suites:

  • Extensible Provisioning Protocol (EPP)

6.98. epp-31a - host rename test (if applicable)

6.98.1. Description

This tests verifies the server’s support for host rename operations.

The client will perform <update> commands on the objects created during epp-28 and will confirm that the server correctly accepts or rejects the commands, for example:

  • an <update> command which specifies a syntatically invalid host name is rejected;
  • an <update> command which places the object out-of-bailiwick is accepted;
  • an <update> command which places the object within a non-existent domain is rejected;
  • an <update> command which places the object within a domain sponsored by another registrar is rejected.

If the epp.hostModel input parameter is attributes, this test will be skipped.

6.98.2. Errors

This test case may produce the following errors:

  • None specified.

6.98.3. Input parameters

This test case requires the following input parameters:

  • epp.hostModel (string)

6.98.4. Resources

The following resources may be required to prepare for this test plan:

  • None specified.

6.98.5. Dependencies

This test case requires the following test cases to have successfully passed:

  • epp-29 - host <info> command test (if applicable)

6.98.6. Dependants

The following test cases require this test case to have successfully passed:

  • None specified.

6.98.7. Test suites

This test case is used in the following test suites:

  • Extensible Provisioning Protocol (EPP)

6.99. epp-31b - host <delete> command test (if applicable)

6.99.1. Description

This test will perform <delete> commands on the objects created during epp-28 and will confirm that the server accepts the <delete> command with a 1xxx response code.

If the epp.hostModel input parameter is attributes, this test will be skipped.

  • None specified.

6.99.7. Test suites

This test case is used in the following test suites:

  • Extensible Provisioning Protocol (EPP)

6.100. epp-32 - domain <create> command test

6.100.1. Description

This test performs a series domain <create> commands, using pseudo- random ASCII domain names under each TLD in the TLD set. If the general.minimalPublicDataSet input parameter is false then a contact object (containing pseudo-random contact information) will be created beforehand and used as the registrant. If the epp.hostModel parameter is objects, then two host objects with pseudo-random names will be created and used as the nameservers (otherwise the names will be provided as attributes).

The client will perform several <create> commands, each of which will test certain aspects of the server’s processing of those commands, for example:

  • to confirm that the server does not accept invalid values for object properties (such as domain name, registration period, registant ID, nameservers, DS record parameters, etc)
  • to confirm that the server does not accept commands which reference non-existent host/contact objects
  • to confirm the server supports all permitted client-assigned status codes
  • to confirm that the server rejects a <create> command which specifies a contact object (where the general.minimalPublicDataSet) input parameter is true
  • to confirm that the server rejects a <create> command which does not specify a contact object (where the general.minimalPublicDataSet) input parameter is false
  • to confirm that the server rejects a <create> command containing host objects when the epp.hostModel parameter is attributes
  • to confirm that the server rejects a <create> command containing host attributes when the epp.hostModel parameter is objects
  • to confirm that the the server which implements RFC 9154 accepts a <create> command without an authInfo command.

6.100.2. Errors

This test case may produce the following errors:

  • None specified.

6.100.3. Input parameters

This test case requires the following input parameters:

  • epp.hostModel (string)
  • general.minimalPublicDataSet (boolean)

6.100.4. Resources

The following resources may be required to prepare for this test plan:

  • None specified.

6.100.5. Dependencies

This test case requires the following test cases to have successfully passed:

  • None specified.

6.100.6. Dependants

The following test cases require this test case to have successfully passed:

  • None specified.

6.100.7. Test suites

This test case is used in the following test suites:

  • Extensible Provisioning Protocol (EPP)

6.101. epp-33 - domain <info> command test

6.101.1. Description

This test performs a series of <info> commands on the domain objects created in epp-32. This test checks that (a) the domain names are present in the repository, and (b) that the expected object properties are present and valid.

The responses will confirm that:

  • the <roid> element is valid and contains a repository ID registered with IANA;
  • the <crDate> and <exDate> elements are present valid;
  • the <crID> and <clID> elements match the client ID used to create the domain.
  • DNSSEC information provided in the <create> command is present and correct.

6.101.2. Errors

This test case may produce the following errors:

  • None specified.

6.101.3. Input parameters

This test case requires the following input parameters:

  • epp.clid (string)

6.101.4. Resources

The following resources may be required to prepare for this test plan:

  • None specified.

6.101.5. Dependencies

This test case requires the following test cases to have successfully passed:

  • epp-32 - domain <create> command test

6.101.6. Dependants

The following test cases require this test case to have successfully passed:

  • None specified.

6.101.7. Test suites

This test case is used in the following test suites:

  • Extensible Provisioning Protocol (EPP)

6.102. epp-34 - domain <update> command test

6.102.1. Description

This test will confirm that the client is able to perform an <update> command on domain names, including:

  • adding and removing client-assigned status codes
  • adding and removing nameservers (whether objects or attributes)
  • changing registrant object (if applicable)
  • adding and remove DNSSEC information

6.102.2. Errors

This test case may produce the following errors:

  • None specified.

6.102.3. Input parameters

This test case requires the following input parameters:

  • epp.clid (string)
  • epp.hostModel (string)
  • general.minimalPublicDataSet (boolean)

6.102.4. Resources

The following resources may be required to prepare for this test plan:

  • None specified.

6.102.5. Dependencies

This test case requires the following test cases to have successfully passed:

  • epp-32 - domain <create> command test
  • epp-33 - domain <info> command test

6.102.6. Dependants

The following test cases require this test case to have successfully passed:

  • None specified.

6.102.7. Test suites

This test case is used in the following test suites:

  • Extensible Provisioning Protocol (EPP)

6.103. epp-35 - domain <renew> command test

6.103.1. Description

This test will confirm that the client is able to renew domain names.

  • Following a succesful <renew> command, the expiry date of the domain MUST have been increased by the period specified by the client;
  • Where a server supports RFC 3915, the domain MUST have an RGP status of renewPeriod;
  • The server MUST reject a <renew> command if it would result in the expiry date being more than 10 years into the future.

6.103.2. Errors

This test case may produce the following errors:

  • None specified.

6.103.3. Input parameters

This test case requires the following input parameters:

  • general.gracePeriodsSupported (boolean)

6.103.4. Resources

The following resources may be required to prepare for this test plan:

  • None specified.

6.103.5. Dependencies

This test case requires the following test cases to have successfully passed:

  • epp-32 - domain <create> command test
  • epp-34 - domain <update> command test

6.103.6. Dependants

The following test cases require this test case to have successfully passed:

  • None specified.

6.103.7. Test suites

This test case is used in the following test suites:

  • Extensible Provisioning Protocol (EPP)

6.104. epp-36 - domain <transfer> command test

6.104.1. Description

This test will confirm that the client is able to initiate a domain transfer.

The client will perform an <update> command to set the authInfo code for the test domain (taken from the set created in epp-32) to a randomly-determined value.

Then, using a second set of credentials, the client will connect to the EPP server and authenticate, submit <transfer> commands, and validate the responses.

This test will confirm that:

  • the server rejects a <transfer> command with an invalid authInfo code
  • the server rejects a command which would extend the domain’s validity period more than 10 years into the future
  • the server accepts a <transfer> command with a valid authInfo code and period.

Once the transfer request has been accepted, the sponsoring client will wait for a message to be received on the server’s message queue, and will then approve the transfer.

Once the gaining registrar has also received a message on the queue, the client will confirm that:

  • the domain is now under the sponsorship of the gaining registrar
  • the authInfo code has been reset by the server (if the server supports RFC 9154).

6.104.2. Errors

This test case may produce the following errors:

  • None specified.

6.104.3. Input parameters

This test case requires the following input parameters:

  • epp.transferClid (string)
  • epp.transferPwd (string)

6.104.4. Resources

The following resources may be required to prepare for this test plan:

  • None specified.

6.104.5. Dependencies

This test case requires the following test cases to have successfully passed:

  • epp-32 - domain <create> command test
  • epp-35 - domain <renew> command test

6.104.6. Dependants

The following test cases require this test case to have successfully passed:

  • None specified.

6.104.7. Test suites

This test case is used in the following test suites:

  • Extensible Provisioning Protocol (EPP)

6.105. epp-37 - domain <delete> command test

6.105.1. Description

This test will perform <delete> commands on the objects created during epp-32 and will confirm that the server accepts the <delete> command with a 1xxx response code.

6.106. epp-39 - domain restore test (if applicable)

6.106.1. Description

This test will perform RGP restore operations on the objects deleted during epp-37, in order to confirm the correct operation of the server’s implementation of RFC 3915.

If the value of the general.gracePeriodsSupported parameter is false, this test will be skipped.

  • Extensible Provisioning Protocol (EPP)

6.107. idn-01 - Label validation test

6.107.1. Description

This test confirms that the EPP server correctly accepts or rejects domain <create> commands for valid and invalid IDN labels, respectively.

If there are no IDN tables supported under any of the TLDs associated with the test, then this test will be skipped.

For each supported IDN table, the test client will perform a series of <create> commands using a pre-defined catalogue of test labels. If required, the client will create any contact object(s) needed.

The server MUST reject all <create> commands for invalid labels and MUST accept all <create> commands for valid labels.

6.107.2. Errors

This test case may produce the following errors:

  • None specified.

6.107.3. Input parameters

This test case requires the following input parameters:

  • epp.clid (string)
  • epp.hostName (string)
  • epp.pwd (string)
  • general.minimalPublicDataSet (boolean)

6.107.4. Resources

The following resources may be required to prepare for this test plan:

  • None specified.

6.107.5. Dependencies

This test case requires the following test cases to have successfully passed:

  • None specified.

6.107.6. Dependants

The following test cases require this test case to have successfully passed:

  • None specified.

6.107.7. Test suites

This test case is used in the following test suites:

  • Internationalized Domain Names (IDN)

6.108. idn-02 - Level 1 variant handling test

6.108.1. Description

This test confirms the EPP server’s conformance with the Level 1 variant support (no support for variant activation, all variants are blocked).

If there are no IDN tables for which Level 1 support is claimed, this test will be skipped.

For each supported IDN table, the test client will perform a series of <create> commands using a pre-defined catalogue of test labels. If required, the client will create any contact object(s) needed.

The client will then submit <create> commands for one or more labels that are variants of the names created in the first step. The server MUST reject these commands.

6.108.2. Errors

This test case may produce the following errors:

  • None specified.

6.108.3. Input parameters

This test case requires the following input parameters:

  • epp.clid (string)
  • epp.hostName (string)
  • epp.pwd (string)
  • general.minimalPublicDataSet (boolean)

6.108.4. Resources

The following resources may be required to prepare for this test plan:

  • None specified.

6.108.5. Dependencies

This test case requires the following test cases to have successfully passed:

  • None specified.

6.108.6. Dependants

The following test cases require this test case to have successfully passed:

  • None specified.

6.108.7. Test suites

This test case is used in the following test suites:

  • Internationalized Domain Names (IDN)

6.109. idn-03 - Level 2 variant handling test

6.109.1. Description

This test confirms the EPP server’s conformance with the Level 2 variant support (variants are supported within the same TLD).

If there are no IDN tables for which Level 2 support is claimed, this test will be skipped.

For each supported IDN table, the test client will perform a series of <create> commands using a pre-defined catalogue of test labels. If required, the client will create any contact object(s) needed.

The client will then submit <create> commands for one or more labels that are variants of the names created in the first step. Some of these commands will be made using the same registrar account as the first step, while some will be made using alternate credentials. If the value of the general.minimalPublicDataSet input parameter is false, then some commands will also use a different registrant contact.

The server MUST reject <create> commands where the (a) registrar is different from that of the primary label or (b) the registrant (if applicable) is different.

6.109.2. Errors

This test case may produce the following errors:

  • None specified.

6.109.3. Input parameters

This test case requires the following input parameters:

  • epp.clid (string)
  • epp.hostName (string)
  • epp.pwd (string)
  • epp.transferClid (string)
  • epp.transferPwd (string)
  • general.minimalPublicDataSet (boolean)

6.109.4. Resources

The following resources may be required to prepare for this test plan:

  • None specified.

6.109.5. Dependencies

This test case requires the following test cases to have successfully passed:

  • None specified.

6.109.6. Dependants

The following test cases require this test case to have successfully passed:

  • None specified.

6.109.7. Test suites

This test case is used in the following test suites:

  • Internationalized Domain Names (IDN)

6.110. idn-04 - Level 3 variant handling test

6.110.1. Description

This test confirms the EPP server’s conformance with the Level 3 variant support (variants are supported within variant TLD(s)).

If there are no IDN tables for which Level 3 support is claimed, this test will be skipped.

For each supported IDN table, the test client will perform a series of <create> commands using a pre-defined catalogue of test labels. If required, the client will create any contact object(s) needed.

The client will then submit <create> commands for one or more labels that are variants (at both second- and top-level) of the names created in the first step. Some of these commands will be made using the same registrar account as the first step, while some will be made using alternate credentials. If the value of the general.minimalPublicDataSet input parameter is false, then some commands will also use a different registrant contact.

The server MUST reject <create> commands where the (a) registrar is different from that of the primary label or (b) the registrant (if applicable) is different.

6.110.2. Errors

This test case may produce the following errors:

  • None specified.

6.110.3. Input parameters

This test case requires the following input parameters:

  • epp.clid (string)
  • epp.hostName (string)
  • epp.pwd (string)
  • epp.transferClid (string)
  • epp.transferPwd (string)
  • general.minimalPublicDataSet (boolean)

6.110.4. Resources

The following resources may be required to prepare for this test plan:

  • None specified.

6.110.5. Dependencies

This test case requires the following test cases to have successfully passed:

  • None specified.

6.110.6. Dependants

The following test cases require this test case to have successfully passed:

  • None specified.

6.110.7. Test suites

This test case is used in the following test suites:

  • Internationalized Domain Names (IDN)

6.111. integration-01 - EPP -> RDAP Integration Test

6.111.1. Description

This test confirms that the EPP and RDAP systems are properly integrated, that is, that transform commands performed on objects in the EPP system are reflected in the RDAP system within the Service Level Requirement of the SLA.

The test system will perform RDAP queries to confirm that the RDAP server provides responses for the domain and host objects created in epp-32 and epp-28 (if applicable). The RDAP server MUST provide a 200 response within 1 hour of the object’s <crDate> element.

6.111.2. Errors

This test case may produce the following errors:

  • None specified.

6.111.3. Input parameters

This test case requires the following input parameters:

  • rdap.baseURLs (object)

6.111.4. Resources

The following resources may be required to prepare for this test plan:

  • None specified.

6.111.5. Dependencies

This test case requires the following test cases to have successfully passed:

  • epp-28 - host <create> command test (if applicable)
  • epp-32 - domain <create> command test

6.111.6. Dependants

The following test cases require this test case to have successfully passed:

  • None specified.

6.111.7. Test suites

This test case is used in the following test suites:

  • Standard Integration Test

6.112. integration-02 - EPP -> DNS Integration Test

6.112.1. Description

This test confirms that the EPP and DNS systems are properly integrated, that is, that transform commands performed on objects in the EPP system are reflected in the RDAP system within the Service Level Requirement of the SLA.

The test system will perform DNS queries to confirm that the DNS servers provides responses for the domain names created in epp-32. All DNS servers MUST provide the correct DNS response within 1 hour of the object’s <crDate> element.

6.112.2. Errors

This test case may produce the following errors:

  • None specified.

6.112.3. Input parameters

This test case requires the following input parameters:

  • dns.nameservers (object)

6.112.4. Resources

The following resources may be required to prepare for this test plan:

  • None specified.

6.112.5. Dependencies

This test case requires the following test cases to have successfully passed:

  • epp-32 - domain <create> command test

6.112.6. Dependants

The following test cases require this test case to have successfully passed:

  • None specified.

6.112.7. Test suites

This test case is used in the following test suites:

  • Standard Integration Test

6.113. integration-03 - EPP -> RDE Integration Test

6.113.1. Description

This test confirms that the EPP and RDE systems are properly integrated, that is, that objects created in the EPP system are reflected in a valid RDE deposit file within the Service Level Requirement of the SLA.

The test system will periodically connect to the SFTP server specified by the integration.rdeSFTPHostname input parameter, using the username specified in the integration.rdeSFTPUsername input parameter and the SSH key in the integration.rdeSFTPPublicKey resource, and look for .ryde files in the directory specified by the integration.rdeSFTPDirectory input parameter. Note that operators MUST ensure that the IP addresses listed in the integration.rdeSFTPACL resource have been added to the Access Control List for the SFTP server (if any).

All objects created in the epp-32 and epp-28 (if applicable) tests MUST be found within a valid RDE deposit file (that is, the deposit passes all the tests in the RDE test suite) within 24 hours of each object’s <crDate> element.

Furthermore, for each deposit found in the directory, the corresponding RDE report (as described in Section 2.1 of draft-lozano-icann-registry-interfaces) MUST be recieved on the test RRI environment before 23:59:59 UTC on the date specified in the Watermark element of the deposit file.

To facilitate submission of RDE reports, the RRI test environment will be configured to accept submissions for the TLDs associated with the test from clients using the same TLSA DNS hostnames that are configured for the test.

6.113.2. Errors

This test case may produce the following errors:

  • None specified.

6.113.3. Input parameters

This test case requires the following input parameters:

  • integration.rdeSFTPDirectory (string)
  • integration.rdeSFTPHostname (string)
  • integration.rdeSFTPUsername (string)
  • integration.rriACL (array)

6.113.4. Resources

The following resources may be required to prepare for this test plan:

  • integration.rdeSFTPACL
  • integration.rdeSFTPPublicKey

6.113.5. Dependencies

This test case requires the following test cases to have successfully passed:

  • epp-28 - host <create> command test (if applicable)
  • epp-32 - domain <create> command test

6.113.6. Dependants

The following test cases require this test case to have successfully passed:

  • None specified.

6.113.7. Test suites

This test case is used in the following test suites:

  • Standard Integration Test

6.114. minimumRPMs-01 - Sunrise domain <check> command test

6.114.1. Description

This test is used to confirm the conformance of the EPP server’s implementation of the Availability Check Form, as described in Section 3.1.2 of RFC 8334.

For this test, it is assumed that the EPP server has been configured to use data (specifically the Sunrise List, as described in Section 5.4.2.1 of RFC 9361) from the TMCH test environment.

The client will connect to the EPP server using the provided credentials and will then perform a series of <check> commands, using the Launch extension to specify a value of avail for the type attribute of the <launch:check> element, and sunrise for the <launch:phase> element. It will then confirm that the server returns an appropriate response:

  • The <domain:name> element for a syntactically valid domain which does not appear on the SURL MUST have an avail attribute of 0 or false.
  • The <domain:name> element for a domain which is present on the SURL, and does not already exist, MUST have an avail attribute of 1 or true.

6.114.2. Errors

This test case may produce the following errors:

  • EPP_CONNECT_ERROR (ERROR)
  • EPP_GENERIC_COMMAND_ERROR (ERROR)
  • EPP_LOGIN_ERROR (ERROR)
  • EPP_SCHEMA_VALIDATION_ERROR (ERROR)
  • EPP_SUNRISE_AVAILABILITY_CHECK_INVALID_RESULT (ERROR)

6.114.3. Input parameters

This test case requires the following input parameters:

  • epp.clid (string)
  • epp.hostName (string)
  • epp.pwd (string)

6.114.4. Resources

The following resources may be required to prepare for this test plan:

  • None specified.

6.114.5. Dependencies

This test case requires the following test cases to have successfully passed:

  • None specified.

6.114.6. Dependants

The following test cases require this test case to have successfully passed:

  • None specified.

6.114.7. Test suites

This test case is used in the following test suites:

  • Minimum Rights Protection Mechanisms (RPMs)

6.115. minimumRPMs-02 - Claims <check> command test

6.115.1. Description

This test is used to confirm the conformance of the EPP server’s implementation of the Claims Check Form, as described in Section 3.1.1 of RFC 8334.

For this test, it is assumed that the EPP server has been configured to use data (specifically the Domain Name Label List, as described in Section 5.3.3.1 of RFC 9361) from the TMCH test environment.

The client will connect to the EPP server using the provided credentials and will then perform a series of <check> commands, using the Launch extension to specify a value of claims for the type attribute of the <launch:check> element and the <launch:phase> element. It will then confirm that the server returns an appropriate response:

  • a <check> response for a domain that is present on the DNL contains the correct <launch:claimKey> element;
  • a <check> response for a domain that is NOT present on the DNL does not contain a <launch:claimKey> element.

6.115.2. Errors

This test case may produce the following errors:

  • None specified.

6.115.3. Input parameters

This test case requires the following input parameters:

  • epp.clid (string)
  • epp.hostName (string)
  • epp.pwd (string)

6.115.4. Resources

The following resources may be required to prepare for this test plan:

  • None specified.

6.115.5. Dependencies

This test case requires the following test cases to have successfully passed:

  • None specified.

6.115.6. Dependants

The following test cases require this test case to have successfully passed:

  • None specified.

6.115.7. Test suites

This test case is used in the following test suites:

  • Minimum Rights Protection Mechanisms (RPMs)

6.116. minimumRPMs-03 - Trademark <check> command test

6.116.1. Description

This test is used to confirm the conformance of the EPP server’s implementation of the Trademark Check Form, as described in Section 3.1.3 of RFC 8334.

For this test, it is assumed that the EPP server has been configured to use data (specifically the Domain Name Label List, as described in Section 5.3.3.1 of RFC 9361) from the TMCH test environment.

The client will connect to the EPP server using the provided credentials and will then perform a series of <check> commands, using the Launch extension to specify a value of trademark for the type attribute of the <launch:check> element. It will then confirm that the server returns an appropriate response:

  • a <check> response for a domain that is present on the DNL contains the correct <launch:claimKey> element;
  • a <check> response for a domain that is NOT present on the DNL does not contain a <launch:claimKey> element.

6.116.2. Errors

This test case may produce the following errors:

  • None specified.

6.116.3. Input parameters

This test case requires the following input parameters:

  • epp.clid (string)
  • epp.hostName (string)
  • epp.pwd (string)

6.116.4. Resources

The following resources may be required to prepare for this test plan:

  • None specified.

6.116.5. Dependencies

This test case requires the following test cases to have successfully passed:

  • None specified.

6.116.6. Dependants

The following test cases require this test case to have successfully passed:

  • None specified.

6.116.7. Test suites

This test case is used in the following test suites:

  • Minimum Rights Protection Mechanisms (RPMs)

6.117. minimumRPMs-04 - Sunrise domain/launch application <create> command test

6.117.1. Description

This test is used to confirm the conformance of the EPP server’s implementation of the Sunrise Create Form, as described in Section 3.3.1 of RFC 8334.

For this test, it is assumed that the EPP server has been configured to use data (specifically the Domain Name Label List, as described in Section 5.3.3.1 of RFC 9361) from the TMCH test environment.

The client will connect to the EPP server and will submit <create> commands, using domain names and SMD files present in the TMCH test environment.

If the server supports Start Date sunrises, the fully-qualified domain name will be constructed using a label from the SMD file and the zz--edsct TLD (eg example.zz-edsct). The Server MUST respond with a 1000 or 1001 result code, however, if the client receives a 2302 “object exists” result code, it will retry with a different domain name.

The client will also attempt to create a domain using an invalid SMD, which the server MUST reject.

If the server supports End Date sunrises, the fully-qualified domain name will be constructed using a label from the SMD file and the zz-sdsct TLD (eg example.zz-sdsct). The Server MUST respond with a 1000 or 1001 result code.

The client will also attempt to create a domain using an invalid SMD, which the server MUST reject.

If the server supports both modes, then both of the above tests will be performed.

6.117.2. Errors

This test case may produce the following errors:

  • None specified.

6.117.3. Input parameters

This test case requires the following input parameters:

  • epp.clid (string)
  • epp.hostModel (string)
  • epp.hostName (string)
  • epp.pwd (string)
  • general.minimalPublicDataSet (boolean)
  • general.sunriseModels (string)

6.117.4. Resources

The following resources may be required to prepare for this test plan:

  • None specified.

6.117.5. Dependencies

This test case requires the following test cases to have successfully passed:

  • None specified.

6.117.6. Dependants

The following test cases require this test case to have successfully passed:

  • None specified.

6.117.7. Test suites

This test case is used in the following test suites:

  • Minimum Rights Protection Mechanisms (RPMs)

6.118. minimumRPMs-05 - Sunrise launch application <info> command test

6.118.1. Description

In this test, the client will perform <info> commands on the objects created in minimumRPMs-04 and will confirm that they have successfully been created in the repository and have the correct object properties.

  • a start-date sunrise <create> command MUST result in the creation of a domain object;
  • an end-date sunrise <create> command MUST result in the creation of a launch application.

6.118.2. Errors

This test case may produce the following errors:

  • None specified.

6.118.3. Input parameters

This test case requires the following input parameters:

  • epp.clid (string)
  • epp.hostModel (string)
  • epp.hostName (string)
  • epp.pwd (string)
  • general.minimalPublicDataSet (boolean)
  • general.sunriseModels (string)

6.118.4. Resources

The following resources may be required to prepare for this test plan:

  • None specified.

6.118.5. Dependencies

This test case requires the following test cases to have successfully passed:

  • minimumRPMs-04 - Sunrise domain/launch application <create> command test

6.118.6. Dependants

The following test cases require this test case to have successfully passed:

  • None specified.

6.118.7. Test suites

This test case is used in the following test suites:

  • Minimum Rights Protection Mechanisms (RPMs)

6.119. minimumRPMs-06 - Trademark claims domain <create> command test

6.119.1. Description

This test is used to confirm the conformance of the EPP server’s implementation of the Claims Create Form, as described in Section 3.3.2 of RFC 8334.

For this test, it is assumed that the EPP server has been configured to use data (specifically the Domain Name Label List, as described in Section 5.3.3.1 of RFC 9361) from the TMCH test environment.

The client will connect to the EPP server and will submit <create> commands, using domain names present in the TMCH test environment.

The domain name will be constructed using a label from the DNL, and the zz-tcdct TLD (eg example.zz--tcdct). The client will perform a Trademark Claims <check> command beforehand to obtain the claim key, and will then synthesise a trademark claims acknowledgement. The server MUST respond with a 1000 or 10001 response.

The client will also perform <create> command using an invalid claims acknowledgements. The server MUST respond with a 2xxx error.

6.119.2. Errors

This test case may produce the following errors:

  • None specified.

6.119.3. Input parameters

This test case requires the following input parameters:

  • epp.clid (string)
  • epp.hostModel (string)
  • epp.hostName (string)
  • epp.pwd (string)
  • general.minimalPublicDataSet (boolean)
  • general.sunriseModels (string)

6.119.4. Resources

The following resources may be required to prepare for this test plan:

  • None specified.

6.119.5. Dependencies

This test case requires the following test cases to have successfully passed:

  • None specified.

6.119.6. Dependants

The following test cases require this test case to have successfully passed:

  • None specified.

6.119.7. Test suites

This test case is used in the following test suites:

  • Minimum Rights Protection Mechanisms (RPMs)

6.120. minimumRPMs-07 - LORDN submission test

6.120.1. Description

This test confirms the RSP’s support for the yd interface of the TMCH functional specification, as described in Section 4.3.7 of RFC 9361.

Within 24 hours of the completion of the minimumRPMs-06 test, the RSP MUST submit LORDN file(s) to the TMCH’s test interface, containing all the domain names created and activated as part of the minimumRPMs-04 and minimumRPMs-06 tests.

6.120.2. Errors

This test case may produce the following errors:

  • None specified.

6.120.3. Input parameters

This test case requires the following input parameters:

  • None specified.

6.120.4. Resources

The following resources may be required to prepare for this test plan:

  • None specified.

6.120.5. Dependencies

This test case requires the following test cases to have successfully passed:

  • minimumRPMs-04 - Sunrise domain/launch application <create> command test
  • minimumRPMs-06 - Trademark claims domain <create> command test

6.120.6. Dependants

The following test cases require this test case to have successfully passed:

  • None specified.

6.120.7. Test suites

This test case is used in the following test suites:

  • Minimum Rights Protection Mechanisms (RPMs)

6.138.7. Test suites

This test case is used in the following test suites:

  • Registration Data Access Protocol (RDAP)

6.148. rde-01 - validate deposit filename format

6.148.1. Description

  • The deposit filename MUST conform to the format specified in the RA.
  • The type of the deposit MUST be FULL.
  • The TLD in the filename MUST be present in the list of TLDs associated with the test.

6.148.2. Errors

This test case may produce the following errors:

  • None specified.

6.149. rde-02 - validate signature over deposit file

6.149.1. Description

The PGP signature MUST be valid for the deposit file and the RSP’s key.

6.150. rde-03 - decrypt deposit file(s)

6.150.1. Description

It MUST be possible to decrypt the deposit file using the RST key. The PGP public key for which the deposit MUST be encrypted may be found in the URL specified by the rde.encryptionKey resource.

6.150.2. Errors

6.151. rde-04 - validate XML/CSV

6.151.1. Description

  • XML deposit files MUST be well-formed and validate against the XML schema.
  • CSV files MUST conform to RFC 4180.
  • Deposits MUST NOT contain a mix of XML and CSV files for the deposit contents.

6.151.2. Errors

This test case may produce the following errors:

  • None specified.

6.152. rde-05 - validate object types

6.152.1. Description

The header object MUST reference the correct object XML namespace URIs.

The correct URIs is determined by the general.minimalPublicDataSet and epp.hostModel input parameters.

All expected URIs MUST be present in the header, and the header MUST NOT contain any unexpected URIs.

6.152.2. Errors

This test case may produce the following errors:

  • None specified.

6.153. rde-06 - validate object counts

6.153.1. Description

The number of each type of object MUST match the number of objects actually present in the deposit file.

6.154. rde-07 - validate domain objects

6.154.1. Description

Domain objects (whether CSV or XML) MUST have the required object properties, and the values of those object properties MUST be well-formed.

The required properties are:

  • <domain:name>
  • <domain:roid> (which MUST have a repository ID registered with IANA)
  • at least one <domain:status> element
  • <domain:registrant> (if general.minimalPublicDataSet is false)
  • <domain:clID> (sponsoring registrar ID)
  • <domain:crDate> (creation date)
  • <domain:exDate> (expiry date)

Contact, host and registrar objects (including optional objects such as admin and tech contacts) which are referenced in domain objects MUST be present in the deposit.

6.154.2. Errors

This test case may produce the following errors:

  • None specified.

6.154.3. Input parameters

This test case requires the following input parameters:

  • epp.hostModel (string)
  • general.minimalPublicDataSet (boolean)
  • rde.depositFile (file)

6.154.4. Resources

The following resources may be required to prepare for this test plan:

  • None specified.

6.154.5. Dependencies

This test case requires the following test cases to have successfully passed:

  • None specified.

6.154.6. Dependants

The following test cases require this test case to have successfully passed:

  • None specified.

6.154.7. Test suites

This test case is used in the following test suites:

  • Registry Data Escrow (RDE)

6.155. rde-08 - validate host objects (if applicable)

6.155.1. Description

Host objects (whether CSV or XML) MUST have the required object properties, and the values of those object properties MUST be well-formed.

The required properties are:

  • <host:name>
  • <host:roid> (which MUST have a repository ID registered with IANA)
  • at least one <domain:status> element
  • one or more <addr> elements (if the host name is subordinate to the TLD)
  • <host:clID> (sponsoring registrar ID)

If the applicant uses the host attribute model, then this test will be skipped.

6.155.2. Errors

This test case may produce the following errors:

  • None specified.

6.155.3. Input parameters

This test case requires the following input parameters:

  • epp.hostModel (string)
  • rde.depositFile (file)

6.155.4. Resources

The following resources may be required to prepare for this test plan:

  • None specified.

6.155.5. Dependencies

This test case requires the following test cases to have successfully passed:

  • None specified.

6.155.6. Dependants

The following test cases require this test case to have successfully passed:

  • None specified.

6.155.7. Test suites

This test case is used in the following test suites:

  • Registry Data Escrow (RDE)

6.156. rde-09 - validate contact objects (if applicable)

6.156.1. Description

Contact objects (whether CSV or XML) MUST have the required object properties, and the values of those object properties MUST be well-formed.

The required properties are:

  • <contact:id>
  • <contact:roid> (which MUST have a repository ID registered with IANA)
  • at least one <contact:status> element
  • 1-2 <contact:postalInfo> elements containing the following:
    • a “type” attribute of “int” or “loc”
    • <contact:name> element
    • an <contact:addr> element containing the following:
      • at least one 1 <contact:street> element
      • <contact:city> element
      • <contact:cc> element
  • <contact:voice>
  • <contact:email>
  • <contact:clID> (sponsoring registrar ID)

If the applicant uses the “thin” registry model, then this test will be skipped.

6.156.2. Errors

This test case may produce the following errors:

  • None specified.

6.156.3. Input parameters

This test case requires the following input parameters:

  • general.minimalPublicDataSet (boolean)
  • rde.depositFile (file)

6.156.4. Resources

The following resources may be required to prepare for this test plan:

  • None specified.

6.156.5. Dependencies

This test case requires the following test cases to have successfully passed:

  • None specified.

6.156.6. Dependants

The following test cases require this test case to have successfully passed:

  • None specified.

6.156.7. Test suites

This test case is used in the following test suites:

  • Registry Data Escrow (RDE)

6.157. rde-10 - validate registrar objects

6.157.1. Description

Registrar objects (whether CSV or XML) MUST have the required object properties, and the values of those object properties MUST be well-formed.

The required properties are:

  • <rdeRegistrar:id>
  • <rdeRegistrar:name>
  • <rdeRegistrar:gurid> (IANA ID)
