6.158. rde-11 - validate IDN table objects (if applicable)

6.158.1. Description

IDN table objects (whether CSV or XML) MUST have the required object properties, and the values of those object properties MUST be well-formed.

All IDN table objects present in the deposit MUST correspond to IDN tables approved for the TLD, and all approved tables MUST have a corresponding object in the deposit.

6.159. rde-12 - validate NNDN objects

6.159.1. Description

NNDN table objects (whether CSV or XML) MUST have the required object properties, and the values of those object properties MUST be well-formed.

The aName property of NNDN objects MUST NOT match the name property of a domain object.

6.160. rde-13 - validate EPP parameters object

6.160.1. Description

The EPP Parameters object MUST match the <greeting> element returned by the EPP server.

6.161. rde-14 - validate policy object (if applicable)

6.161.1. Description

The object policies included in the <rdePolicy:policy> object MUST conform to the Registration Data Policy and the applicable data model.

  • If the general.minimalPublicDataSet input parameter is true, then contact objects MUST NOT be present in the deposit.
  • If the epp.hostModel input parameter is attributes, then host objects MUST NOT be present in the deposit.

6.161.2. Errors

This test case may produce the following errors:

  • None specified.

6.161.3. Input parameters

This test case requires the following input parameters:

  • epp.hostModel (string)
  • general.minimalPublicDataSet (boolean)

6.161.4. Resources

  • None specified.

  • None specified.

The following test cases require this test case to have successfully passed:

  • None specified.

6.161.7. Test suites

This test case is used in the following test suites:

  • Registry Data Escrow (RDE)

6.162. srsgw-01 - IPv4 and IPv6 connectivity

6.162.1. Description

This test confirms that the SRS Gateway EPP system is reachable over IPv4 and IPv6.

The SRS Gateway EPP server host name will be resolved to obtain its IPv4 and IPv6 addresses. The client will then attempt to connect to TCP port 700 on these addresses.

6.162.2. Errors

This test case may produce the following errors:

  • None specified.

6.162.3. Input parameters

This test case requires the following input parameters:

  • srsgw.eppHostName (string)

6.162.4. Resources

The following resources may be required to prepare for this test plan:

  • epp.clientACL
  • epp.clientCertificate

6.162.5. Dependencies

This test case requires the following test cases to have successfully passed:

  • None specified.

6.162.6. Dependants

The following test cases require this test case to have successfully passed:

  • None specified.

6.162.7. Test suites

This test case is used in the following test suites:

  • SRS Gateway

6.163. srsgw-02 - Host <create> synchronization (if applicable)

6.163.1. Description

This test confirms that host objects created in the SRS Gateway EPP system are correctly synchronized with the primary registry system.

If the value of the epp.hostModel input parameter is attributes, then this test will be skipped.

The client will connect to the SRS Gateway EPP system, authenticate, and submit a <create> command for a pseudo-randomly generated host name. IP address information will be provided if required. The server MUST respond with a 1000 or 1001 response. The client will then perform an <info> command and will capture the response.

It will then connect to the primary EPP system, authenticate, and perform an <info> command for the object created in the first step. If the server responds with a 2303 response, it will wait for 30 seconds and retry. The server MUST respond to the first or second <info> command with a 1000 response.

The two <info> responses will then be compared and MUST be identical.

6.163.2. Errors

This test case may produce the following errors:

  • None specified.

6.163.3. Input parameters

This test case requires the following input parameters:

  • epp.clid (string)
  • epp.hostModel (string)
  • epp.hostName (string)
  • epp.pwd (string)
  • srsgw.eppClid (string)
  • srsgw.eppHostName (string)
  • srsgw.eppPwd (string)

6.163.4. Resources

The following resources may be required to prepare for this test plan:

  • epp.clientACL
  • epp.clientCertificate

6.163.5. Dependencies

This test case requires the following test cases to have successfully passed:

  • None specified.

6.163.6. Dependants

The following test cases require this test case to have successfully passed:

  • None specified.

6.163.7. Test suites

This test case is used in the following test suites:

  • SRS Gateway

6.164. srsgw-03 - Contact <create> synchronization (if applicable)

6.164.1. Description

This test confirms that contact objects created in the SRS Gateway EPP system are correctly synchronized with the primary registry system.

If the value of the general.minimalPublicDataSet input parameter is true, then this test will be skipped.

The client will connect to the SRS Gateway EPP system, authenticate, and submit a <create> command for a pseudo-randomly generated contact object. The client will then perform an <info> command and will capture the response.

It will then connect to the primary EPP system, authenticate, and perform an <info> command for the object created in the first step. If the server responds with a 2303 response, it will wait for 30 seconds and retry. The server MUST respond to the first or second <info> command with a 1000 response.

The two <info> responses will then be compared and MUST be identical.

6.164.2. Errors

This test case may produce the following errors:

  • None specified.

6.164.3. Input parameters

This test case requires the following input parameters:

  • epp.clid (string)
  • epp.hostName (string)
  • epp.pwd (string)
  • general.minimalPublicDataSet (boolean)
  • srsgw.eppClid (string)
  • srsgw.eppHostName (string)
  • srsgw.eppPwd (string)

6.164.4. Resources

The following resources may be required to prepare for this test plan:

  • None specified.

6.164.5. Dependencies

This test case requires the following test cases to have successfully passed:

  • None specified.

6.164.6. Dependants

The following test cases require this test case to have successfully passed:

  • None specified.

6.164.7. Test suites

This test case is used in the following test suites:

  • SRS Gateway

6.165. srsgw-04 - Domain <create> synchronization

6.165.1. Description

This test confirms that domain objects created in the SRS Gateway EPP system are correctly synchronized with the primary registry system.

The client will connect to the SRS Gateway EPP system, authenticate, and submit <create> commands for a pseudo-randomly generated domain names. Contact and nameserver objects created in srsgw-02 and srsgw-03 will be used if required. The server MUST respond with 1000 or 1001 responses. The client will then perform <info> commands and will capture the responses.

It will then connect to the primary EPP system, authenticate, and perform <info> commands for the domains created in the first step. If the server responds with a 2303 response, it will wait for 30 seconds and retry. The server MUST respond to the first or second <info> command with a 1000 response.

The pairs of <info> responses will then be compared and MUST be identical.

6.165.2. Errors

This test case may produce the following errors:

  • None specified.

6.165.3. Input parameters

This test case requires the following input parameters:

  • epp.clid (string)
  • epp.hostModel (string)
  • epp.hostName (string)
  • epp.pwd (string)
  • general.minimalPublicDataSet (boolean)
  • srsgw.eppClid (string)
  • srsgw.eppHostName (string)
  • srsgw.eppPwd (string)

6.165.4. Resources

The following resources may be required to prepare for this test plan:

  • None specified.

6.165.5. Dependencies

This test case requires the following test cases to have successfully passed:

  • srsgw-02 - Host <create> synchronization (if applicable)
  • srsgw-03 - Contact <create> synchronization (if applicable)

6.165.6. Dependants

The following test cases require this test case to have successfully passed:

  • None specified.

6.165.7. Test suites

This test case is used in the following test suites:

  • SRS Gateway

6.166. srsgw-05 - Domain <renew> synchronisation

6.166.1. Description

This test confirms that the expiry dates of domain objects renewed in the SRS Gateway EPP system are correctly synchronized with the primary registry system.

The client will connect to the SRS Gateway EPP system, authenticate, and submit a <renew> command for the domain created in srsgw-04. The server MUST respond with a 1000 or 1001 response. The client will then perform an <info> command and will capture the response.

It will then connect to the primary EPP system, authenticate, and perform an <info> command for the domain renewed in the first step. The server MUST respond with a 1000 response.

The <exDate> element of the two <info> responses will then be compared and MUST be identical.

6.166.2. Errors

This test case may produce the following errors:

  • None specified.

6.166.3. Input parameters

This test case requires the following input parameters:

  • epp.clid (string)
  • epp.hostName (string)
  • epp.pwd (string)
  • srsgw.eppClid (string)
  • srsgw.eppHostName (string)
  • srsgw.eppPwd (string)

6.166.4. Resources

The following resources may be required to prepare for this test plan:

  • None specified.

6.166.5. Dependencies

This test case requires the following test cases to have successfully passed:

  • srsgw-04 - Domain <create> synchronization

6.166.6. Dependants

The following test cases require this test case to have successfully passed:

  • None specified.

6.166.7. Test suites

This test case is used in the following test suites:

  • SRS Gateway

6.167. srsgw-06 - Domain <transfer> synchronisation

6.167.1. Description

This test confirms that transfer requests submitted in the SRS Gateway EPP system are correctly synchronized with the primary registry system.

The client will connect to the SRS Gateway EPP system, authenticate, and perform an <update> command to specify an authInfo code for the domain created in srsgw-04. The server MUST respond with a 1000 or 1001 response.

It will then reconnect to the SRS Gateway EPP system using the credentials of a second registrar account and submit a <transfer op="request"> command using the authInfo command set for the domain in the first step. The server MUST respond with a 1000 or 1001 response.

It will then connect to the primary EPP system, authenticate, and perform an <info> command for the domain. The server MUST respond with a 1000 response.

  • if the response to the <transfer op="request"> command was 1000, then the <domain:clID> element MUST contain the value of the srsgw.eppTransferClid input parameter.
  • if the response to the <transfer op="request"> command was 1001, then the domain MUST have the pendingTransfer status.

6.167.2. Errors

This test case may produce the following errors:

  • None specified.

6.167.3. Input parameters

This test case requires the following input parameters:

  • epp.clid (string)
  • epp.hostName (string)
  • epp.pwd (string)
  • srsgw.eppClid (string)
  • srsgw.eppHostName (string)
  • srsgw.eppPwd (string)
  • srsgw.eppTransferClid (string)
  • srsgw.eppTransferPwd (string)

6.167.4. Resources

The following resources may be required to prepare for this test plan:

  • None specified.

6.167.5. Dependencies

This test case requires the following test cases to have successfully passed:

  • srsgw-05 - Domain <renew> synchronisation

6.167.6. Dependants

The following test cases require this test case to have successfully passed:

  • None specified.

6.167.7. Test suites

This test case is used in the following test suites:

  • SRS Gateway

6.168. srsgw-07 - Domain <transfer> approval synchronisation

6.168.1. Description

This test confirms that transfer request approvals submitted in the SRS Gateway EPP system are correctly synchronized with the primary registry system.

If the response to the <transfer op="request"> command performed in srsgw-07 was 1000, then this test will be skipped.

The client will connect to the SRS Gateway EPP system, authenticate, and perform an <transfer op="approve"> command for the domain for which a transfer was requested in srsgw-04. The server MUST respond with a 1000 or 1001 response.

It will then connect to the primary EPP system, authenticate, and perform an <info> command for the domain. The server MUST respond with a 1000 response. The <domain:clID> element MUST contain the value of the srsgw.eppTransferClid input parameter.

6.168.2. Errors

This test case may produce the following errors:

  • None specified.

6.168.3. Input parameters

This test case requires the following input parameters:

  • epp.clid (string)
  • epp.hostName (string)
  • epp.pwd (string)
  • srsgw.eppClid (string)
  • srsgw.eppHostName (string)
  • srsgw.eppPwd (string)
  • srsgw.eppTransferClid (string)

6.168.4. Resources

The following resources may be required to prepare for this test plan:

  • None specified.

6.168.5. Dependencies

This test case requires the following test cases to have successfully passed:

  • srsgw-06 - Domain <transfer> synchronisation

6.168.6. Dependants

The following test cases require this test case to have successfully passed:

  • None specified.

6.168.7. Test suites

This test case is used in the following test suites:

  • SRS Gateway

6.169. srsgw-08 - Domain <delete> synchronisation

6.169.1. Description

This test confirms that domain objects deleted in the SRS Gateway EPP system are correctly synchronized with the primary registry system.

The client will connect to the SRS Gateway EPP system, authenticate using the credentials provided in epp.transferClid and epp.transferPwd, and submit a <delete> command for the domain transferred in srsgw-07. If the value of the general.gracePeriodsSupported input parameter is false, the server MUST respond with a 1000 response. Otherwise it MUST respond with a 1001 response.

It will then connect to the primary EPP system, authenticate, and perform an <info> command for the domain renewed in the first step.

  • if general.gracePeriodsSupported is false, the server MUST respond to the <info> command with a 2303 (“object does not exist”) result code.
  • If general.gracePeriodsSupported is true, the domain object MUST have the pendingDelete status and have an RGP status of pendingDeleteRestorable.

6.169.2. Errors

This test case may produce the following errors:

  • None specified.

6.169.3. Input parameters

This test case requires the following input parameters:

  • epp.clid (string)
  • epp.hostName (string)
  • epp.pwd (string)
  • general.gracePeriodsSupported (boolean)
  • srsgw.eppClid (string)
  • srsgw.eppHostName (string)
  • srsgw.eppPwd (string)

6.169.4. Resources

The following resources may be required to prepare for this test plan:

  • None specified.

6.169.5. Dependencies

This test case requires the following test cases to have successfully passed:

  • srsgw-07 - Domain <transfer> approval synchronisation

6.169.6. Dependants

The following test cases require this test case to have successfully passed:

  • None specified.

6.169.7. Test suites

This test case is used in the following test suites:

  • SRS Gateway

6.170. srsgw-09 - Host <update> synchronization (if applicable)

6.170.1. Description

This test confirms that host objects updated in the SRS Gateway EPP system are correctly synchronized with the primary registry system.

If the value of the epp.hostModel input parameter is attributes, then this test will be skipped.

The test client will connect to the SRS Gateway EPP server and perform <update> commands on the objects created in srsgw-02, specifically to add and remove status codes and IP addresses. It will then perform <info> commands on those objects.

The client will then connect to the primary registry EPP server and perform <info> commands for those objects.

The two sets of <info> responses MUST be identical.

6.170.2. Errors

This test case may produce the following errors:

  • None specified.

6.170.3. Input parameters

This test case requires the following input parameters:

  • epp.clid (string)
  • epp.hostModel (string)
  • epp.hostName (string)
  • epp.pwd (string)
  • srsgw.eppClid (string)
  • srsgw.eppHostName (string)
  • srsgw.eppPwd (string)

6.170.4. Resources

The following resources may be required to prepare for this test plan:

  • None specified.

6.170.5. Dependencies

This test case requires the following test cases to have successfully passed:

  • srsgw-02 - Host <create> synchronization (if applicable)

6.170.6. Dependants

The following test cases require this test case to have successfully passed:

  • None specified.

6.170.7. Test suites

This test case is used in the following test suites:

  • SRS Gateway

6.171. srsgw-10 - Host <delete> synchronization (if applicable)

6.171.1. Description

This test confirms that host objects deleted in the SRS Gateway EPP system are correctly synchronized with the primary registry system.

If the value of the epp.hostModel input parameter is attributes, then this test will be skipped.

The test client will connect to the SRS Gateway EPP server and perform <delete> commands on objects created in srsgw-02. The server MUST respond with a 1000 response.

The client will then connect to the primary registry EPP server and perform <info> commands for those objects. The server MUST respond with a 2303 “object does not exist” response.

6.172. srsgw-11 - Contact <update> synchronization (if applicable)

6.172.1. Description

This test confirms that contact objects updated in the SRS Gateway EPP system are correctly synchronized with the primary registry system.

If the value of the general.minimalPublicDataSet input parameter is true, then this test will be skipped.

The test client will connect to the SRS Gateway EPP server and perform <update> commands on the objects created in srsgw-03. It will then perform <info> commands on those objects.

The client will then connect to the primary registry EPP server and perform <info> commands for those objects.

The two sets of <info> responses MUST be identical.

If the value of the general.minimalPublicDataSet input parameter is true, then this test will be skipped.

The test client will connect to the SRS Gateway EPP server and perform <delete> commands on objects created in srsgw-03. The server MUST respond with a 1000 response.

The client will then connect to the primary registry EPP server and perform <info> commands for those objects. The server MUST respond with a 2303 “object does not exist” response.

6.174. srsgw-13 - Domain RDAP synchronization

6.174.1. Description

This test confirms that the SRS Gateway’s RDAP service provides responses to domain lookups that match those of the primary registry RDAP server.

The test system will perform RDAP queries for some of the objects created in srsgw-04 against both the primary registry RDAP server and the SRS Gateway RDAP server. After canonicalisation, the responses from each server MUST be identical.

6.174.2. Errors

This test case may produce the following errors:

  • None specified.

6.174.3. Input parameters

This test case requires the following input parameters:

  • rdap.baseURLs (object)
  • srsgw.rdapBaseURLs (object)

6.174.4. Resources

The following resources may be required to prepare for this test plan:

  • None specified.

6.174.5. Dependencies

This test case requires the following test cases to have successfully passed:

  • srsgw-04 - Domain <create> synchronization

6.174.6. Dependants

The following test cases require this test case to have successfully passed:

  • None specified.

6.174.7. Test suites

This test case is used in the following test suites:

  • SRS Gateway

6.175. srsgw-14 - Nameserver RDAP synchronization

6.175.1. Description

This test confirms that the SRS Gateway’s RDAP service provides responses to domain lookups that match those of the primary registry RDAP server.

If the value of the epp.hostModel input parameter is attributes, then this test will be skipped.

The test system will perform RDAP queries for some of the objects created in srsgw-02 against both the primary registry RDAP server and the SRS Gateway RDAP server. After canonicalisation, the JSON responses from each server MUST be identical.

6.175.2. Errors

This test case may produce the following errors:

  • None specified.

6.175.3. Input parameters

This test case requires the following input parameters:

  • rdap.baseURLs (object)
  • srsgw.rdapBaseURLs (object)

6.175.4. Resources

The following resources may be required to prepare for this test plan:

  • None specified.

6.175.5. Dependencies

This test case requires the following test cases to have successfully passed:

  • srsgw-02 - Host <create> synchronization (if applicable)

6.175.6. Dependants

The following test cases require this test case to have successfully passed:

  • None specified.

6.175.7. Test suites

This test case is used in the following test suites:

  • SRS Gateway

6.176. srsgw-15 - Registrar RDAP synchronization

6.176.1. Description

This test confirms that the SRS Gateway’s RDAP service provides responses to registrar (entity) lookups that match those of the primary registry RDAP server.

The test system will perform RDAP queries for some of the objects created in srsgw-04 against the primary registry RDAP server in order to obtain the handle property of the entity with the registrar role. It will then construct two URLs using this value and the values of the rdap.baseURLs and srsgw.rdapBaseURLs input parameters. It will then retrieve those URLs.

After canonicalisation, the JSON responses from each server MUST be identical.

6.176.2. Errors

This test case may produce the following errors:

  • None specified.

6.176.3. Input parameters

This test case requires the following input parameters:

  • rdap.baseURLs (object)
  • srsgw.rdapBaseURLs (object)

6.176.4. Resources

The following resources may be required to prepare for this test plan:

  • None specified.

6.176.5. Dependencies

This test case requires the following test cases to have successfully passed:

  • srsgw-02 - Host <create> synchronization (if applicable)

6.176.6. Dependants

The following test cases require this test case to have successfully passed:

  • None specified.

6.176.7. Test suites

This test case is used in the following test suites:

  • SRS Gateway

7. Input Parameters

7.1. dns.nameservers

7.1.1. Description

The set of nameservers that will be authoritative for the TLD(s).

This input parameter is an array where the object properties are the TLD names, and the values are objects. For these objects, the properties are the nameserver names, and the values are arrays of IPv4 and IPv6 addresses.

There MUST be at least two nameservers, and at least two nameservers MUST have at least one IPv6 address.

7.1.2. Type

object

7.1.3. Example

{
   "dns.nameservers" : {
      "example" : {
         "ns1.example.com" : [
            "192.168.53.1",
            "2001:DB8::53:1"
         ],
         "ns2.example.com" : [
            "192.168.53.2",
            "2001:DB8::53:2"
         ]
      }
   }
}

7.1.4. Test cases

This input parameter is used in the following test cases:

  • dnssec-91 - Permitted signing algorithms
  • integration-02 - EPP -> DNS Integration Test

7.2. dnssec.dsRecords

7.2.1. Description

The DS record(s) that may be used to validate the DNSSEC signature for the TLD(s). This input parameter is an object where the object properties are the TLD names and the values are arrays of objects representing DS records.

There MUST be an entry for every TLD in the TLD set and there MUST be at least one DS record for each TLD.

7.2.2. Type

object

7.2.3. Example

{
   "dnssec.dsRecords" : {
      "example" : [
         {
            "alg" : "8",
            "digest" : "E2D3...5766",
            "digestType" : "2",
            "keyTag" : "12345"
         }
      ]
   }
}

7.2.4. Test cases

This input parameter is used in the following test cases:

  • dnssec-92 - Permitted DS record hash algorithm(s)

7.3. dnssecOps.algorithmRolloverZone

7.3.1. Description

The domain name which will be monitored for the occurrence of an algorithm rollover.

7.3.2. Type

string

7.3.3. Example

{
   "dnssecOps.algorithmRolloverZone" : "example.com"
}

7.3.4. Test cases

This input parameter is used in the following test cases:

  • dnssecOps03-AlgorithmRollover - algorithm rollover

7.4. dnssecOps.csk

7.4.1. Description

A boolean indicating whether the RSP uses a Combined Signing Key (CSK, also referred to as a “Single Type Signing Scheme”) instead of a split KSK/ZSK configuration.

7.4.2. Type

boolean

7.4.3. Example

{
   "dnssecOps.csk" : false
}

7.4.4. Test cases

This input parameter is used in the following test cases:

  • dnssecOps01-ZSKRollover - ZSK rollover

7.5. dnssecOps.kskRolloverZone

7.5.1. Description

The domain name which will be monitored for the occurrence of a KSK rollover.

7.5.2. Type

string

7.5.3. Example

{
   "dnssecOps.kskRolloverZone" : "example.com"
}

7.5.4. Test cases

This input parameter is used in the following test cases:

  • dnssecOps02-KSKRollover - KSK rollover

7.6. dnssecOps.zskRolloverZone

7.6.1. Description

The domain name which will be monitored for the occurrence of a ZSK rollover.

7.6.2. Type

string

7.6.3. Example

{
   "dnssecOps.zskRolloverZone" : "example.com"
}

7.6.4. Test cases

This input parameter is used in the following test cases:

  • dnssecOps01-ZSKRollover - ZSK rollover

7.7. epp.clid

7.7.1. Description

the username used to log in to the EPP server

7.7.2. Type

string

7.7.3. Example

{
   "epp.clid" : "clid-01"
}

7.7.4. Test cases

This input parameter is used in the following test cases:

  • epp-17 - <login> command **MUST** return a successful response
  • epp-33 - domain <info> command test
  • epp-34 - domain <update> command test
  • idn-01 - Label validation test
  • idn-02 - Level 1 variant handling test
  • idn-03 - Level 2 variant handling test
  • idn-04 - Level 3 variant handling test
  • minimumRPMs-01 - Sunrise domain <check> command test
  • minimumRPMs-02 - Claims <check> command test
  • minimumRPMs-03 - Trademark <check> command test
  • minimumRPMs-04 - Sunrise domain/launch application <create> command test
  • minimumRPMs-05 - Sunrise launch application <info> command test
  • minimumRPMs-06 - Trademark claims domain <create> command test
  • srsgw-02 - Host <create> synchronization (if applicable)
  • srsgw-03 - Contact <create> synchronization (if applicable)
  • srsgw-04 - Domain <create> synchronization
  • srsgw-05 - Domain <renew> synchronisation
  • srsgw-06 - Domain <transfer> synchronisation
  • srsgw-07 - Domain <transfer> approval synchronisation
  • srsgw-08 - Domain <delete> synchronisation
  • srsgw-09 - Host <update> synchronization (if applicable)
  • srsgw-10 - Host <delete> synchronization (if applicable)
  • srsgw-11 - Contact <update> synchronization (if applicable)
  • srsgw-12 - Contact <delete> synchronization (if applicable)

7.8. epp.hostModel

7.8.1. Description

The host model supported by the EPP server. The possible values for this parameter are: * objects * attributes

7.8.2. Type

string

7.8.3. Example

{
   "epp.hostModel" : "objects"
}

7.8.4. Test cases

This input parameter is used in the following test cases:

  • epp-15 - <objURI> element(s) in the <greeting> **MUST** be valid for the registry type
  • epp-16 - <extURI> element(s) in the <greeting> **MUST** be valid
  • epp-22 - host <check> command test (if applicable)
  • epp-28 - host <create> command test (if applicable)
  • epp-29 - host <info> command test (if applicable)
  • epp-31 - host <update> command test (if applicable)
  • epp-31a - host rename test (if applicable)
  • epp-31b - host <delete> command test (if applicable)
  • epp-32 - domain <create> command test
  • epp-34 - domain <update> command test
  • minimumRPMs-04 - Sunrise domain/launch application <create> command test
  • minimumRPMs-05 - Sunrise launch application <info> command test
  • minimumRPMs-06 - Trademark claims domain <create> command test
  • rde-05 - validate object types
  • rde-07 - validate domain objects
  • rde-08 - validate host objects (if applicable)
  • rde-14 - validate policy object (if applicable)
  • srsgw-02 - Host <create> synchronization (if applicable)
  • srsgw-04 - Domain <create> synchronization
  • srsgw-09 - Host <update> synchronization (if applicable)
  • srsgw-10 - Host <delete> synchronization (if applicable)

7.9. epp.hostName

7.9.1. Description

the fully-qualified domain name of the EPP server

7.9.2. Type

string

7.9.3. Example

{
   "epp.hostName" : "epp.rsp.tech"
}

7.9.4. Test cases

This input parameter is used in the following test cases:

  • epp-01 - EPP server **MUST** have at least one A record
  • epp-02 - EPP server **MUST** have at least one AAAA record
  • epp-03 - All IP addresses **MUST** accept TCP connections on port 700
  • epp-04 - All service ports support TLSv1.2 or higher
  • epp-05 - All service ports **MUST NOT** support TLSv1.1 or earlier
  • epp-06 - All service ports **MUST** offer a valid certificate issued by a trusted CA
  • epp-07 - TLS certificate **MUST** be valid
  • epp-08 - TLS certificate **MUST** be valid for the server name
  • epp-09 - All service ports **MUST** send a <greeting> frame after successful connection
  • epp-11 - <svID> element in the <greeting> **MUST** be valid
  • epp-12 - <svDate> element in the <greeting> **MUST** be valid
  • epp-13 - <version> element in the <greeting> **MUST** be valid
  • epp-14 - <lang> element(s) in the <greeting> **MUST** be valid
  • epp-15 - <objURI> element(s) in the <greeting> **MUST** be valid for the registry type
  • epp-16 - <extURI> element(s) in the <greeting> **MUST** be valid
  • epp-17 - <login> command **MUST** return a successful response
  • idn-01 - Label validation test
  • idn-02 - Level 1 variant handling test
  • idn-03 - Level 2 variant handling test
  • idn-04 - Level 3 variant handling test
  • minimumRPMs-01 - Sunrise domain <check> command test
  • minimumRPMs-02 - Claims <check> command test
  • minimumRPMs-03 - Trademark <check> command test
  • minimumRPMs-04 - Sunrise domain/launch application <create> command test
  • minimumRPMs-05 - Sunrise launch application <info> command test
  • minimumRPMs-06 - Trademark claims domain <create> command test
  • rde-13 - validate EPP parameters object
  • srsgw-02 - Host <create> synchronization (if applicable)
  • srsgw-03 - Contact <create> synchronization (if applicable)
  • srsgw-04 - Domain <create> synchronization
  • srsgw-05 - Domain <renew> synchronisation
  • srsgw-06 - Domain <transfer> synchronisation
  • srsgw-07 - Domain <transfer> approval synchronisation
  • srsgw-08 - Domain <delete> synchronisation
  • srsgw-09 - Host <update> synchronization (if applicable)
  • srsgw-10 - Host <delete> synchronization (if applicable)
  • srsgw-11 - Contact <update> synchronization (if applicable)
  • srsgw-12 - Contact <delete> synchronization (if applicable)

7.10. epp.pwd

7.10.1. Description

the password used to log in to the EPP server

7.10.2. Type

string

7.10.3. Example

{
   "epp.pwd" : "foo2bar"
}

7.10.4. Test cases

This input parameter is used in the following test cases:

  • epp-17 - <login> command **MUST** return a successful response
  • idn-01 - Label validation test
  • idn-02 - Level 1 variant handling test
  • idn-03 - Level 2 variant handling test
  • idn-04 - Level 3 variant handling test
  • minimumRPMs-01 - Sunrise domain <check> command test
  • minimumRPMs-02 - Claims <check> command test
  • minimumRPMs-03 - Trademark <check> command test
  • minimumRPMs-04 - Sunrise domain/launch application <create> command test
  • minimumRPMs-05 - Sunrise launch application <info> command test
  • minimumRPMs-06 - Trademark claims domain <create> command test
  • srsgw-02 - Host <create> synchronization (if applicable)
  • srsgw-03 - Contact <create> synchronization (if applicable)
  • srsgw-04 - Domain <create> synchronization
  • srsgw-05 - Domain <renew> synchronisation
  • srsgw-06 - Domain <transfer> synchronisation
  • srsgw-07 - Domain <transfer> approval synchronisation
  • srsgw-08 - Domain <delete> synchronisation
  • srsgw-09 - Host <update> synchronization (if applicable)
  • srsgw-10 - Host <delete> synchronization (if applicable)
  • srsgw-11 - Contact <update> synchronization (if applicable)
  • srsgw-12 - Contact <delete> synchronization (if applicable)

7.11. epp.registeredContacts

7.11.1. Description

An array of contact IDs that exist in the EPP server and which are therefore unavailable for registration.

If the value of general.minimalPublicDataSet is false, this array MUST contain one member for each TLD in the TLD set. However, if it is false, the array MUST be empty.

7.11.2. Type

array

7.11.3. Example

{
   "epp.registeredContacts" : [
      "abc123",
      "def321"
   ]
}

7.11.4. Test cases

This input parameter is used in the following test cases:

  • epp-23 - contact <check> command test (if applicable for the registry type)

7.12. epp.registeredNames

7.12.1. Description

An array of domain names that exist in the EPP server and which are therefore unavailable for registration. The array MUST contain one member for each TLD in the TLD set.

7.12.2. Type

array

7.12.3. Example

{
   "epp.registeredNames" : [
      "example.example1",
      "example.example2"
   ]
}

7.12.4. Test cases

This input parameter is used in the following test cases:

  • epp-19 - domain <check> command test

7.13. epp.registeredNameservers

7.13.1. Description

An array of host objects that exist in the EPP server and which are therefore unavailable for registration.

If the value of epp.hostModel is objects, this array MUST contain one member for each TLD in the TLD set. However, if it is attributes, the array MUST be empty.

7.13.2. Type

array

7.13.3. Example

{
   "epp.registeredNameservers" : [
      "ns1.example.com",
      "ns2.example.org"
   ]
}

7.13.4. Test cases

This input parameter is used in the following test cases:

  • epp-22 - host <check> command test (if applicable)

7.14. epp.restoreReportRequired

7.14.1. Description

Whether the server requires submission of a restore report when a client attempts to restore a domain.

If the value of general.gracePeriodsSupported is false, then this input parameter is ignored.

7.14.2. Type

boolean

7.14.3. Example

{
   "epp.restoreReportRequired" : false
}

7.14.4. Test cases

This input parameter is used in the following test cases:

  • epp-39 - domain restore test (if applicable)

7.15. epp.transferClid

7.15.1. Description

the username used for transfer tests

7.15.2. Type

string

7.15.3. Example

{
   "epp.transferClid" : "clid-02"
}

7.15.4. Test cases

This input parameter is used in the following test cases:

  • epp-36 - domain <transfer> command test
  • idn-03 - Level 2 variant handling test
  • idn-04 - Level 3 variant handling test

7.16. epp.transferPwd

7.16.1. Description

the password used for transfer tests

7.16.2. Type

string

7.16.3. Example

{
   "epp.transferPwd" : "foo3bar"
}

7.16.4. Test cases

This input parameter is used in the following test cases:

  • epp-36 - domain <transfer> command test
  • idn-03 - Level 2 variant handling test
  • idn-04 - Level 3 variant handling test

7.17. general.gracePeriodsSupported

7.17.1. Description

Whether or not the registry supports grace periods as defined in RFC 3915

7.17.2. Type

boolean

7.17.3. Example

{
   "general.gracePeriodsSupported" : true
}

7.17.4. Test cases

This input parameter is used in the following test cases:

  • epp-16 - <extURI> element(s) in the <greeting> **MUST** be valid
  • epp-35 - domain <renew> command test
  • epp-39 - domain restore test (if applicable)
  • srsgw-08 - Domain <delete> synchronisation

7.18. general.minimalPublicDataSet

7.18.1. Description

if true, then the registry only supports the minimum public data set, and does not collect registrant and/or technical contact information from registrars.

7.18.2. Type

boolean

7.18.3. Example

{
   "general.minimalPublicDataSet" : true
}

7.18.4. Test cases

This input parameter is used in the following test cases:

  • epp-15 - <objURI> element(s) in the <greeting> **MUST** be valid for the registry type
  • epp-16 - <extURI> element(s) in the <greeting> **MUST** be valid
  • epp-23 - contact <check> command test (if applicable for the registry type)
  • epp-24 - contact <create> command test (if applicable for the registry type)
  • epp-25 - contact <info> command test (if applicable for the registry type)
  • epp-26 - contact <update> command test (if applicable for the registry type)
  • epp-27 - contact <delete> command test (if applicable for the registry type)
  • epp-32 - domain <create> command test
  • epp-34 - domain <update> command test
  • idn-01 - Label validation test
  • idn-02 - Level 1 variant handling test
  • idn-03 - Level 2 variant handling test
  • idn-04 - Level 3 variant handling test
  • minimumRPMs-04 - Sunrise domain/launch application <create> command test
  • minimumRPMs-05 - Sunrise launch application <info> command test
  • minimumRPMs-06 - Trademark claims domain <create> command test
  • rde-05 - validate object types
  • rde-07 - validate domain objects
  • rde-09 - validate contact objects (if applicable)
  • rde-14 - validate policy object (if applicable)
  • srsgw-03 - Contact <create> synchronization (if applicable)
  • srsgw-04 - Domain <create> synchronization
  • srsgw-11 - Contact <update> synchronization (if applicable)
  • srsgw-12 - Contact <delete> synchronization (if applicable)

7.19. general.sunriseModels

7.19.1. Description

The sunrise models supported by the EPP server. The possible values for this parameter are: * start-date * end-date * both

7.19.2. Type

string

7.19.3. Example

{
   "general.sunriseModels" : "start-date"
}

7.19.4. Test cases

This input parameter is used in the following test cases:

  • minimumRPMs-04 - Sunrise domain/launch application <create> command test
  • minimumRPMs-05 - Sunrise launch application <info> command test
  • minimumRPMs-06 - Trademark claims domain <create> command test

7.20. integration.rdeSFTPDirectory

7.20.1. Description

The directory on the SFTP server where deposit files may be found.

7.20.2. Type

string

7.20.3. Example

{
   "integration.rdeSFTPDirectory" : "/path/to/deposits"
}

7.20.4. Test cases

This input parameter is used in the following test cases:

  • integration-03 - EPP -> RDE Integration Test

7.21. integration.rdeSFTPHostname

7.21.1. Description

The hostname of the operator’s SFTP server.

7.21.2. Type

string

7.21.3. Example

{
   "integration.rdeSFTPHostname" : "sftp.rsp.tech"
}

7.21.4. Test cases

This input parameter is used in the following test cases:

  • integration-03 - EPP -> RDE Integration Test

7.22. integration.rdeSFTPUsername

7.22.1. Description

The username that can be used to connect to the SFTP server.

7.22.2. Type

string

7.22.3. Example

{
   "integration.rdeSFTPUsername" : "icann"
}

7.22.4. Test cases

This input parameter is used in the following test cases:

  • integration-03 - EPP -> RDE Integration Test

7.23. integration.rriACL

7.23.1. Description

An array of IP addresses from which requests to the RRI will be sent.

7.23.2. Type

array

7.23.3. Example

{
   "integration.rriACL" : [
      "192.168.22.1",
      "2001:DB8::22:1"
   ]
}

7.23.4. Test cases

This input parameter is used in the following test cases:

  • integration-03 - EPP -> RDE Integration Test

7.24. rdap.baseURLs

7.24.1. Description

7.24.2. Type

object

7.24.3. Example

{
   "rdap.baseURLs" : {
      "example" : "https://rdap.example.com/example/"
   }
}

7.24.4. Test cases

This input parameter is used in the following test cases:

  • integration-01 - EPP -> RDAP Integration Test
  • srsgw-13 - Domain RDAP synchronization
  • srsgw-14 - Nameserver RDAP synchronization
  • srsgw-15 - Registrar RDAP synchronization

7.25. rdap.testDomains

7.25.1. Description

The domain(s) that will be queried to validate domain responses. This input parameter is an object, where the object properties are the TLD names and the values domain names.

7.25.2. Type

object

7.25.3. Example

{
   "rdap.testDomains" : {
      "example" : "example.example"
   }
}

7.25.4. Test cases

This input parameter is used in the following test cases:

  • None specified.

7.26. rdap.testEntities

7.26.1. Description

The entities(s) that will be queried to validate entity responses. This input parameter is an object, where the object properties are the TLD names and the values entity handles.

7.26.2. Type

object

7.26.3. Example

{
   "rdap.testEntities" : {
      "example" : "9999"
   }
}

7.26.4. Test cases

This input parameter is used in the following test cases:

  • None specified.

7.27. rdap.testNameservers

7.27.1. Description

The nameservers(s) that will be queried to validate nameserver responses. This input parameter is an object, where the object properties are the TLD names and the values host names.

7.27.2. Type

object

7.27.3. Example

{
   "rdap.testNameservers" : {
      "example" : "ns1.example.com"
   }
}

7.27.4. Test cases

This input parameter is used in the following test cases:

  • None specified.

7.28. rde.depositFile

7.28.1. Description

an RDE deposit file. The TLD to which the deposit relates MUST match one of the TLDs that are associated with the test object.

7.28.2. Type

file

7.28.3. Example

{
   "rde.depositFile" : "example_20231004_FULL_S1_R0.ryde"
}

7.28.4. Test cases

This input parameter is used in the following test cases:

  • rde-01 - validate deposit filename format
  • rde-02 - validate signature over deposit file
  • rde-03 - decrypt deposit file(s)
  • rde-04 - validate XML/CSV
  • rde-05 - validate object types
  • rde-06 - validate object counts
  • rde-07 - validate domain objects
  • rde-08 - validate host objects (if applicable)
  • rde-09 - validate contact objects (if applicable)
  • rde-10 - validate registrar objects
  • rde-11 - validate IDN table objects (if applicable)
  • rde-12 - validate NNDN objects

7.29. rde.publicKey

7.29.1. Description

a PGP public key block

7.29.2. Type

file

7.29.3. Example

{
   "rde.publicKey" : "rsp-rde-signing-key.asc"
}

7.29.4. Test cases

This input parameter is used in the following test cases:

  • rde-02 - validate signature over deposit file

7.30. rde.signatureFile

7.30.1. Description

an ASCII-armoured OpenPGP signature covering the deposit file

7.30.2. Type

file

7.30.3. Example

{
   "rde.signatureFile" : "example_20231004_FULL_S1_R0.sig"
}

7.30.4. Test cases

This input parameter is used in the following test cases:

  • rde-02 - validate signature over deposit file

7.31. srsgw.eppClid

7.31.1. Description

the username used to log in to the SRS Gateway EPP server

7.31.2. Type

string

7.31.3. Example

{
   "srsgw.eppClid" : "clid-01"
}

7.31.4. Test cases

  • srsgw-02 - Host <create> synchronization (if applicable)

  • srsgw-10 - Host <delete> synchronization (if applicable)
  • srsgw-11 - Contact <update> synchronization (if applicable)
  • srsgw-12 - Contact <delete> synchronization (if applicable)

the fully-qualified domain name of the SRS Gateway EPP server

string

   "srsgw.eppHostName" : "epp.rsp.tech"
}

  • srsgw-01 - IPv4 and IPv6 connectivity
  • srsgw-02 - Host <create> synchronization (if applicable)
  • srsgw-03 - Contact <create> synchronization (if applicable)

  • srsgw-07 - Domain <transfer> approval synchronisation

  • srsgw-10 - Host <delete> synchronization (if applicable)
  • srsgw-11 - Contact <update> synchronization (if applicable)
  • srsgw-12 - Contact <delete> synchronization (if applicable)

7.33.1. Description

the password used to log in to the SRS Gateway EPP server

7.33.2. Type

string

7.33.3. Example

{
   "srsgw.eppPwd" : "foo2bar"
}

  • srsgw-02 - Host <create> synchronization (if applicable)

}

7.36. srsgw.rdapBaseURLs

7.36.1. Description

The RDAP base URL(s) for the TLD(s). This input parameter is an object, where the object properties are the TLD names and the values are strings containing the base URL. The URL MUST end with a slash (“/”).

7.36.2. Type

object

7.36.3. Example

{
   "srsgw.rdapBaseURLs" : {
      "example" : "https://rdap.example.com/example/"
   }
}

7.36.4. Test cases

This input parameter is used in the following test cases:

  • srsgw-13 - Domain RDAP synchronization
  • srsgw-14 - Nameserver RDAP synchronization
  • srsgw-15 - Registrar RDAP synchronization

8. Errors

8.1. DNSSEC_DNS_QUERY_ERROR

8.1.1. Severity

ERROR

8.1.2. Description

An error occurred while performing DNS query(s).

8.2. DNSSEC_INVALID_DIGEST_ALGORITHM

8.2.1. Severity

ERROR

8.2.2. Description

An invalid algorithm is used in the provided DS record(s).

8.3. DNSSEC_INVALID_SIGNING_ALGORITHM

8.3.1. Severity

ERROR

8.3.2. Description

An invalid algorithm is used to sign the zone.

8.4. EPP_CONNECT_ERROR

8.4.1. Severity

ERROR

8.4.2. Description

The client was unable to successfully connect to the EPP serer.

8.5. EPP_GENERIC_COMMAND_ERROR

8.5.1. Severity

ERROR

8.5.2. Description

The client received a 2400 error from the server.

8.6. EPP_LOGIN_ERROR

8.6.1. Severity

ERROR

8.6.2. Description

The client was unable to successfullt authenticate with the EPP server.

8.7. EPP_SCHEMA_VALIDATION_ERROR

8.7.1. Severity

ERROR

8.7.2. Description

The response from the server failed schema validation.

8.8. EPP_SUNRISE_AVAILABILITY_CHECK_INVALID_RESULT

8.8.1. Severity

ERROR

8.8.2. Description

The response to a sunrise availability check command contained an invalid value in the avail attribute.

8.9. ZM_AAAA_BAD_RDATA

8.9.1. Severity

ERROR

8.9.2. Description

Not available.

8.10. ZM_AAAA_QUERY_DROPPED

8.10.1. Severity

ERROR

8.10.2. Description

Not available.

8.11. ZM_AAAA_UNEXPECTED_RCODE

8.11.1. Severity

ERROR

8.11.2. Description

Not available.

8.12. ZM_AAAA_WELL_PROCESSED

8.12.1. Severity

INFO

8.12.2. Description

Not available.

8.13. ZM_ADDRESSES_MATCH

8.13.1. Severity

INFO

8.13.2. Description

Not available.

8.14. ZM_ALGORITHM_DEPRECATED

8.14.1. Severity

ERROR

8.14.2. Description

Not available.

8.15. ZM_ALGORITHM_NOT_RECOMMENDED

8.15.1. Severity

WARNING

8.15.2. Description

Not available.

8.16. ZM_ALGORITHM_NOT_ZONE_SIGN

8.16.1. Severity

ERROR

8.16.2. Description

Not available.

8.17. ZM_ALGORITHM_OK

8.17.1. Severity

INFO

8.17.2. Description

Not available.

8.18. ZM_ALGORITHM_PRIVATE

8.18.1. Severity

ERROR

8.18.2. Description

Not available.

8.19. ZM_ALGORITHM_RESERVED

8.19.1. Severity

ERROR

8.19.2. Description

Not available.

8.20. ZM_ALGORITHM_UNASSIGNED

8.20.1. Severity

ERROR

8.20.2. Description

Not available.

8.21. ZM_A_UNEXPECTED_RCODE

8.21.1. Severity

ERROR

8.21.2. Description

Not available.

8.22. ZM_BREAKS_ON_EDNS

8.22.1. Severity

ERROR

8.22.2. Description

Not available.

8.23. ZM_CHILD_DISTINCT_NS_IP

8.23.1. Severity

INFO

8.23.2. Description

Not available.

8.24. ZM_CHILD_NS_FAILED

8.24.1. Severity

ERROR

8.24.2. Description

Not available.

8.25. ZM_CHILD_NS_SAME_IP

8.25.1. Severity

ERROR

8.25.2. Description

Not available.

8.26. ZM_CHILD_ZONE_LAME

8.26.1. Severity

ERROR

8.26.2. Description

Not available.

8.27. ZM_CN01_IPV4_DISABLED

8.27.1. Severity

NOTICE

8.27.2. Description

IPv4 is disabled. No DNS queries are sent to these name servers: “{ns_list}”.

8.28. ZM_CN01_IPV6_DISABLED

8.28.1. Severity

NOTICE

8.28.2. Description

IPv6 is disabled. No DNS queries are sent to these name servers: “{ns_list}”.

8.29. ZM_CN01_MISSING_NS_RECORD_UDP

8.29.1. Severity

ERROR

8.29.2. Description

Nameserver {ns} reponds to a NS query with no NS records in the answer section over UDP.

8.30. ZM_CN01_MISSING_SOA_RECORD_UDP

8.30.1. Severity

ERROR

8.30.2. Description

Nameserver {ns} reponds to a SOA query with no SOA records in the answer section over UDP.

8.31. ZM_CN01_NO_RESPONSE_NS_QUERY_UDP

8.31.1. Severity

ERROR

8.31.2. Description

Nameserver {ns} does not respond to NS queries over UDP.

8.32. ZM_CN01_NO_RESPONSE_SOA_QUERY_UDP

8.32.1. Severity

ERROR

8.32.2. Description

Nameserver {ns} does not respond to SOA queries over UDP.

8.33. ZM_CN01_NO_RESPONSE_UDP

8.33.1. Severity

ERROR

8.33.2. Description

Nameserver {ns} does not respond to any queries over UDP.

8.34. ZM_CN01_NS_RECORD_NOT_AA_UDP

8.34.1. Severity

ERROR

8.34.2. Description

Nameserver {ns} does not give an authoritative response on an NS query over UDP.

8.35. ZM_CN01_SOA_RECORD_NOT_AA_UDP

8.35.1. Severity

ERROR

8.35.2. Description

Nameserver {ns} does not give an authoritative response on an SOA query over UDP.

8.36. ZM_CN01_UNEXPECTED_RCODE_NS_QUERY_UDP

8.36.1. Severity

ERROR

8.36.2. Description

Nameserver {ns} responds with an unexpected RCODE ({rcode}) on an NS query over UDP.

8.37. ZM_CN01_UNEXPECTED_RCODE_SOA_QUERY_UDP

8.37.1. Severity

ERROR

8.37.2. Description

Nameserver {ns} responds with an unexpected RCODE ({rcode}) on an SOA query over UDP.

8.38. ZM_CN01_WRONG_NS_RECORD_UDP

8.38.1. Severity

ERROR

8.38.2. Description

Nameserver {ns} responds with a wrong owner name ({domain_found} instead of {domain_expected}) on NS queries over UDP.

8.39. ZM_CN01_WRONG_SOA_RECORD_UDP

8.39.1. Severity

ERROR

8.39.2. Description

Nameserver {ns} responds with a wrong owner name ({domain_found} instead of {domain_expected}) on SOA queries over UDP.

8.40. ZM_CN02_MISSING_NS_RECORD_TCP

8.40.1. Severity

ERROR

8.40.2. Description

Nameserver {ns} reponds to a NS query with no NS records in the answer section over TCP.

8.41. ZM_CN02_MISSING_SOA_RECORD_TCP

8.41.1. Severity

ERROR

8.41.2. Description

Nameserver {ns} reponds to a SOA query with no SOA records in the answer section over TCP.

8.42. ZM_CN02_NO_RESPONSE_NS_QUERY_TCP

8.42.1. Severity

ERROR

8.42.2. Description

Nameserver {ns} does not respond to NS queries over TCP.

8.43. ZM_CN02_NO_RESPONSE_SOA_QUERY_TCP

8.43.1. Severity

ERROR

8.43.2. Description

Nameserver {ns} does not respond to SOA queries over TCP.

8.44. ZM_CN02_NO_RESPONSE_TCP

8.44.1. Severity

ERROR

8.44.2. Description

Nameserver {ns} does not respond to any queries over TCP.

8.45. ZM_CN02_NS_RECORD_NOT_AA_TCP

8.45.1. Severity

ERROR

8.45.2. Description

Nameserver {ns} does not give an authoritative response on an NS query over TCP.

8.46.1. Severity

ERROR

8.46.2. Description

Nameserver {ns} does not give an authoritative response on an SOA query over TCP.

8.47.1. Severity

ERROR

8.47.2. Description

Nameserver {ns} responds with an unexpected RCODE ({rcode}) on an NS query over TCP.

8.48.1. Severity

ERROR

8.48.2. Description

Nameserver {ns} responds with an unexpected RCODE ({rcode}) on an SOA query over TCP.

8.49. ZM_CN02_WRONG_NS_RECORD_TCP

8.49.1. Severity

ERROR

8.49.2. Description

Nameserver {ns} responds with a wrong owner name ({domain_found} instead of {domain_expected}) on NS queries over TCP.

8.50.1. Severity

ERROR

8.50.2. Description

ERROR

8.52.2. Description

8.67. ZM_DS02_ALGO_NOT_SUPPORTED_BY_ZM

8.67.1. Severity

NOTICE

8.67.2. Description

DNSKEY with tag {keytag} uses unsupported algorithm {algo_num} ({algo_mnemo}) by this installation of Zonemaster. Fetched from the nameservers with IP addresses “{ns_ip_list}”.

8.68. ZM_DS02_DNSKEY_NOT_FOR_ZONE_SIGNING

8.68.1. Severity

ERROR

8.68.2. Description

Flags field of DNSKEY record with tag {keytag} does not have ZONE bit set although DS with same tag is present in parent. Fetched from the nameservers with IP addresses “{ns_ip_list}”.

8.69. ZM_DS02_DNSKEY_NOT_SEP

8.69.1. Severity

ERROR

8.69.2. Description

Flags field of DNSKEY record with tag {keytag} does not have SEP bit set although DS with same tag is present in parent. Fetched from the nameservers with IP addresses “{ns_ip_list}”.

8.70.1. Severity

ERROR

8.70.2. Description

The DNSKEY RRset has not been signed by any DNSKEY matched by a DS record. Fetched from the nameservers with IP addresses “{ns_ip_list}”.

8.71. ZM_DS02_NO_DNSKEY_FOR_DS

8.71.1. Severity

ERROR

8.71.2. Description

The DNSKEY record with tag {keytag} that the DS refers to does not exist in the DNSKEY RRset. Fetched from the nameservers with IP “{ns_ip_list}”.

ERROR

8.72.2. Description

The DNSKEY RRset is not signed by the DNSKEY with tag {keytag} that the DS record refers to. Fetched from the nameservers with IP “{ns_ip_list}”.

8.73.1. Severity

ERROR

8.73.2. Description

The DS record does not match the DNSKEY with tag {keytag} by algorithm or digest. Fetched from the nameservers with IP “{ns_ip_list}”.

ERROR

8.74.2. Description

There is no valid DNSKEY matched by any of the DS records. Fetched from the nameservers with IP addresses “{ns_ip_list}”.

ERROR

8.75.2. Description

8.215. ZM_WRONG_SOA

8.215.1. Severity

ERROR

8.215.2. Description

Not available.

8.216. ZM_Z01_MNAME_HAS_LOCALHOST_ADDR

8.216.1. Severity

WARNING

8.216.2. Description

SOA MNAME name server “{nsname}” resolves to a localhost IP address ({ns_ip}).

8.217. ZM_Z01_MNAME_IS_DOT

8.217.1. Severity

NOTICE

8.217.2. Description

SOA MNAME is specified as “.” which usually means “no server”. Fetched from name servers “{ns_ip_list}”.

8.218. ZM_Z01_MNAME_IS_LOCALHOST

8.218.1. Severity

WARNING

8.218.2. Description

SOA MNAME name server is “localhost”, which is invalid. Fetched from name servers “{ns_ip_list}”.

8.219. ZM_Z01_MNAME_MISSING_SOA_RECORD

8.219.1. Severity

WARNING

8.219.2. Description

SOA MNAME name server “{ns}” reponds to an SOA query with no SOA records in the answer section.

8.220. ZM_Z01_MNAME_NOT_AUTHORITATIVE

8.220.1. Severity

WARNING

8.220.2. Description

SOA MNAME name server “{ns}” is not authoritative for the zone.

8.221. ZM_Z01_MNAME_NOT_IN_NS_LIST

8.221.1. Severity

INFO

8.221.2. Description

SOA MNAME name server “{nsname}” is not listed as NS record for the zone.

8.222. ZM_Z01_MNAME_NOT_MASTER

8.222.1. Severity

WARNING

8.222.2. Description

SOA MNAME name server(s) “{ns_list}” do(es) not have the highest SOA SERIAL (expected “{soaserial}” but got “{soaserial_list}”)

8.223. ZM_Z01_MNAME_NOT_RESOLVE

8.223.1. Severity

WARNING

8.223.2. Description

SOA MNAME name server “{nsname}” cannot be resolved into an IP address.

8.224. ZM_Z01_MNAME_NO_RESPONSE

8.224.1. Severity

WARNING

8.224.2. Description

SOA MNAME name server “{ns}” does not respond to an SOA query.

8.225. ZM_Z01_MNAME_UNEXPECTED_RCODE

8.225.1. Severity

WARNING

8.225.2. Description

SOA MNAME name server “{ns}” gives unexpected RCODE name (“{rcode}”) in response to an SOA query.

8.226. ZM_Z_FLAGS_NOTCLEAR

8.226.1. Severity

ERROR

8.226.2. Description

Not available.

9. About this document

This document was automatically generated from the formal specification for the RST system, which is available in YAML and JSON formats.

The schema for the formal specification can be found in Schema.md. The YAML file is the normative reference, other representations are informational only.

ICANN welcomes feedback and contributions from the community. Interested parties are encouraged to fork the repository and submit a pull request.

Copyright 2023 Internet Corporation for Assigned Names and Numbers (ICANN).
